2611 rdev = conf->disks[i].replacement;
2612 if (rdev)
2613 replacement = 1;
2614 else
2615 /* rdev was removed and 'replacement'
2616 * replaced it. rdev is not removed
2617 * until all requests are finished.
2618 */
2619 rdev = conf->disks[i].rdev;
2620 break;
2621 }
2622 }
2623 pr_debug("end_write_request %llu/%d, count %d, error: %d.\n",
2624 (unsigned long long)sh->sector, i, atomic_read(&sh->count),
2625 bi->bi_status);
2626 if (i == disks) {
2627 bio_reset(bi);
2628 BUG();
2629 return;
2630 }
2631
2632 if (replacement) {
2633 if (bi->bi_status)
2634 md_error(conf->mddev, rdev);
2635 else if (is_badblock(rdev, sh->sector,
2636 STRIPE_SECTORS,
2637 &first_bad, &bad_sectors))
2638 set_bit(R5_MadeGoodRepl, &sh->dev[i].flags);
2639 } else {
2640 if (bi->bi_status) {
2641 set_bit(STRIPE_DEGRADED, &sh->state);
2642 set_bit(WriteErrorSeen, &rdev->flags);
2643 set_bit(R5_WriteError, &sh->dev[i].flags);
2644 if (!test_and_set_bit(WantReplacement, &rdev->flags))
2645 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED,
2646 &rdev->mddev->recovery);
2647 } else if (is_badblock(rdev, sh->sector,
2648 STRIPE_SECTORS,
2649 &first_bad, &bad_sectors)) {
2650 set_bit(R5_MadeGood, &sh->dev[i].flags);
2651 if (test_bit(R5_ReadError, &sh->dev[i].flags))
2652 /* That was a successful write so make
2653 * sure it looks like we already did
2654 * a re-write.
2655 */
2656 set_bit(R5_ReWrite, &sh->dev[i].flags);
2657 }
2658 }
2659 rdev_dec_pending(rdev, conf->mddev);
2660
2661 if (sh->batch_head && bi->bi_status && !replacement)
2662 set_bit(STRIPE_BATCH_ERR, &sh->batch_head->state);
2663
2664 bio_reset(bi);
2665 if (!test_and_clear_bit(R5_DOUBLE_LOCKED, &sh->dev[i].flags))
2666 clear_bit(R5_LOCKED, &sh->dev[i].flags);
2667 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
2668 raid5_release_stripe(sh);
2669
2670 if (sh->batch_head && sh != sh->batch_head)
2671 raid5_release_stripe(sh->batch_head);
2672}
2673
2674static void raid5_error(struct mddev *mddev, struct md_rdev *rdev)
2675{
2676 char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
2677 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
2678 unsigned long flags;
2679 pr_debug("raid456: error called\n");
2680
2681 spin_lock_irqsave(&conf->device_lock, flags);
2682 set_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags);
2683 clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
2684 mddev->degraded = raid5_calc_degraded(conf);
2685 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&conf->device_lock, flags);
2686 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery);
2687
2688 set_bit(Blocked, &rdev->flags);
2689 set_mask_bits(&mddev->sb_flags, 0,
2690 BIT(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS) | BIT(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING));
2691 pr_crit("md/raid:%s: Disk failure on %s, disabling device.\n"
2692 "md/raid:%s: Operation continuing on %d devices.\n",
2693 mdname(mddev),
2694 bdevname(rdev->bdev, b),
2695 mdname(mddev),
2696 conf->raid_disks - mddev->degraded);
2697 r5c_update_on_rdev_error(mddev, rdev);
2698}
2699
2700/*
2701 * Input: a 'big' sector number,
2702 * Output: index of the data and parity disk, and the sector # in them.
2703 */
2704sector_t raid5_compute_sector(struct r5conf *conf, sector_t r_sector,
2705 int previous, int *dd_idx,
2706 struct stripe_head *sh)
2707{
2708 sector_t stripe, stripe2;
2709 sector_t chunk_number;
2710 unsigned int chunk_offset;
2711 int pd_idx, qd_idx;
2712 int ddf_layout = 0;
2713 sector_t new_sector;
2714 int algorithm = previous ? conf->prev_algo
2715 : conf->algorithm;
2716 int sectors_per_chunk = previous ? conf->prev_chunk_sectors
2717 : conf->chunk_sectors;
2718 int raid_disks = previous ? conf->previous_raid_disks
2719 : conf->raid_disks;
2720 int data_disks = raid_disks - conf->max_degraded;
2721
2722 /* First compute the information on this sector */
2723
2724 /*
2725 * Compute the chunk number and the sector offset inside the chunk
2726 */
2727 chunk_offset = sector_div(r_sector, sectors_per_chunk);
2728 chunk_number = r_sector;
2729
2730 /*
2731 * Compute the stripe number
2732 */
2733 stripe = chunk_number;
2734 *dd_idx = sector_div(stripe, data_disks);
2735 stripe2 = stripe;
2736 /*
2737 * Select the parity disk based on the user selected algorithm.
2738 */
2739 pd_idx = qd_idx = -1;
2740 switch(conf->level) {
2741 case 4:
2742 pd_idx = data_disks;
2743 break;
2744 case 5:
2745 switch (algorithm) {
2746 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC:
2747 pd_idx = data_disks - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
2748 if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
2749 (*dd_idx)++;
2750 break;
2751 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC:
2752 pd_idx = sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
2753 if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
2754 (*dd_idx)++;
2755 break;
2756 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC:
2757 pd_idx = data_disks - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
2758 *dd_idx = (pd_idx + 1 + *dd_idx) % raid_disks;
2759 break;
2760 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC:
2761 pd_idx = sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
2762 *dd_idx = (pd_idx + 1 + *dd_idx) % raid_disks;
2763 break;
2764 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0:
2765 pd_idx = 0;
2766 (*dd_idx)++;
2767 break;
2768 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_N:
2769 pd_idx = data_disks;
2770 break;
2771 default:
2772 BUG();
2773 }
2774 break;
2775 case 6:
2776
2777 switch (algorithm) {
2778 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC:
2779 pd_idx = raid_disks - 1 - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
2780 qd_idx = pd_idx + 1;
2781 if (pd_idx == raid_disks-1) {
2782 (*dd_idx)++; /* Q D D D P */
2783 qd_idx = 0;
2784 } else if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
2785 (*dd_idx) += 2; /* D D P Q D */
2786 break;
2787 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC:
2788 pd_idx = sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
2789 qd_idx = pd_idx + 1;
2790 if (pd_idx == raid_disks-1) {
2791 (*dd_idx)++; /* Q D D D P */
2792 qd_idx = 0;
2793 } else if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
2794 (*dd_idx) += 2; /* D D P Q D */
2795 break;
2796 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC:
2797 pd_idx = raid_disks - 1 - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
2798 qd_idx = (pd_idx + 1) % raid_disks;
2799 *dd_idx = (pd_idx + 2 + *dd_idx) % raid_disks;
2800 break;
2801 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC:
2802 pd_idx = sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
2803 qd_idx = (pd_idx + 1) % raid_disks;
2804 *dd_idx = (pd_idx + 2 + *dd_idx) % raid_disks;
2805 break;
2806
2807 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0:
2808 pd_idx = 0;
2809 qd_idx = 1;
2810 (*dd_idx) += 2;
2811 break;
2812 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_N:
2813 pd_idx = data_disks;
2814 qd_idx = data_disks + 1;
2815 break;
2816
2817 case ALGORITHM_ROTATING_ZERO_RESTART:
2818 /* Exactly the same as RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC, but or
2819 * of blocks for computing Q is different.
2820 */
2821 pd_idx = sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
2822 qd_idx = pd_idx + 1;
2823 if (pd_idx == raid_disks-1) {
2824 (*dd_idx)++; /* Q D D D P */
2825 qd_idx = 0;
2826 } else if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
2827 (*dd_idx) += 2; /* D D P Q D */
2828 ddf_layout = 1;
2829 break;
2830
2831 case ALGORITHM_ROTATING_N_RESTART:
2832 /* Same a left_asymmetric, by first stripe is
2833 * D D D P Q rather than
2834 * Q D D D P
2835 */
2836 stripe2 += 1;
2837 pd_idx = raid_disks - 1 - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
2838 qd_idx = pd_idx + 1;
2839 if (pd_idx == raid_disks-1) {
2840 (*dd_idx)++; /* Q D D D P */
2841 qd_idx = 0;
2842 } else if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
2843 (*dd_idx) += 2; /* D D P Q D */
2844 ddf_layout = 1;
2845 break;
2846
2847 case ALGORITHM_ROTATING_N_CONTINUE:
2848 /* Same as left_symmetric but Q is before P */
2849 pd_idx = raid_disks - 1 - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
2850 qd_idx = (pd_idx + raid_disks - 1) % raid_disks;
2851 *dd_idx = (pd_idx + 1 + *dd_idx) % raid_disks;
2852 ddf_layout = 1;
2853 break;
2854
2855 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
2856 /* RAID5 left_asymmetric, with Q on last device */
2857 pd_idx = data_disks - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks-1);
2858 if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
2859 (*dd_idx)++;
2860 qd_idx = raid_disks - 1;
2861 break;
2862
2863 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
2864 pd_idx = sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks-1);
2865 if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
2866 (*dd_idx)++;
2867 qd_idx = raid_disks - 1;
2868 break;
2869
2870 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC_6:
2871 pd_idx = data_disks - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks-1);
2872 *dd_idx = (pd_idx + 1 + *dd_idx) % (raid_disks-1);
2873 qd_idx = raid_disks - 1;
2874 break;
2875
2876 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC_6:
2877 pd_idx = sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks-1);
2878 *dd_idx = (pd_idx + 1 + *dd_idx) % (raid_disks-1);
2879 qd_idx = raid_disks - 1;
2880 break;
2881
2882 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0_6:
2883 pd_idx = 0;
2884 (*dd_idx)++;
2885 qd_idx = raid_disks - 1;
2886 break;
2887
2888 default:
2889 BUG();
2890 }
2891 break;
2892 }
2893
2894 if (sh) {
2895 sh->pd_idx = pd_idx;
2896 sh->qd_idx = qd_idx;
2897 sh->ddf_layout = ddf_layout;
2898 }
2899 /*
2900 * Finally, compute the new sector number
2901 */
2902 new_sector = (sector_t)stripe * sectors_per_chunk + chunk_offset;
2903 return new_sector;
2904}
2905
2906sector_t raid5_compute_blocknr(struct stripe_head *sh, int i, int previous)
2907{
2908 struct r5conf *conf = sh->raid_conf;
2909 int raid_disks = sh->disks;
2910 int data_disks = raid_disks - conf->max_degraded;
2911 sector_t new_sector = sh->sector, check;
2912 int sectors_per_chunk = previous ? conf->prev_chunk_sectors
2913 : conf->chunk_sectors;
2914 int algorithm = previous ? conf->prev_algo
2915 : conf->algorithm;
2916 sector_t stripe;
2917 int chunk_offset;
2918 sector_t chunk_number;
2919 int dummy1, dd_idx = i;
2920 sector_t r_sector;
2921 struct stripe_head sh2;
2922
2923 chunk_offset = sector_div(new_sector, sectors_per_chunk);
2924 stripe = new_sector;
2925
2926 if (i == sh->pd_idx)
2927 return 0;
2928 switch(conf->level) {
2929 case 4: break;
2930 case 5:
2931 switch (algorithm) {
2932 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC:
2933 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC:
2934 if (i > sh->pd_idx)
2935 i--;
2936 break;
2937 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC:
2938 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC:
2939 if (i < sh->pd_idx)
2940 i += raid_disks;
2941 i -= (sh->pd_idx + 1);
2942 break;
2943 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0:
2944 i -= 1;
2945 break;
2946 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_N:
2947 break;
2948 default:
2949 BUG();
2950 }
2951 break;
2952 case 6:
2953 if (i == sh->qd_idx)
2954 return 0; /* It is the Q disk */
2955 switch (algorithm) {
2956 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC:
2957 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC:
2958 case ALGORITHM_ROTATING_ZERO_RESTART:
2959 case ALGORITHM_ROTATING_N_RESTART:
2960 if (sh->pd_idx == raid_disks-1)
2961 i--; /* Q D D D P */
2962 else if (i > sh->pd_idx)
2963 i -= 2; /* D D P Q D */
2964 break;
2965 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC:
2966 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC:
2967 if (sh->pd_idx == raid_disks-1)
2968 i--; /* Q D D D P */
2969 else {
2970 /* D D P Q D */
2971 if (i < sh->pd_idx)
2972 i += raid_disks;
2973 i -= (sh->pd_idx + 2);
2974 }
2975 break;
2976 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0:
2977 i -= 2;
2978 break;
2979 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_N:
2980 break;
2981 case ALGORITHM_ROTATING_N_CONTINUE:
2982 /* Like left_symmetric, but P is before Q */
2983 if (sh->pd_idx == 0)
2984 i--; /* P D D D Q */
2985 else {
2986 /* D D Q P D */
2987 if (i < sh->pd_idx)
2988 i += raid_disks;
2989 i -= (sh->pd_idx + 1);
2990 }
2991 break;
2992 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
2993 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
2994 if (i > sh->pd_idx)
2995 i--;
2996 break;
2997 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC_6:
2998 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC_6:
2999 if (i < sh->pd_idx)
3000 i += data_disks + 1;
3001 i -= (sh->pd_idx + 1);
3002 break;
3003 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0_6:
3004 i -= 1;
3005 break;
3006 default:
3007 BUG();
3008 }
3009 break;
3010 }
3011
3012 chunk_number = stripe * data_disks + i;
3013 r_sector = chunk_number * sectors_per_chunk + chunk_offset;
3014
3015 check = raid5_compute_sector(conf, r_sector,
3016 previous, &dummy1, &sh2);
3017 if (check != sh->sector || dummy1 != dd_idx || sh2.pd_idx != sh->pd_idx
3018 || sh2.qd_idx != sh->qd_idx) {
3019 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: compute_blocknr: map not correct\n",
3020 mdname(conf->mddev));
3021 return 0;
3022 }
3023 return r_sector;
3024}
3025
3026/*
3027 * There are cases where we want handle_stripe_dirtying() and
3028 * schedule_reconstruction() to delay towrite to some dev of a stripe.
3029 *
3030 * This function checks whether we want to delay the towrite. Specifically,
3031 * we delay the towrite when:
3032 *
3033 * 1. degraded stripe has a non-overwrite to the missing dev, AND this
3034 * stripe has data in journal (for other devices).
3035 *
3036 * In this case, when reading data for the non-overwrite dev, it is
3037 * necessary to handle complex rmw of write back cache (prexor with
3038 * orig_page, and xor with page). To keep read path simple, we would
3039 * like to flush data in journal to RAID disks first, so complex rmw
3040 * is handled in the write patch (handle_stripe_dirtying).
3041 *
3042 * 2. when journal space is critical (R5C_LOG_CRITICAL=1)
3043 *
3044 * It is important to be able to flush all stripes in raid5-cache.
3045 * Therefore, we need reserve some space on the journal device for
3046 * these flushes. If flush operation includes pending writes to the
3047 * stripe, we need to reserve (conf->raid_disk + 1) pages per stripe
3048 * for the flush out. If we exclude these pending writes from flush
3049 * operation, we only need (conf->max_degraded + 1) pages per stripe.
3050 * Therefore, excluding pending writes in these cases enables more
3051 * efficient use of the journal device.
3052 *
3053 * Note: To make sure the stripe makes progress, we only delay
3054 * towrite for stripes with data already in journal (injournal > 0).
3055 * When LOG_CRITICAL, stripes with injournal == 0 will be sent to
3056 * no_space_stripes list.
3057 *
3058 * 3. during journal failure
3059 * In journal failure, we try to flush all cached data to raid disks
3060 * based on data in stripe cache. The array is read-only to upper
3061 * layers, so we would skip all pending writes.
3062 *
3063 */
3064static inline bool delay_towrite(struct r5conf *conf,
3065 struct r5dev *dev,
3066 struct stripe_head_state *s)
3067{
3068 /* case 1 above */
3069 if (!test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &dev->flags) &&
3070 !test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags) && s->injournal)
3071 return true;
3072 /* case 2 above */
3073 if (test_bit(R5C_LOG_CRITICAL, &conf->cache_state) &&
3074 s->injournal > 0)
3075 return true;
3076 /* case 3 above */
3077 if (s->log_failed && s->injournal)
3078 return true;
3079 return false;
3080}
3081
3082static void
3083schedule_reconstruction(struct stripe_head *sh, struct stripe_head_state *s,
3084 int rcw, int expand)
3085{
3086 int i, pd_idx = sh->pd_idx, qd_idx = sh->qd_idx, disks = sh->disks;
3087 struct r5conf *conf = sh->raid_conf;
3088 int level = conf->level;
3089
3090 if (rcw) {
3091 /*
3092 * In some cases, handle_stripe_dirtying initially decided to
3093 * run rmw and allocates extra page for prexor. However, rcw is
3094 * cheaper later on. We need to free the extra page now,
3095 * because we won't be able to do that in ops_complete_prexor().
3096 */
3097 r5c_release_extra_page(sh);
3098
3099 for (i = disks; i--; ) {
3100 struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
3101
3102 if (dev->towrite && !delay_towrite(conf, dev, s)) {
3103 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
3104 set_bit(R5_Wantdrain, &dev->flags);
3105 if (!expand)
3106 clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags);
3107 s->locked++;
3108 } else if (test_bit(R5_InJournal, &dev->flags)) {
3109 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
3110 s->locked++;
3111 }
3112 }
3113 /* if we are not expanding this is a proper write request, and
3114 * there will be bios with new data to be drained into the
3115 * stripe cache
3116 */
3117 if (!expand) {
3118 if (!s->locked)
3119 /* False alarm, nothing to do */
3120 return;
3121 sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_drain_run;
3122 set_bit(STRIPE_OP_BIODRAIN, &s->ops_request);
3123 } else
3124 sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_run;
3125
3126 set_bit(STRIPE_OP_RECONSTRUCT, &s->ops_request);
3127
3128 if (s->locked + conf->max_degraded == disks)
3129 if (!test_and_set_bit(STRIPE_FULL_WRITE, &sh->state))
3130 atomic_inc(&conf->pending_full_writes);
3131 } else {
3132 BUG_ON(!(test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[pd_idx].flags) ||
3133 test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &sh->dev[pd_idx].flags)));
3134 BUG_ON(level == 6 &&
3135 (!(test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[qd_idx].flags) ||
3136 test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &sh->dev[qd_idx].flags))));
3137
3138 for (i = disks; i--; ) {
3139 struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
3140 if (i == pd_idx || i == qd_idx)
3141 continue;
3142
3143 if (dev->towrite &&
3144 (test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) ||
3145 test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags))) {
3146 set_bit(R5_Wantdrain, &dev->flags);
3147 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
3148 clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags);
3149 s->locked++;
3150 } else if (test_bit(R5_InJournal, &dev->flags)) {
3151 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
3152 s->locked++;
3153 }
3154 }
3155 if (!s->locked)
3156 /* False alarm - nothing to do */
3157 return;
3158 sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_prexor_drain_run;
3159 set_bit(STRIPE_OP_PREXOR, &s->ops_request);
3160 set_bit(STRIPE_OP_BIODRAIN, &s->ops_request);
3161 set_bit(STRIPE_OP_RECONSTRUCT, &s->ops_request);
3162 }
3163
3164 /* keep the parity disk(s) locked while asynchronous operations
3165 * are in flight
3166 */
3167 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &sh->dev[pd_idx].flags);
3168 clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[pd_idx].flags);
3169 s->locked++;
3170
3171 if (level == 6) {
3172 int qd_idx = sh->qd_idx;
3173 struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[qd_idx];
3174
3175 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
3176 clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags);
3177 s->locked++;
3178 }
3179
3180 if (raid5_has_ppl(sh->raid_conf) && sh->ppl_page &&
3181 test_bit(STRIPE_OP_BIODRAIN, &s->ops_request) &&
3182 !test_bit(STRIPE_FULL_WRITE, &sh->state) &&
3183 test_bit(R5_Insync, &sh->dev[pd_idx].flags))
3184 set_bit(STRIPE_OP_PARTIAL_PARITY, &s->ops_request);
3185
3186 pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu locked: %d ops_request: %lx\n",
3187 __func__, (unsigned long long)sh->sector,
3188 s->locked, s->ops_request);
3189}
3190
3191/*
3192 * Each stripe/dev can have one or more bion attached.
3193 * toread/towrite point to the first in a chain.
3194 * The bi_next chain must be in order.
3195 */
3196static int add_stripe_bio(struct stripe_head *sh, struct bio *bi, int dd_idx,
3197 int forwrite, int previous)
3198{
3199 struct bio **bip;
3200 struct r5conf *conf = sh->raid_conf;
3201 int firstwrite=0;
3202
3203 pr_debug("adding bi b#%llu to stripe s#%llu\n",
3204 (unsigned long long)bi->bi_iter.bi_sector,
3205 (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
3206
3207 spin_lock_irq(&sh->stripe_lock);
3208 /* Don't allow new IO added to stripes in batch list */
3209 if (sh->batch_head)
3210 goto overlap;
3211 if (forwrite) {
3212 bip = &sh->dev[dd_idx].towrite;
3213 if (*bip == NULL)
3214 firstwrite = 1;
3215 } else
3216 bip = &sh->dev[dd_idx].toread;
3217 while (*bip && (*bip)->bi_iter.bi_sector < bi->bi_iter.bi_sector) {
3218 if (bio_end_sector(*bip) > bi->bi_iter.bi_sector)
3219 goto overlap;
3220 bip = & (*bip)->bi_next;
3221 }
3222 if (*bip && (*bip)->bi_iter.bi_sector < bio_end_sector(bi))
3223 goto overlap;
3224
3225 if (forwrite && raid5_has_ppl(conf)) {
3226 /*
3227 * With PPL only writes to consecutive data chunks within a
3228 * stripe are allowed because for a single stripe_head we can
3229 * only have one PPL entry at a time, which describes one data
3230 * range. Not really an overlap, but wait_for_overlap can be
3231 * used to handle this.
3232 */
3233 sector_t sector;
3234 sector_t first = 0;
3235 sector_t last = 0;
3236 int count = 0;
3237 int i;
3238
3239 for (i = 0; i < sh->disks; i++) {
3240 if (i != sh->pd_idx &&
3241 (i == dd_idx || sh->dev[i].towrite)) {
3242 sector = sh->dev[i].sector;
3243 if (count == 0 || sector < first)
3244 first = sector;
3245 if (sector > last)
3246 last = sector;
3247 count++;
3248 }
3249 }
3250
3251 if (first + conf->chunk_sectors * (count - 1) != last)
3252 goto overlap;
3253 }
3254
3255 if (!forwrite || previous)
3256 clear_bit(STRIPE_BATCH_READY, &sh->state);
3257
3258 BUG_ON(*bip && bi->bi_next && (*bip) != bi->bi_next);
3259 if (*bip)
3260 bi->bi_next = *bip;
3261 *bip = bi;
3262 bio_inc_remaining(bi);
3263 md_write_inc(conf->mddev, bi);
3264
3265 if (forwrite) {
3266 /* check if page is covered */
3267 sector_t sector = sh->dev[dd_idx].sector;
3268 for (bi=sh->dev[dd_idx].towrite;
3269 sector < sh->dev[dd_idx].sector + STRIPE_SECTORS &&
3270 bi && bi->bi_iter.bi_sector <= sector;
3271 bi = r5_next_bio(bi, sh->dev[dd_idx].sector)) {
3272 if (bio_end_sector(bi) >= sector)
3273 sector = bio_end_sector(bi);
3274 }
3275 if (sector >= sh->dev[dd_idx].sector + STRIPE_SECTORS)
3276 if (!test_and_set_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &sh->dev[dd_idx].flags))
3277 sh->overwrite_disks++;
3278 }
3279
3280 pr_debug("added bi b#%llu to stripe s#%llu, disk %d.\n",
3281 (unsigned long long)(*bip)->bi_iter.bi_sector,
3282 (unsigned long long)sh->sector, dd_idx);
3283
3284 if (conf->mddev->bitmap && firstwrite) {
3285 /* Cannot hold spinlock over bitmap_startwrite,
3286 * but must ensure this isn't added to a batch until
3287 * we have added to the bitmap and set bm_seq.
3288 * So set STRIPE_BITMAP_PENDING to prevent
3289 * batching.
3290 * If multiple add_stripe_bio() calls race here they
3291 * much all set STRIPE_BITMAP_PENDING. So only the first one
3292 * to complete "bitmap_startwrite" gets to set
3293 * STRIPE_BIT_DELAY. This is important as once a stripe
3294 * is added to a batch, STRIPE_BIT_DELAY cannot be changed
3295 * any more.
3296 */
3297 set_bit(STRIPE_BITMAP_PENDING, &sh->state);
3298 spin_unlock_irq(&sh->stripe_lock);
3299 bitmap_startwrite(conf->mddev->bitmap, sh->sector,
3300 STRIPE_SECTORS, 0);
3301 spin_lock_irq(&sh->stripe_lock);
3302 clear_bit(STRIPE_BITMAP_PENDING, &sh->state);
3303 if (!sh->batch_head) {
3304 sh->bm_seq = conf->seq_flush+1;
3305 set_bit(STRIPE_BIT_DELAY, &sh->state);
3306 }
3307 }
3308 spin_unlock_irq(&sh->stripe_lock);
3309
3310 if (stripe_can_batch(sh))
3311 stripe_add_to_batch_list(conf, sh);
3312 return 1;
3313
3314 overlap:
3315 set_bit(R5_Overlap, &sh->dev[dd_idx].flags);
3316 spin_unlock_irq(&sh->stripe_lock);
3317 return 0;
3318}
3319
3320static void end_reshape(struct r5conf *conf);
3321
3322static void stripe_set_idx(sector_t stripe, struct r5conf *conf, int previous,
3323 struct stripe_head *sh)
3324{
3325 int sectors_per_chunk =
3326 previous ? conf->prev_chunk_sectors : conf->chunk_sectors;
3327 int dd_idx;
3328 int chunk_offset = sector_div(stripe, sectors_per_chunk);
3329 int disks = previous ? conf->previous_raid_disks : conf->raid_disks;
3330
3331 raid5_compute_sector(conf,
3332 stripe * (disks - conf->max_degraded)
3333 *sectors_per_chunk + chunk_offset,
3334 previous,
3335 &dd_idx, sh);
3336}
3337
3338static void
3339handle_failed_stripe(struct r5conf *conf, struct stripe_head *sh,
3340 struct stripe_head_state *s, int disks)
3341{
3342 int i;
3343 BUG_ON(sh->batch_head);
3344 for (i = disks; i--; ) {
3345 struct bio *bi;
3346 int bitmap_end = 0;
3347
3348 if (test_bit(R5_ReadError, &sh->dev[i].flags)) {
3349 struct md_rdev *rdev;
3350 rcu_read_lock();
3351 rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[i].rdev);
3352 if (rdev && test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags) &&
3353 !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
3354 atomic_inc(&rdev->nr_pending);
3355 else
3356 rdev = NULL;
3357 rcu_read_unlock();
3358 if (rdev) {
3359 if (!rdev_set_badblocks(
3360 rdev,
3361 sh->sector,
3362 STRIPE_SECTORS, 0))
3363 md_error(conf->mddev, rdev);
3364 rdev_dec_pending(rdev, conf->mddev);
3365 }
3366 }
3367 spin_lock_irq(&sh->stripe_lock);
3368 /* fail all writes first */
3369 bi = sh->dev[i].towrite;
3370 sh->dev[i].towrite = NULL;
3371 sh->overwrite_disks = 0;
3372 spin_unlock_irq(&sh->stripe_lock);
3373 if (bi)
3374 bitmap_end = 1;
3375
3376 log_stripe_write_finished(sh);
3377
3378 if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_Overlap, &sh->dev[i].flags))
3379 wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
3380
3381 while (bi && bi->bi_iter.bi_sector <
3382 sh->dev[i].sector + STRIPE_SECTORS) {
3383 struct bio *nextbi = r5_next_bio(bi, sh->dev[i].sector);
3384
3385 md_write_end(conf->mddev);
3386 bio_io_error(bi);
3387 bi = nextbi;
3388 }
3389 if (bitmap_end)
3390 bitmap_endwrite(conf->mddev->bitmap, sh->sector,
3391 STRIPE_SECTORS, 0, 0);
3392 bitmap_end = 0;
3393 /* and fail all 'written' */
3394 bi = sh->dev[i].written;
3395 sh->dev[i].written = NULL;
3396 if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_SkipCopy, &sh->dev[i].flags)) {
3397 WARN_ON(test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[i].flags));
3398 sh->dev[i].page = sh->dev[i].orig_page;
3399 }
3400
3401 if (bi) bitmap_end = 1;
3402 while (bi && bi->bi_iter.bi_sector <
3403 sh->dev[i].sector + STRIPE_SECTORS) {
3404 struct bio *bi2 = r5_next_bio(bi, sh->dev[i].sector);
3405
3406 md_write_end(conf->mddev);
3407 bio_io_error(bi);
3408 bi = bi2;
3409 }
3410
3411 /* fail any reads if this device is non-operational and
3412 * the data has not reached the cache yet.
3413 */
3414 if (!test_bit(R5_Wantfill, &sh->dev[i].flags) &&
3415 s->failed > conf->max_degraded &&
3416 (!test_bit(R5_Insync, &sh->dev[i].flags) ||
3417 test_bit(R5_ReadError, &sh->dev[i].flags))) {
3418 spin_lock_irq(&sh->stripe_lock);
3419 bi = sh->dev[i].toread;
3420 sh->dev[i].toread = NULL;
3421 spin_unlock_irq(&sh->stripe_lock);
3422 if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_Overlap, &sh->dev[i].flags))
3423 wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
3424 if (bi)
3425 s->to_read--;
3426 while (bi && bi->bi_iter.bi_sector <
3427 sh->dev[i].sector + STRIPE_SECTORS) {
3428 struct bio *nextbi =
3429 r5_next_bio(bi, sh->dev[i].sector);
3430
3431 bio_io_error(bi);
3432 bi = nextbi;
3433 }
3434 }
3435 if (bitmap_end)
3436 bitmap_endwrite(conf->mddev->bitmap, sh->sector,
3437 STRIPE_SECTORS, 0, 0);
3438 /* If we were in the middle of a write the parity block might
3439 * still be locked - so just clear all R5_LOCKED flags
3440 */
3441 clear_bit(R5_LOCKED, &sh->dev[i].flags);
3442 }
3443 s->to_write = 0;
3444 s->written = 0;
3445
3446 if (test_and_clear_bit(STRIPE_FULL_WRITE, &sh->state))
3447 if (atomic_dec_and_test(&conf->pending_full_writes))
3448 md_wakeup_thread(conf->mddev->thread);
3449}
3450
3451static void
3452handle_failed_sync(struct r5conf *conf, struct stripe_head *sh,
3453 struct stripe_head_state *s)
3454{
3455 int abort = 0;
3456 int i;
3457
3458 BUG_ON(sh->batch_head);
3459 clear_bit(STRIPE_SYNCING, &sh->state);
3460 if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_Overlap, &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags))
3461 wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
3462 s->syncing = 0;
3463 s->replacing = 0;
3464 /* There is nothing more to do for sync/check/repair.
3465 * Don't even need to abort as that is handled elsewhere
3466 * if needed, and not always wanted e.g. if there is a known
3467 * bad block here.
3468 * For recover/replace we need to record a bad block on all
3469 * non-sync devices, or abort the recovery
3470 */
3471 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RECOVER, &conf->mddev->recovery)) {
3472 /* During recovery devices cannot be removed, so
3473 * locking and refcounting of rdevs is not needed
3474 */
3475 rcu_read_lock();
3476 for (i = 0; i < conf->raid_disks; i++) {
3477 struct md_rdev *rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[i].rdev);
3478 if (rdev
3479 && !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags)
3480 && !test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags)
3481 && !rdev_set_badblocks(rdev, sh->sector,
3482 STRIPE_SECTORS, 0))
3483 abort = 1;
3484 rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[i].replacement);
3485 if (rdev
3486 && !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags)
3487 && !test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags)
3488 && !rdev_set_badblocks(rdev, sh->sector,
3489 STRIPE_SECTORS, 0))
3490 abort = 1;
3491 }
3492 rcu_read_unlock();
3493 if (abort)
3494 conf->recovery_disabled =
3495 conf->mddev->recovery_disabled;
3496 }
3497 md_done_sync(conf->mddev, STRIPE_SECTORS, !abort);
3498}
3499
3500static int want_replace(struct stripe_head *sh, int disk_idx)
3501{
3502 struct md_rdev *rdev;
3503 int rv = 0;
3504
3505 rcu_read_lock();
3506 rdev = rcu_dereference(sh->raid_conf->disks[disk_idx].replacement);
3507 if (rdev
3508 && !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags)
3509 && !test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags)
3510 && (rdev->recovery_offset <= sh->sector
3511 || rdev->mddev->recovery_cp <= sh->sector))
3512 rv = 1;
3513 rcu_read_unlock();
3514 return rv;
3515}
3516
3517static int need_this_block(struct stripe_head *sh, struct stripe_head_state *s,
3518 int disk_idx, int disks)
3519{
3520 struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[disk_idx];
3521 struct r5dev *fdev[2] = { &sh->dev[s->failed_num[0]],
3522 &sh->dev[s->failed_num[1]] };
3523 int i;
3524
3525
3526 if (test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) ||
3527 test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags))
3528 /* No point reading this as we already have it or have
3529 * decided to get it.
3530 */
3531 return 0;
3532
3533 if (dev->toread ||
3534 (dev->towrite && !test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &dev->flags)))
3535 /* We need this block to directly satisfy a request */
3536 return 1;
3537
3538 if (s->syncing || s->expanding ||
3539 (s->replacing && want_replace(sh, disk_idx)))
3540 /* When syncing, or expanding we read everything.
3541 * When replacing, we need the replaced block.
3542 */
3543 return 1;
3544
3545 if ((s->failed >= 1 && fdev[0]->toread) ||
3546 (s->failed >= 2 && fdev[1]->toread))
3547 /* If we want to read from a failed device, then
3548 * we need to actually read every other device.
3549 */
3550 return 1;
3551
3552 /* Sometimes neither read-modify-write nor reconstruct-write
3553 * cycles can work. In those cases we read every block we
3554 * can. Then the parity-update is certain to have enough to
3555 * work with.
3556 * This can only be a problem when we need to write something,
3557 * and some device has failed. If either of those tests
3558 * fail we need look no further.
3559 */
3560 if (!s->failed || !s->to_write)
3561 return 0;
3562
3563 if (test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags) &&
3564 !test_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE, &sh->state))
3565 /* Pre-reads at not permitted until after short delay
3566 * to gather multiple requests. However if this
3567 * device is no Insync, the block could only be computed
3568 * and there is no need to delay that.
3569 */
3570 return 0;
3571
3572 for (i = 0; i < s->failed && i < 2; i++) {
3573 if (fdev[i]->towrite &&
3574 !test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &fdev[i]->flags) &&
3575 !test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &fdev[i]->flags))
3576 /* If we have a partial write to a failed
3577 * device, then we will need to reconstruct
3578 * the content of that device, so all other
3579 * devices must be read.
3580 */
3581 return 1;
3582 }
3583
3584 /* If we are forced to do a reconstruct-write, either because
3585 * the current RAID6 implementation only supports that, or
3586 * because parity cannot be trusted and we are currently
3587 * recovering it, there is extra need to be careful.
3588 * If one of the devices that we would need to read, because
3589 * it is not being overwritten (and maybe not written at all)
3590 * is missing/faulty, then we need to read everything we can.
3591 */
3592 if (sh->raid_conf->level != 6 &&
3593 sh->sector < sh->raid_conf->mddev->recovery_cp)
3594 /* reconstruct-write isn't being forced */
3595 return 0;
3596 for (i = 0; i < s->failed && i < 2; i++) {
3597 if (s->failed_num[i] != sh->pd_idx &&
3598 s->failed_num[i] != sh->qd_idx &&
3599 !test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &fdev[i]->flags) &&
3600 !test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &fdev[i]->flags))
3601 return 1;
3602 }
3603
3604 return 0;
3605}
3606
3607/* fetch_block - checks the given member device to see if its data needs
3608 * to be read or computed to satisfy a request.
3609 *
3610 * Returns 1 when no more member devices need to be checked, otherwise returns
3611 * 0 to tell the loop in handle_stripe_fill to continue
3612 */
3613static int fetch_block(struct stripe_head *sh, struct stripe_head_state *s,
3614 int disk_idx, int disks)
3615{
3616 struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[disk_idx];
3617
3618 /* is the data in this block needed, and can we get it? */
3619 if (need_this_block(sh, s, disk_idx, disks)) {
3620 /* we would like to get this block, possibly by computing it,
3621 * otherwise read it if the backing disk is insync
3622 */
3623 BUG_ON(test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags));
3624 BUG_ON(test_bit(R5_Wantread, &dev->flags));
3625 BUG_ON(sh->batch_head);
3626
3627 /*
3628 * In the raid6 case if the only non-uptodate disk is P
3629 * then we already trusted P to compute the other failed
3630 * drives. It is safe to compute rather than re-read P.
3631 * In other cases we only compute blocks from failed
3632 * devices, otherwise check/repair might fail to detect
3633 * a real inconsistency.
3634 */
3635
3636 if ((s->uptodate == disks - 1) &&
3637 ((sh->qd_idx >= 0 && sh->pd_idx == disk_idx) ||
3638 (s->failed && (disk_idx == s->failed_num[0] ||
3639 disk_idx == s->failed_num[1])))) {
3640 /* have disk failed, and we're requested to fetch it;
3641 * do compute it
3642 */
3643 pr_debug("Computing stripe %llu block %d\n",
3644 (unsigned long long)sh->sector, disk_idx);
3645 set_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state);
3646 set_bit(STRIPE_OP_COMPUTE_BLK, &s->ops_request);
3647 set_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags);
3648 sh->ops.target = disk_idx;
3649 sh->ops.target2 = -1; /* no 2nd target */
3650 s->req_compute = 1;
3651 /* Careful: from this point on 'uptodate' is in the eye
3652 * of raid_run_ops which services 'compute' operations
3653 * before writes. R5_Wantcompute flags a block that will
3654 * be R5_UPTODATE by the time it is needed for a
3655 * subsequent operation.
3656 */
3657 s->uptodate++;
3658 return 1;
3659 } else if (s->uptodate == disks-2 && s->failed >= 2) {
3660 /* Computing 2-failure is *very* expensive; only
3661 * do it if failed >= 2
3662 */
3663 int other;
3664 for (other = disks; other--; ) {
3665 if (other == disk_idx)
3666 continue;
3667 if (!test_bit(R5_UPTODATE,
3668 &sh->dev[other].flags))
3669 break;
3670 }
3671 BUG_ON(other < 0);
3672 pr_debug("Computing stripe %llu blocks %d,%d\n",
3673 (unsigned long long)sh->sector,
3674 disk_idx, other);
3675 set_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state);
3676 set_bit(STRIPE_OP_COMPUTE_BLK, &s->ops_request);
3677 set_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &sh->dev[disk_idx].flags);
3678 set_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &sh->dev[other].flags);
3679 sh->ops.target = disk_idx;
3680 sh->ops.target2 = other;
3681 s->uptodate += 2;
3682 s->req_compute = 1;
3683 return 1;
3684 } else if (test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags)) {
3685 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
3686 set_bit(R5_Wantread, &dev->flags);
3687 s->locked++;
3688 pr_debug("Reading block %d (sync=%d)\n",
3689 disk_idx, s->syncing);
3690 }
3691 }
3692
3693 return 0;
3694}
3695
3696/**
3697 * handle_stripe_fill - read or compute data to satisfy pending requests.
3698 */
3699static void handle_stripe_fill(struct stripe_head *sh,
3700 struct stripe_head_state *s,
3701 int disks)
3702{
3703 int i;
3704
3705 /* look for blocks to read/compute, skip this if a compute
3706 * is already in flight, or if the stripe contents are in the
3707 * midst of changing due to a write
3708 */
3709 if (!test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state) && !sh->check_state &&
3710 !sh->reconstruct_state) {
3711
3712 /*
3713 * For degraded stripe with data in journal, do not handle
3714 * read requests yet, instead, flush the stripe to raid
3715 * disks first, this avoids handling complex rmw of write
3716 * back cache (prexor with orig_page, and then xor with
3717 * page) in the read path
3718 */
3719 if (s->injournal && s->failed) {
3720 if (test_bit(STRIPE_R5C_CACHING, &sh->state))
3721 r5c_make_stripe_write_out(sh);
3722 goto out;
3723 }
3724
3725 for (i = disks; i--; )
3726 if (fetch_block(sh, s, i, disks))
3727 break;
3728 }
3729out:
3730 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
3731}
3732
3733static void break_stripe_batch_list(struct stripe_head *head_sh,
3734 unsigned long handle_flags);
3735/* handle_stripe_clean_event
3736 * any written block on an uptodate or failed drive can be returned.
3737 * Note that if we 'wrote' to a failed drive, it will be UPTODATE, but
3738 * never LOCKED, so we don't need to test 'failed' directly.
3739 */
3740static void handle_stripe_clean_event(struct r5conf *conf,
3741 struct stripe_head *sh, int disks)
3742{
3743 int i;
3744 struct r5dev *dev;
3745 int discard_pending = 0;
3746 struct stripe_head *head_sh = sh;
3747 bool do_endio = false;
3748
3749 for (i = disks; i--; )
3750 if (sh->dev[i].written) {
3751 dev = &sh->dev[i];
3752 if (!test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
3753 (test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) ||
3754 test_bit(R5_Discard, &dev->flags) ||
3755 test_bit(R5_SkipCopy, &dev->flags))) {
3756 /* We can return any write requests */
3757 struct bio *wbi, *wbi2;
3758 pr_debug("Return write for disc %d\n", i);
3759 if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_Discard, &dev->flags))
3760 clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags);
3761 if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_SkipCopy, &dev->flags)) {
3762 WARN_ON(test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags));
3763 }
3764 do_endio = true;
3765
3766returnbi:
3767 dev->page = dev->orig_page;
3768 wbi = dev->written;
3769 dev->written = NULL;
3770 while (wbi && wbi->bi_iter.bi_sector <
3771 dev->sector + STRIPE_SECTORS) {
3772 wbi2 = r5_next_bio(wbi, dev->sector);
3773 md_write_end(conf->mddev);
3774 bio_endio(wbi);
3775 wbi = wbi2;
3776 }
3777 bitmap_endwrite(conf->mddev->bitmap, sh->sector,
3778 STRIPE_SECTORS,
3779 !test_bit(STRIPE_DEGRADED, &sh->state),
3780 0);
3781 if (head_sh->batch_head) {
3782 sh = list_first_entry(&sh->batch_list,
3783 struct stripe_head,
3784 batch_list);
3785 if (sh != head_sh) {
3786 dev = &sh->dev[i];
3787 goto returnbi;
3788 }
3789 }
3790 sh = head_sh;
3791 dev = &sh->dev[i];
3792 } else if (test_bit(R5_Discard, &dev->flags))
3793 discard_pending = 1;
3794 }
3795
3796 log_stripe_write_finished(sh);
3797
3798 if (!discard_pending &&
3799 test_bit(R5_Discard, &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags)) {
3800 int hash;
3801 clear_bit(R5_Discard, &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags);
3802 clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags);
3803 if (sh->qd_idx >= 0) {
3804 clear_bit(R5_Discard, &sh->dev[sh->qd_idx].flags);
3805 clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[sh->qd_idx].flags);
3806 }
3807 /* now that discard is done we can proceed with any sync */
3808 clear_bit(STRIPE_DISCARD, &sh->state);
3809 /*
3810 * SCSI discard will change some bio fields and the stripe has
3811 * no updated data, so remove it from hash list and the stripe
3812 * will be reinitialized
3813 */
3814unhash:
3815 hash = sh->hash_lock_index;
3816 spin_lock_irq(conf->hash_locks + hash);
3817 remove_hash(sh);
3818 spin_unlock_irq(conf->hash_locks + hash);
3819 if (head_sh->batch_head) {
3820 sh = list_first_entry(&sh->batch_list,
3821 struct stripe_head, batch_list);
3822 if (sh != head_sh)
3823 goto unhash;
3824 }
3825 sh = head_sh;
3826
3827 if (test_bit(STRIPE_SYNC_REQUESTED, &sh->state))
3828 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
3829
3830 }
3831
3832 if (test_and_clear_bit(STRIPE_FULL_WRITE, &sh->state))
3833 if (atomic_dec_and_test(&conf->pending_full_writes))
3834 md_wakeup_thread(conf->mddev->thread);
3835
3836 if (head_sh->batch_head && do_endio)
3837 break_stripe_batch_list(head_sh, STRIPE_EXPAND_SYNC_FLAGS);
3838}
3839
3840/*
3841 * For RMW in write back cache, we need extra page in prexor to store the
3842 * old data. This page is stored in dev->orig_page.
3843 *
3844 * This function checks whether we have data for prexor. The exact logic
3845 * is:
3846 * R5_UPTODATE && (!R5_InJournal || R5_OrigPageUPTDODATE)
3847 */
3848static inline bool uptodate_for_rmw(struct r5dev *dev)
3849{
3850 return (test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags)) &&
3851 (!test_bit(R5_InJournal, &dev->flags) ||
3852 test_bit(R5_OrigPageUPTDODATE, &dev->flags));
3853}
3854
3855static int handle_stripe_dirtying(struct r5conf *conf,
3856 struct stripe_head *sh,
3857 struct stripe_head_state *s,
3858 int disks)
3859{
3860 int rmw = 0, rcw = 0, i;
3861 sector_t recovery_cp = conf->mddev->recovery_cp;
3862
3863 /* Check whether resync is now happening or should start.
3864 * If yes, then the array is dirty (after unclean shutdown or
3865 * initial creation), so parity in some stripes might be inconsistent.
3866 * In this case, we need to always do reconstruct-write, to ensure
3867 * that in case of drive failure or read-error correction, we
3868 * generate correct data from the parity.
3869 */
3870 if (conf->rmw_level == PARITY_DISABLE_RMW ||
3871 (recovery_cp < MaxSector && sh->sector >= recovery_cp &&
3872 s->failed == 0)) {
3873 /* Calculate the real rcw later - for now make it
3874 * look like rcw is cheaper
3875 */
3876 rcw = 1; rmw = 2;
3877 pr_debug("force RCW rmw_level=%u, recovery_cp=%llu sh->sector=%llu\n",
3878 conf->rmw_level, (unsigned long long)recovery_cp,
3879 (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
3880 } else for (i = disks; i--; ) {
3881 /* would I have to read this buffer for read_modify_write */
3882 struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
3883 if (((dev->towrite && !delay_towrite(conf, dev, s)) ||
3884 i == sh->pd_idx || i == sh->qd_idx ||
3885 test_bit(R5_InJournal, &dev->flags)) &&
3886 !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
3887 !(uptodate_for_rmw(dev) ||
3888 test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags))) {
3889 if (test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags))
3890 rmw++;
3891 else
3892 rmw += 2*disks; /* cannot read it */
3893 }
3894 /* Would I have to read this buffer for reconstruct_write */
3895 if (!test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &dev->flags) &&
3896 i != sh->pd_idx && i != sh->qd_idx &&
3897 !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
3898 !(test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) ||
3899 test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags))) {
3900 if (test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags))
3901 rcw++;
3902 else
3903 rcw += 2*disks;
3904 }
3905 }
3906
3907 pr_debug("for sector %llu state 0x%lx, rmw=%d rcw=%d\n",
3908 (unsigned long long)sh->sector, sh->state, rmw, rcw);
3909 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
3910 if ((rmw < rcw || (rmw == rcw && conf->rmw_level == PARITY_PREFER_RMW)) && rmw > 0) {
3911 /* prefer read-modify-write, but need to get some data */
3912 if (conf->mddev->queue)
3913 blk_add_trace_msg(conf->mddev->queue,
3914 "raid5 rmw %llu %d",
3915 (unsigned long long)sh->sector, rmw);
3916 for (i = disks; i--; ) {
3917 struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
3918 if (test_bit(R5_InJournal, &dev->flags) &&
3919 dev->page == dev->orig_page &&
3920 !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags)) {
3921 /* alloc page for prexor */
3922 struct page *p = alloc_page(GFP_NOIO);
3923
3924 if (p) {
3925 dev->orig_page = p;
3926 continue;
3927 }
3928
3929 /*
3930 * alloc_page() failed, try use
3931 * disk_info->extra_page
3932 */
3933 if (!test_and_set_bit(R5C_EXTRA_PAGE_IN_USE,
3934 &conf->cache_state)) {
3935 r5c_use_extra_page(sh);
3936 break;
3937 }
3938
3939 /* extra_page in use, add to delayed_list */
3940 set_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
3941 s->waiting_extra_page = 1;
3942 return -EAGAIN;
3943 }
3944 }
3945
3946 for (i = disks; i--; ) {
3947 struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
3948 if (((dev->towrite && !delay_towrite(conf, dev, s)) ||
3949 i == sh->pd_idx || i == sh->qd_idx ||
3950 test_bit(R5_InJournal, &dev->flags)) &&
3951 !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
3952 !(uptodate_for_rmw(dev) ||
3953 test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags)) &&
3954 test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags)) {
3955 if (test_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE,
3956 &sh->state)) {
3957 pr_debug("Read_old block %d for r-m-w\n",
3958 i);
3959 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
3960 set_bit(R5_Wantread, &dev->flags);
3961 s->locked++;
3962 } else {
3963 set_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
3964 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
3965 }
3966 }
3967 }
3968 }
3969 if ((rcw < rmw || (rcw == rmw && conf->rmw_level != PARITY_PREFER_RMW)) && rcw > 0) {
3970 /* want reconstruct write, but need to get some data */
3971 int qread =0;
3972 rcw = 0;
3973 for (i = disks; i--; ) {
3974 struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
3975 if (!test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &dev->flags) &&
3976 i != sh->pd_idx && i != sh->qd_idx &&
3977 !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
3978 !(test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) ||
3979 test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags))) {
3980 rcw++;
3981 if (test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags) &&
3982 test_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE,
3983 &sh->state)) {
3984 pr_debug("Read_old block "
3985 "%d for Reconstruct\n", i);
3986 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
3987 set_bit(R5_Wantread, &dev->flags);
3988 s->locked++;
3989 qread++;
3990 } else {
3991 set_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
3992 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
3993 }
3994 }
3995 }
3996 if (rcw && conf->mddev->queue)
3997 blk_add_trace_msg(conf->mddev->queue, "raid5 rcw %llu %d %d %d",
3998 (unsigned long long)sh->sector,
3999 rcw, qread, test_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state));
4000 }
4001
4002 if (rcw > disks && rmw > disks &&
4003 !test_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE, &sh->state))
4004 set_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
4005
4006 /* now if nothing is locked, and if we have enough data,
4007 * we can start a write request
4008 */
4009 /* since handle_stripe can be called at any time we need to handle the
4010 * case where a compute block operation has been submitted and then a
4011 * subsequent call wants to start a write request. raid_run_ops only
4012 * handles the case where compute block and reconstruct are requested
4013 * simultaneously. If this is not the case then new writes need to be
4014 * held off until the compute completes.
4015 */
4016 if ((s->req_compute || !test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state)) &&
4017 (s->locked == 0 && (rcw == 0 || rmw == 0) &&
4018 !test_bit(STRIPE_BIT_DELAY, &sh->state)))
4019 schedule_reconstruction(sh, s, rcw == 0, 0);
4020 return 0;
4021}
4022
4023static void handle_parity_checks5(struct r5conf *conf, struct stripe_head *sh,
4024 struct stripe_head_state *s, int disks)
4025{
4026 struct r5dev *dev = NULL;
4027
4028 BUG_ON(sh->batch_head);
4029 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
4030
4031 switch (sh->check_state) {
4032 case check_state_idle:
4033 /* start a new check operation if there are no failures */
4034 if (s->failed == 0) {
4035 BUG_ON(s->uptodate != disks);
4036 sh->check_state = check_state_run;
4037 set_bit(STRIPE_OP_CHECK, &s->ops_request);
4038 clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags);
4039 s->uptodate--;
4040 break;
4041 }
4042 dev = &sh->dev[s->failed_num[0]];
4043 /* fall through */
4044 case check_state_compute_result:
4045 sh->check_state = check_state_idle;
4046 if (!dev)
4047 dev = &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx];
4048
4049 /* check that a write has not made the stripe insync */
4050 if (test_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state))
4051 break;
4052
4053 /* either failed parity check, or recovery is happening */
4054 BUG_ON(!test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags));
4055 BUG_ON(s->uptodate != disks);
4056
4057 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
4058 s->locked++;
4059 set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
4060
4061 clear_bit(STRIPE_DEGRADED, &sh->state);
4062 set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
4063 break;
4064 case check_state_run:
4065 break; /* we will be called again upon completion */
4066 case check_state_check_result:
4067 sh->check_state = check_state_idle;
4068
4069 /* if a failure occurred during the check operation, leave
4070 * STRIPE_INSYNC not set and let the stripe be handled again
4071 */
4072 if (s->failed)
4073 break;
4074
4075 /* handle a successful check operation, if parity is correct
4076 * we are done. Otherwise update the mismatch count and repair
4077 * parity if !MD_RECOVERY_CHECK
4078 */
4079 if ((sh->ops.zero_sum_result & SUM_CHECK_P_RESULT) == 0)
4080 /* parity is correct (on disc,
4081 * not in buffer any more)
4082 */
4083 set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
4084 else {
4085 atomic64_add(STRIPE_SECTORS, &conf->mddev->resync_mismatches);
4086 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &conf->mddev->recovery)) {
4087 /* don't try to repair!! */
4088 set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
4089 pr_warn_ratelimited("%s: mismatch sector in range "
4090 "%llu-%llu\n", mdname(conf->mddev),
4091 (unsigned long long) sh->sector,
4092 (unsigned long long) sh->sector +
4093 STRIPE_SECTORS);
4094 } else {
4095 sh->check_state = check_state_compute_run;
4096 set_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state);
4097 set_bit(STRIPE_OP_COMPUTE_BLK, &s->ops_request);
4098 set_bit(R5_Wantcompute,
4099 &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags);
4100 sh->ops.target = sh->pd_idx;
4101 sh->ops.target2 = -1;
4102 s->uptodate++;
4103 }
4104 }
4105 break;
4106 case check_state_compute_run:
4107 break;
4108 default:
4109 pr_err("%s: unknown check_state: %d sector: %llu\n",
4110 __func__, sh->check_state,
4111 (unsigned long long) sh->sector);
4112 BUG();
4113 }
4114}
4115
4116static void handle_parity_checks6(struct r5conf *conf, struct stripe_head *sh,
4117 struct stripe_head_state *s,
4118 int disks)
4119{
4120 int pd_idx = sh->pd_idx;
4121 int qd_idx = sh->qd_idx;
4122 struct r5dev *dev;
4123
4124 BUG_ON(sh->batch_head);
4125 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
4126
4127 BUG_ON(s->failed > 2);
4128
4129 /* Want to check and possibly repair P and Q.
4130 * However there could be one 'failed' device, in which
4131 * case we can only check one of them, possibly using the
4132 * other to generate missing data
4133 */
4134
4135 switch (sh->check_state) {
4136 case check_state_idle:
4137 /* start a new check operation if there are < 2 failures */
4138 if (s->failed == s->q_failed) {
4139 /* The only possible failed device holds Q, so it
4140 * makes sense to check P (If anything else were failed,
4141 * we would have used P to recreate it).
4142 */
4143 sh->check_state = check_state_run;
4144 }
4145 if (!s->q_failed && s->failed < 2) {
4146 /* Q is not failed, and we didn't use it to generate
4147 * anything, so it makes sense to check it
4148 */
4149 if (sh->check_state == check_state_run)
4150 sh->check_state = check_state_run_pq;
4151 else
4152 sh->check_state = check_state_run_q;
4153 }
4154
4155 /* discard potentially stale zero_sum_result */
4156 sh->ops.zero_sum_result = 0;
4157
4158 if (sh->check_state == check_state_run) {
4159 /* async_xor_zero_sum destroys the contents of P */
4160 clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[pd_idx].flags);
4161 s->uptodate--;
4162 }
4163 if (sh->check_state >= check_state_run &&
4164 sh->check_state <= check_state_run_pq) {
4165 /* async_syndrome_zero_sum preserves P and Q, so
4166 * no need to mark them !uptodate here
4167 */
4168 set_bit(STRIPE_OP_CHECK, &s->ops_request);
4169 break;
4170 }
4171
4172 /* we have 2-disk failure */
4173 BUG_ON(s->failed != 2);
4174 /* fall through */
4175 case check_state_compute_result:
4176 sh->check_state = check_state_idle;
4177
4178 /* check that a write has not made the stripe insync */
4179 if (test_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state))
4180 break;
4181
4182 /* now write out any block on a failed drive,
4183 * or P or Q if they were recomputed
4184 */
4185 BUG_ON(s->uptodate < disks - 1); /* We don't need Q to recover */
4186 if (s->failed == 2) {
4187 dev = &sh->dev[s->failed_num[1]];
4188 s->locked++;
4189 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
4190 set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
4191 }
4192 if (s->failed >= 1) {
4193 dev = &sh->dev[s->failed_num[0]];
4194 s->locked++;
4195 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
4196 set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
4197 }
4198 if (sh->ops.zero_sum_result & SUM_CHECK_P_RESULT) {
4199 dev = &sh->dev[pd_idx];
4200 s->locked++;
4201 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
4202 set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
4203 }
4204 if (sh->ops.zero_sum_result & SUM_CHECK_Q_RESULT) {
4205 dev = &sh->dev[qd_idx];
4206 s->locked++;
4207 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
4208 set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
4209 }
4210 clear_bit(STRIPE_DEGRADED, &sh->state);
4211
4212 set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
4213 break;
4214 case check_state_run:
4215 case check_state_run_q:
4216 case check_state_run_pq:
4217 break; /* we will be called again upon completion */
4218 case check_state_check_result:
4219 sh->check_state = check_state_idle;
4220
4221 /* handle a successful check operation, if parity is correct
4222 * we are done. Otherwise update the mismatch count and repair
4223 * parity if !MD_RECOVERY_CHECK
4224 */
4225 if (sh->ops.zero_sum_result == 0) {
4226 /* both parities are correct */
4227 if (!s->failed)
4228 set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
4229 else {
4230 /* in contrast to the raid5 case we can validate
4231 * parity, but still have a failure to write
4232 * back
4233 */
4234 sh->check_state = check_state_compute_result;
4235 /* Returning at this point means that we may go
4236 * off and bring p and/or q uptodate again so
4237 * we make sure to check zero_sum_result again
4238 * to verify if p or q need writeback
4239 */
4240 }
4241 } else {
4242 atomic64_add(STRIPE_SECTORS, &conf->mddev->resync_mismatches);
4243 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &conf->mddev->recovery)) {
4244 /* don't try to repair!! */
4245 set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
4246 pr_warn_ratelimited("%s: mismatch sector in range "
4247 "%llu-%llu\n", mdname(conf->mddev),
4248 (unsigned long long) sh->sector,
4249 (unsigned long long) sh->sector +
4250 STRIPE_SECTORS);
4251 } else {
4252 int *target = &sh->ops.target;
4253
4254 sh->ops.target = -1;
4255 sh->ops.target2 = -1;
4256 sh->check_state = check_state_compute_run;
4257 set_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state);
4258 set_bit(STRIPE_OP_COMPUTE_BLK, &s->ops_request);
4259 if (sh->ops.zero_sum_result & SUM_CHECK_P_RESULT) {
4260 set_bit(R5_Wantcompute,
4261 &sh->dev[pd_idx].flags);
4262 *target = pd_idx;
4263 target = &sh->ops.target2;
4264 s->uptodate++;
4265 }
4266 if (sh->ops.zero_sum_result & SUM_CHECK_Q_RESULT) {
4267 set_bit(R5_Wantcompute,
4268 &sh->dev[qd_idx].flags);
4269 *target = qd_idx;
4270 s->uptodate++;
4271 }
4272 }
4273 }
4274 break;
4275 case check_state_compute_run:
4276 break;
4277 default:
4278 pr_warn("%s: unknown check_state: %d sector: %llu\n",
4279 __func__, sh->check_state,
4280 (unsigned long long) sh->sector);
4281 BUG();
4282 }
4283}
4284
4285static void handle_stripe_expansion(struct r5conf *conf, struct stripe_head *sh)
4286{
4287 int i;
4288
4289 /* We have read all the blocks in this stripe and now we need to
4290 * copy some of them into a target stripe for expand.
4291 */
4292 struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *tx = NULL;
4293 BUG_ON(sh->batch_head);
4294 clear_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_SOURCE, &sh->state);
4295 for (i = 0; i < sh->disks; i++)
4296 if (i != sh->pd_idx && i != sh->qd_idx) {
4297 int dd_idx, j;
4298 struct stripe_head *sh2;
4299 struct async_submit_ctl submit;
4300
4301 sector_t bn = raid5_compute_blocknr(sh, i, 1);
4302 sector_t s = raid5_compute_sector(conf, bn, 0,
4303 &dd_idx, NULL);
4304 sh2 = raid5_get_active_stripe(conf, s, 0, 1, 1);
4305 if (sh2 == NULL)
4306 /* so far only the early blocks of this stripe
4307 * have been requested. When later blocks
4308 * get requested, we will try again
4309 */
4310 continue;
4311 if (!test_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh2->state) ||
4312 test_bit(R5_Expanded, &sh2->dev[dd_idx].flags)) {
4313 /* must have already done this block */
4314 raid5_release_stripe(sh2);
4315 continue;
4316 }
4317
4318 /* place all the copies on one channel */
4319 init_async_submit(&submit, 0, tx, NULL, NULL, NULL);
4320 tx = async_memcpy(sh2->dev[dd_idx].page,
4321 sh->dev[i].page, 0, 0, STRIPE_SIZE,
4322 &submit);
4323
4324 set_bit(R5_Expanded, &sh2->dev[dd_idx].flags);
4325 set_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh2->dev[dd_idx].flags);
4326 for (j = 0; j < conf->raid_disks; j++)
4327 if (j != sh2->pd_idx &&
4328 j != sh2->qd_idx &&
4329 !test_bit(R5_Expanded, &sh2->dev[j].flags))
4330 break;
4331 if (j == conf->raid_disks) {
4332 set_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_READY, &sh2->state);
4333 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh2->state);
4334 }
4335 raid5_release_stripe(sh2);
4336
4337 }
4338 /* done submitting copies, wait for them to complete */
4339 async_tx_quiesce(&tx);
4340}
4341
4342/*
4343 * handle_stripe - do things to a stripe.
4344 *
4345 * We lock the stripe by setting STRIPE_ACTIVE and then examine the
4346 * state of various bits to see what needs to be done.
4347 * Possible results:
4348 * return some read requests which now have data
4349 * return some write requests which are safely on storage
4350 * schedule a read on some buffers
4351 * schedule a write of some buffers
4352 * return confirmation of parity correctness
4353 *
4354 */
4355
4356static void analyse_stripe(struct stripe_head *sh, struct stripe_head_state *s)
4357{
4358 struct r5conf *conf = sh->raid_conf;
4359 int disks = sh->disks;
4360 struct r5dev *dev;
4361 int i;
4362 int do_recovery = 0;
4363
4364 memset(s, 0, sizeof(*s));
4365
4366 s->expanding = test_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_SOURCE, &sh->state) && !sh->batch_head;
4367 s->expanded = test_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_READY, &sh->state) && !sh->batch_head;
4368 s->failed_num[0] = -1;
4369 s->failed_num[1] = -1;
4370 s->log_failed = r5l_log_disk_error(conf);
4371
4372 /* Now to look around and see what can be done */
4373 rcu_read_lock();
4374 for (i=disks; i--; ) {
4375 struct md_rdev *rdev;
4376 sector_t first_bad;
4377 int bad_sectors;
4378 int is_bad = 0;
4379
4380 dev = &sh->dev[i];
4381
4382 pr_debug("check %d: state 0x%lx read %p write %p written %p\n",
4383 i, dev->flags,
4384 dev->toread, dev->towrite, dev->written);
4385 /* maybe we can reply to a read
4386 *
4387 * new wantfill requests are only permitted while
4388 * ops_complete_biofill is guaranteed to be inactive
4389 */
4390 if (test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) && dev->toread &&
4391 !test_bit(STRIPE_BIOFILL_RUN, &sh->state))
4392 set_bit(R5_Wantfill, &dev->flags);
4393
4394 /* now count some things */
4395 if (test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags))
4396 s->locked++;
4397 if (test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags))
4398 s->uptodate++;
4399 if (test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags)) {
4400 s->compute++;
4401 BUG_ON(s->compute > 2);
4402 }
4403
4404 if (test_bit(R5_Wantfill, &dev->flags))
4405 s->to_fill++;
4406 else if (dev->toread)
4407 s->to_read++;
4408 if (dev->towrite) {
4409 s->to_write++;
4410 if (!test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &dev->flags))
4411 s->non_overwrite++;
4412 }
4413 if (dev->written)
4414 s->written++;
4415 /* Prefer to use the replacement for reads, but only
4416 * if it is recovered enough and has no bad blocks.
4417 */
4418 rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[i].replacement);
4419 if (rdev && !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags) &&
4420 rdev->recovery_offset >= sh->sector + STRIPE_SECTORS &&
4421 !is_badblock(rdev, sh->sector, STRIPE_SECTORS,
4422 &first_bad, &bad_sectors))
4423 set_bit(R5_ReadRepl, &dev->flags);
4424 else {
4425 if (rdev && !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
4426 set_bit(R5_NeedReplace, &dev->flags);
4427 else
4428 clear_bit(R5_NeedReplace, &dev->flags);
4429 rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[i].rdev);
4430 clear_bit(R5_ReadRepl, &dev->flags);
4431 }
4432 if (rdev && test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
4433 rdev = NULL;
4434 if (rdev) {
4435 is_bad = is_badblock(rdev, sh->sector, STRIPE_SECTORS,
4436 &first_bad, &bad_sectors);
4437 if (s->blocked_rdev == NULL
4438 && (test_bit(Blocked, &rdev->flags)
4439 || is_bad < 0)) {
4440 if (is_bad < 0)
4441 set_bit(BlockedBadBlocks,
4442 &rdev->flags);
4443 s->blocked_rdev = rdev;
4444 atomic_inc(&rdev->nr_pending);
4445 }
4446 }
4447 clear_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
4448 if (!rdev)
4449 /* Not in-sync */;
4450 else if (is_bad) {
4451 /* also not in-sync */
4452 if (!test_bit(WriteErrorSeen, &rdev->flags) &&
4453 test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags)) {
4454 /* treat as in-sync, but with a read error
4455 * which we can now try to correct
4456 */
4457 set_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
4458 set_bit(R5_ReadError, &dev->flags);
4459 }
4460 } else if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags))
4461 set_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
4462 else if (sh->sector + STRIPE_SECTORS <= rdev->recovery_offset)
4463 /* in sync if before recovery_offset */
4464 set_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
4465 else if (test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) &&
4466 test_bit(R5_Expanded, &dev->flags))
4467 /* If we've reshaped into here, we assume it is Insync.
4468 * We will shortly update recovery_offset to make
4469 * it official.
4470 */
4471 set_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
4472
4473 if (test_bit(R5_WriteError, &dev->flags)) {
4474 /* This flag does not apply to '.replacement'
4475 * only to .rdev, so make sure to check that*/
4476 struct md_rdev *rdev2 = rcu_dereference(
4477 conf->disks[i].rdev);
4478 if (rdev2 == rdev)
4479 clear_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
4480 if (rdev2 && !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev2->flags)) {
4481 s->handle_bad_blocks = 1;
4482 atomic_inc(&rdev2->nr_pending);
4483 } else
4484 clear_bit(R5_WriteError, &dev->flags);
4485 }
4486 if (test_bit(R5_MadeGood, &dev->flags)) {
4487 /* This flag does not apply to '.replacement'
4488 * only to .rdev, so make sure to check that*/
4489 struct md_rdev *rdev2 = rcu_dereference(
4490 conf->disks[i].rdev);
4491 if (rdev2 && !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev2->flags)) {
4492 s->handle_bad_blocks = 1;
4493 atomic_inc(&rdev2->nr_pending);
4494 } else
4495 clear_bit(R5_MadeGood, &dev->flags);
4496 }
4497 if (test_bit(R5_MadeGoodRepl, &dev->flags)) {
4498 struct md_rdev *rdev2 = rcu_dereference(
4499 conf->disks[i].replacement);
4500 if (rdev2 && !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev2->flags)) {
4501 s->handle_bad_blocks = 1;
4502 atomic_inc(&rdev2->nr_pending);
4503 } else
4504 clear_bit(R5_MadeGoodRepl, &dev->flags);
4505 }
4506 if (!test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags)) {
4507 /* The ReadError flag will just be confusing now */
4508 clear_bit(R5_ReadError, &dev->flags);
4509 clear_bit(R5_ReWrite, &dev->flags);
4510 }
4511 if (test_bit(R5_ReadError, &dev->flags))
4512 clear_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
4513 if (!test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags)) {
4514 if (s->failed < 2)
4515 s->failed_num[s->failed] = i;
4516 s->failed++;
4517 if (rdev && !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
4518 do_recovery = 1;
4519 }
4520
4521 if (test_bit(R5_InJournal, &dev->flags))
4522 s->injournal++;
4523 if (test_bit(R5_InJournal, &dev->flags) && dev->written)
4524 s->just_cached++;
4525 }
4526 if (test_bit(STRIPE_SYNCING, &sh->state)) {
4527 /* If there is a failed device being replaced,
4528 * we must be recovering.
4529 * else if we are after recovery_cp, we must be syncing
4530 * else if MD_RECOVERY_REQUESTED is set, we also are syncing.
4531 * else we can only be replacing
4532 * sync and recovery both need to read all devices, and so
4533 * use the same flag.
4534 */
4535 if (do_recovery ||
4536 sh->sector >= conf->mddev->recovery_cp ||
4537 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_REQUESTED, &(conf->mddev->recovery)))
4538 s->syncing = 1;
4539 else
4540 s->replacing = 1;
4541 }
4542 rcu_read_unlock();
4543}
4544
4545static int clear_batch_ready(struct stripe_head *sh)
4546{
4547 /* Return '1' if this is a member of batch, or
4548 * '0' if it is a lone stripe or a head which can now be
4549 * handled.
4550 */
4551 struct stripe_head *tmp;
4552 if (!test_and_clear_bit(STRIPE_BATCH_READY, &sh->state))
4553 return (sh->batch_head && sh->batch_head != sh);
4554 spin_lock(&sh->stripe_lock);
4555 if (!sh->batch_head) {
4556 spin_unlock(&sh->stripe_lock);
4557 return 0;
4558 }
4559
4560 /*
4561 * this stripe could be added to a batch list before we check
4562 * BATCH_READY, skips it
4563 */
4564 if (sh->batch_head != sh) {
4565 spin_unlock(&sh->stripe_lock);
4566 return 1;
4567 }
4568 spin_lock(&sh->batch_lock);
4569 list_for_each_entry(tmp, &sh->batch_list, batch_list)
4570 clear_bit(STRIPE_BATCH_READY, &tmp->state);
4571 spin_unlock(&sh->batch_lock);
4572 spin_unlock(&sh->stripe_lock);
4573
4574 /*
4575 * BATCH_READY is cleared, no new stripes can be added.
4576 * batch_list can be accessed without lock
4577 */
4578 return 0;
4579}
4580
4581static void break_stripe_batch_list(struct stripe_head *head_sh,
4582 unsigned long handle_flags)
4583{
4584 struct stripe_head *sh, *next;
4585 int i;
4586 int do_wakeup = 0;
4587
4588 list_for_each_entry_safe(sh, next, &head_sh->batch_list, batch_list) {
4589
4590 list_del_init(&sh->batch_list);
4591
4592 WARN_ONCE(sh->state & ((1 << STRIPE_ACTIVE) |
4593 (1 << STRIPE_SYNCING) |
4594 (1 << STRIPE_REPLACED) |
4595 (1 << STRIPE_DELAYED) |
4596 (1 << STRIPE_BIT_DELAY) |
4597 (1 << STRIPE_FULL_WRITE) |
4598 (1 << STRIPE_BIOFILL_RUN) |
4599 (1 << STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN) |
4600 (1 << STRIPE_OPS_REQ_PENDING) |
4601 (1 << STRIPE_DISCARD) |
4602 (1 << STRIPE_BATCH_READY) |
4603 (1 << STRIPE_BATCH_ERR) |
4604 (1 << STRIPE_BITMAP_PENDING)),
4605 "stripe state: %lx\n", sh->state);
4606 WARN_ONCE(head_sh->state & ((1 << STRIPE_DISCARD) |
4607 (1 << STRIPE_REPLACED)),
4608 "head stripe state: %lx\n", head_sh->state);
4609
4610 set_mask_bits(&sh->state, ~(STRIPE_EXPAND_SYNC_FLAGS |
4611 (1 << STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE) |
4612 (1 << STRIPE_DEGRADED) |
4613 (1 << STRIPE_ON_UNPLUG_LIST)),
4614 head_sh->state & (1 << STRIPE_INSYNC));
4615
4616 sh->check_state = head_sh->check_state;
4617 sh->reconstruct_state = head_sh->reconstruct_state;
4618 for (i = 0; i < sh->disks; i++) {
4619 if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_Overlap, &sh->dev[i].flags))
4620 do_wakeup = 1;
4621 sh->dev[i].flags = head_sh->dev[i].flags &
4622 (~((1 << R5_WriteError) | (1 << R5_Overlap)));
4623 }
4624 spin_lock_irq(&sh->stripe_lock);
4625 sh->batch_head = NULL;
4626 spin_unlock_irq(&sh->stripe_lock);
4627 if (handle_flags == 0 ||
4628 sh->state & handle_flags)
4629 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
4630 raid5_release_stripe(sh);
4631 }
4632 spin_lock_irq(&head_sh->stripe_lock);
4633 head_sh->batch_head = NULL;
4634 spin_unlock_irq(&head_sh->stripe_lock);
4635 for (i = 0; i < head_sh->disks; i++)
4636 if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_Overlap, &head_sh->dev[i].flags))
4637 do_wakeup = 1;
4638 if (head_sh->state & handle_flags)
4639 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &head_sh->state);
4640
4641 if (do_wakeup)
4642 wake_up(&head_sh->raid_conf->wait_for_overlap);
4643}
4644
4645static void handle_stripe(struct stripe_head *sh)
4646{
4647 struct stripe_head_state s;
4648 struct r5conf *conf = sh->raid_conf;
4649 int i;
4650 int prexor;
4651 int disks = sh->disks;
4652 struct r5dev *pdev, *qdev;
4653
4654 clear_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
4655 if (test_and_set_bit_lock(STRIPE_ACTIVE, &sh->state)) {
4656 /* already being handled, ensure it gets handled
4657 * again when current action finishes */
4658 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
4659 return;
4660 }
4661
4662 if (clear_batch_ready(sh) ) {
4663 clear_bit_unlock(STRIPE_ACTIVE, &sh->state);
4664 return;
4665 }
4666
4667 if (test_and_clear_bit(STRIPE_BATCH_ERR, &sh->state))
4668 break_stripe_batch_list(sh, 0);
4669
4670 if (test_bit(STRIPE_SYNC_REQUESTED, &sh->state) && !sh->batch_head) {
4671 spin_lock(&sh->stripe_lock);
4672 /*
4673 * Cannot process 'sync' concurrently with 'discard'.
4674 * Flush data in r5cache before 'sync'.
4675 */
4676 if (!test_bit(STRIPE_R5C_PARTIAL_STRIPE, &sh->state) &&
4677 !test_bit(STRIPE_R5C_FULL_STRIPE, &sh->state) &&
4678 !test_bit(STRIPE_DISCARD, &sh->state) &&
4679 test_and_clear_bit(STRIPE_SYNC_REQUESTED, &sh->state)) {
4680 set_bit(STRIPE_SYNCING, &sh->state);
4681 clear_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
4682 clear_bit(STRIPE_REPLACED, &sh->state);
4683 }
4684 spin_unlock(&sh->stripe_lock);
4685 }
4686 clear_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
4687
4688 pr_debug("handling stripe %llu, state=%#lx cnt=%d, "
4689 "pd_idx=%d, qd_idx=%d\n, check:%d, reconstruct:%d\n",
4690 (unsigned long long)sh->sector, sh->state,
4691 atomic_read(&sh->count), sh->pd_idx, sh->qd_idx,
4692 sh->check_state, sh->reconstruct_state);
4693
4694 analyse_stripe(sh, &s);
4695
4696 if (test_bit(STRIPE_LOG_TRAPPED, &sh->state))
4697 goto finish;
4698
4699 if (s.handle_bad_blocks ||
4700 test_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING, &conf->mddev->sb_flags)) {
4701 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
4702 goto finish;
4703 }
4704
4705 if (unlikely(s.blocked_rdev)) {
4706 if (s.syncing || s.expanding || s.expanded ||
4707 s.replacing || s.to_write || s.written) {
4708 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
4709 goto finish;
4710 }
4711 /* There is nothing for the blocked_rdev to block */
4712 rdev_dec_pending(s.blocked_rdev, conf->mddev);
4713 s.blocked_rdev = NULL;
4714 }
4715
4716 if (s.to_fill && !test_bit(STRIPE_BIOFILL_RUN, &sh->state)) {
4717 set_bit(STRIPE_OP_BIOFILL, &s.ops_request);
4718 set_bit(STRIPE_BIOFILL_RUN, &sh->state);
4719 }
4720
4721 pr_debug("locked=%d uptodate=%d to_read=%d"
4722 " to_write=%d failed=%d failed_num=%d,%d\n",
4723 s.locked, s.uptodate, s.to_read, s.to_write, s.failed,
4724 s.failed_num[0], s.failed_num[1]);
4725 /*
4726 * check if the array has lost more than max_degraded devices and,
4727 * if so, some requests might need to be failed.
4728 *
4729 * When journal device failed (log_failed), we will only process
4730 * the stripe if there is data need write to raid disks
4731 */
4732 if (s.failed > conf->max_degraded ||
4733 (s.log_failed && s.injournal == 0)) {
4734 sh->check_state = 0;
4735 sh->reconstruct_state = 0;
4736 break_stripe_batch_list(sh, 0);
4737 if (s.to_read+s.to_write+s.written)
4738 handle_failed_stripe(conf, sh, &s, disks);
4739 if (s.syncing + s.replacing)
4740 handle_failed_sync(conf, sh, &s);
4741 }
4742
4743 /* Now we check to see if any write operations have recently
4744 * completed
4745 */
4746 prexor = 0;
4747 if (sh->reconstruct_state == reconstruct_state_prexor_drain_result)
4748 prexor = 1;
4749 if (sh->reconstruct_state == reconstruct_state_drain_result ||
4750 sh->reconstruct_state == reconstruct_state_prexor_drain_result) {
4751 sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_idle;
4752
4753 /* All the 'written' buffers and the parity block are ready to
4754 * be written back to disk
4755 */
4756 BUG_ON(!test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags) &&
4757 !test_bit(R5_Discard, &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags));
4758 BUG_ON(sh->qd_idx >= 0 &&
4759 !test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[sh->qd_idx].flags) &&
4760 !test_bit(R5_Discard, &sh->dev[sh->qd_idx].flags));
4761 for (i = disks; i--; ) {
4762 struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
4763 if (test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
4764 (i == sh->pd_idx || i == sh->qd_idx ||
4765 dev->written || test_bit(R5_InJournal,
4766 &dev->flags))) {
4767 pr_debug("Writing block %d\n", i);
4768 set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
4769 if (prexor)
4770 continue;
4771 if (s.failed > 1)
4772 continue;
4773 if (!test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags) ||
4774 ((i == sh->pd_idx || i == sh->qd_idx) &&
4775 s.failed == 0))
4776 set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
4777 }
4778 }
4779 if (test_and_clear_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE, &sh->state))
4780 s.dec_preread_active = 1;
4781 }
4782
4783 /*
4784 * might be able to return some write requests if the parity blocks
4785 * are safe, or on a failed drive
4786 */
4787 pdev = &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx];
4788 s.p_failed = (s.failed >= 1 && s.failed_num[0] == sh->pd_idx)
4789 || (s.failed >= 2 && s.failed_num[1] == sh->pd_idx);
4790 qdev = &sh->dev[sh->qd_idx];
4791 s.q_failed = (s.failed >= 1 && s.failed_num[0] == sh->qd_idx)
4792 || (s.failed >= 2 && s.failed_num[1] == sh->qd_idx)
4793 || conf->level < 6;
4794
4795 if (s.written &&
4796 (s.p_failed || ((test_bit(R5_Insync, &pdev->flags)
4797 && !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &pdev->flags)
4798 && (test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &pdev->flags) ||
4799 test_bit(R5_Discard, &pdev->flags))))) &&
4800 (s.q_failed || ((test_bit(R5_Insync, &qdev->flags)
4801 && !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &qdev->flags)
4802 && (test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &qdev->flags) ||
4803 test_bit(R5_Discard, &qdev->flags))))))
4804 handle_stripe_clean_event(conf, sh, disks);
4805
4806 if (s.just_cached)
4807 r5c_handle_cached_data_endio(conf, sh, disks);
4808 log_stripe_write_finished(sh);
4809
4810 /* Now we might consider reading some blocks, either to check/generate
4811 * parity, or to satisfy requests
4812 * or to load a block that is being partially written.
4813 */
4814 if (s.to_read || s.non_overwrite
4815 || (conf->level == 6 && s.to_write && s.failed)
4816 || (s.syncing && (s.uptodate + s.compute < disks))
4817 || s.replacing
4818 || s.expanding)
4819 handle_stripe_fill(sh, &s, disks);
4820
4821 /*
4822 * When the stripe finishes full journal write cycle (write to journal
4823 * and raid disk), this is the clean up procedure so it is ready for
4824 * next operation.
4825 */
4826 r5c_finish_stripe_write_out(conf, sh, &s);
4827
4828 /*
4829 * Now to consider new write requests, cache write back and what else,
4830 * if anything should be read. We do not handle new writes when:
4831 * 1/ A 'write' operation (copy+xor) is already in flight.
4832 * 2/ A 'check' operation is in flight, as it may clobber the parity
4833 * block.
4834 * 3/ A r5c cache log write is in flight.
4835 */
4836
4837 if (!sh->reconstruct_state && !sh->check_state && !sh->log_io) {
4838 if (!r5c_is_writeback(conf->log)) {
4839 if (s.to_write)
4840 handle_stripe_dirtying(conf, sh, &s, disks);
4841 } else { /* write back cache */
4842 int ret = 0;
4843
4844 /* First, try handle writes in caching phase */
4845 if (s.to_write)
4846 ret = r5c_try_caching_write(conf, sh, &s,
4847 disks);
4848 /*
4849 * If caching phase failed: ret == -EAGAIN
4850 * OR
4851 * stripe under reclaim: !caching && injournal
4852 *
4853 * fall back to handle_stripe_dirtying()
4854 */
4855 if (ret == -EAGAIN ||
4856 /* stripe under reclaim: !caching && injournal */
4857 (!test_bit(STRIPE_R5C_CACHING, &sh->state) &&
4858 s.injournal > 0)) {
4859 ret = handle_stripe_dirtying(conf, sh, &s,
4860 disks);
4861 if (ret == -EAGAIN)
4862 goto finish;
4863 }
4864 }
4865 }
4866
4867 /* maybe we need to check and possibly fix the parity for this stripe
4868 * Any reads will already have been scheduled, so we just see if enough
4869 * data is available. The parity check is held off while parity
4870 * dependent operations are in flight.
4871 */
4872 if (sh->check_state ||
4873 (s.syncing && s.locked == 0 &&
4874 !test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state) &&
4875 !test_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state))) {
4876 if (conf->level == 6)
4877 handle_parity_checks6(conf, sh, &s, disks);
4878 else
4879 handle_parity_checks5(conf, sh, &s, disks);
4880 }
4881
4882 if ((s.replacing || s.syncing) && s.locked == 0
4883 && !test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state)
4884 && !test_bit(STRIPE_REPLACED, &sh->state)) {
4885 /* Write out to replacement devices where possible */
4886 for (i = 0; i < conf->raid_disks; i++)
4887 if (test_bit(R5_NeedReplace, &sh->dev[i].flags)) {
4888 WARN_ON(!test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[i].flags));
4889 set_bit(R5_WantReplace, &sh->dev[i].flags);
4890 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &sh->dev[i].flags);
4891 s.locked++;
4892 }
4893 if (s.replacing)
4894 set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
4895 set_bit(STRIPE_REPLACED, &sh->state);
4896 }
4897 if ((s.syncing || s.replacing) && s.locked == 0 &&
4898 !test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state) &&
4899 test_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state)) {
4900 md_done_sync(conf->mddev, STRIPE_SECTORS, 1);
4901 clear_bit(STRIPE_SYNCING, &sh->state);
4902 if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_Overlap, &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags))
4903 wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
4904 }
4905
4906 /* If the failed drives are just a ReadError, then we might need
4907 * to progress the repair/check process
4908 */
4909 if (s.failed <= conf->max_degraded && !conf->mddev->ro)
4910 for (i = 0; i < s.failed; i++) {
4911 struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[s.failed_num[i]];
4912 if (test_bit(R5_ReadError, &dev->flags)
4913 && !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags)
4914 && test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags)
4915 ) {
4916 if (!test_bit(R5_ReWrite, &dev->flags)) {
4917 set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
4918 set_bit(R5_ReWrite, &dev->flags);
4919 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
4920 s.locked++;
4921 } else {
4922 /* let's read it back */
4923 set_bit(R5_Wantread, &dev->flags);
4924 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
4925 s.locked++;
4926 }
4927 }
4928 }
4929
4930 /* Finish reconstruct operations initiated by the expansion process */
4931 if (sh->reconstruct_state == reconstruct_state_result) {
4932 struct stripe_head *sh_src
4933 = raid5_get_active_stripe(conf, sh->sector, 1, 1, 1);
4934 if (sh_src && test_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_SOURCE, &sh_src->state)) {
4935 /* sh cannot be written until sh_src has been read.
4936 * so arrange for sh to be delayed a little
4937 */
4938 set_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
4939 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
4940 if (!test_and_set_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE,
4941 &sh_src->state))
4942 atomic_inc(&conf->preread_active_stripes);
4943 raid5_release_stripe(sh_src);
4944 goto finish;
4945 }
4946 if (sh_src)
4947 raid5_release_stripe(sh_src);
4948
4949 sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_idle;
4950 clear_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh->state);
4951 for (i = conf->raid_disks; i--; ) {
4952 set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &sh->dev[i].flags);
4953 set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &sh->dev[i].flags);
4954 s.locked++;
4955 }
4956 }
4957
4958 if (s.expanded && test_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh->state) &&
4959 !sh->reconstruct_state) {
4960 /* Need to write out all blocks after computing parity */
4961 sh->disks = conf->raid_disks;
4962 stripe_set_idx(sh->sector, conf, 0, sh);
4963 schedule_reconstruction(sh, &s, 1, 1);
4964 } else if (s.expanded && !sh->reconstruct_state && s.locked == 0) {
4965 clear_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_READY, &sh->state);
4966 atomic_dec(&conf->reshape_stripes);
4967 wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
4968 md_done_sync(conf->mddev, STRIPE_SECTORS, 1);
4969 }
4970
4971 if (s.expanding && s.locked == 0 &&
4972 !test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state))
4973 handle_stripe_expansion(conf, sh);
4974
4975finish:
4976 /* wait for this device to become unblocked */
4977 if (unlikely(s.blocked_rdev)) {
4978 if (conf->mddev->external)
4979 md_wait_for_blocked_rdev(s.blocked_rdev,
4980 conf->mddev);
4981 else
4982 /* Internal metadata will immediately
4983 * be written by raid5d, so we don't
4984 * need to wait here.
4985 */
4986 rdev_dec_pending(s.blocked_rdev,
4987 conf->mddev);
4988 }
4989
4990 if (s.handle_bad_blocks)
4991 for (i = disks; i--; ) {
4992 struct md_rdev *rdev;
4993 struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
4994 if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_WriteError, &dev->flags)) {
4995 /* We own a safe reference to the rdev */
4996 rdev = conf->disks[i].rdev;
4997 if (!rdev_set_badblocks(rdev, sh->sector,
4998 STRIPE_SECTORS, 0))
4999 md_error(conf->mddev, rdev);
5000 rdev_dec_pending(rdev, conf->mddev);
5001 }
5002 if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_MadeGood, &dev->flags)) {
5003 rdev = conf->disks[i].rdev;
5004 rdev_clear_badblocks(rdev, sh->sector,
5005 STRIPE_SECTORS, 0);
5006 rdev_dec_pending(rdev, conf->mddev);
5007 }
5008 if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_MadeGoodRepl, &dev->flags)) {
5009 rdev = conf->disks[i].replacement;
5010 if (!rdev)
5011 /* rdev have been moved down */
5012 rdev = conf->disks[i].rdev;
5013 rdev_clear_badblocks(rdev, sh->sector,
5014 STRIPE_SECTORS, 0);
5015 rdev_dec_pending(rdev, conf->mddev);
5016 }
5017 }
5018
5019 if (s.ops_request)
5020 raid_run_ops(sh, s.ops_request);
5021
5022 ops_run_io(sh, &s);
5023
5024 if (s.dec_preread_active) {
5025 /* We delay this until after ops_run_io so that if make_request
5026 * is waiting on a flush, it won't continue until the writes
5027 * have actually been submitted.
5028 */
5029 atomic_dec(&conf->preread_active_stripes);
5030 if (atomic_read(&conf->preread_active_stripes) <
5031 IO_THRESHOLD)
5032 md_wakeup_thread(conf->mddev->thread);
5033 }
5034
5035 clear_bit_unlock(STRIPE_ACTIVE, &sh->state);
5036}
5037
5038static void raid5_activate_delayed(struct r5conf *conf)
5039{
5040 if (atomic_read(&conf->preread_active_stripes) < IO_THRESHOLD) {
5041 while (!list_empty(&conf->delayed_list)) {
5042 struct list_head *l = conf->delayed_list.next;
5043 struct stripe_head *sh;
5044 sh = list_entry(l, struct stripe_head, lru);
5045 list_del_init(l);
5046 clear_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
5047 if (!test_and_set_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE, &sh->state))
5048 atomic_inc(&conf->preread_active_stripes);
5049 list_add_tail(&sh->lru, &conf->hold_list);
5050 raid5_wakeup_stripe_thread(sh);
5051 }
5052 }
5053}
5054
5055static void activate_bit_delay(struct r5conf *conf,
5056 struct list_head *temp_inactive_list)
5057{
5058 /* device_lock is held */
5059 struct list_head head;
5060 list_add(&head, &conf->bitmap_list);
5061 list_del_init(&conf->bitmap_list);
5062 while (!list_empty(&head)) {
5063 struct stripe_head *sh = list_entry(head.next, struct stripe_head, lru);
5064 int hash;
5065 list_del_init(&sh->lru);
5066 atomic_inc(&sh->count);
5067 hash = sh->hash_lock_index;
5068 __release_stripe(conf, sh, &temp_inactive_list[hash]);
5069 }
5070}
5071
5072static int raid5_congested(struct mddev *mddev, int bits)
5073{
5074 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
5075
