5076 /* No difference between reads and writes. Just check
5077 * how busy the stripe_cache is
5078 */
5079
5080 if (test_bit(R5_INACTIVE_BLOCKED, &conf->cache_state))
5081 return 1;
5082
5083 /* Also checks whether there is pressure on r5cache log space */
5084 if (test_bit(R5C_LOG_TIGHT, &conf->cache_state))
5085 return 1;
5086 if (conf->quiesce)
5087 return 1;
5088 if (atomic_read(&conf->empty_inactive_list_nr))
5089 return 1;
5090
5091 return 0;
5092}
5093
5094static int in_chunk_boundary(struct mddev *mddev, struct bio *bio)
5095{
5096 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
5097 sector_t sector = bio->bi_iter.bi_sector;
5098 unsigned int chunk_sectors;
5099 unsigned int bio_sectors = bio_sectors(bio);
5100
5101 WARN_ON_ONCE(bio->bi_partno);
5102
5103 chunk_sectors = min(conf->chunk_sectors, conf->prev_chunk_sectors);
5104 return chunk_sectors >=
5105 ((sector & (chunk_sectors - 1)) + bio_sectors);
5106}
5107
5108/*
5109 * add bio to the retry LIFO ( in O(1) ... we are in interrupt )
5110 * later sampled by raid5d.
5111 */
5112static void add_bio_to_retry(struct bio *bi,struct r5conf *conf)
5113{
5114 unsigned long flags;
5115
5116 spin_lock_irqsave(&conf->device_lock, flags);
5117
5118 bi->bi_next = conf->retry_read_aligned_list;
5119 conf->retry_read_aligned_list = bi;
5120
5121 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&conf->device_lock, flags);
5122 md_wakeup_thread(conf->mddev->thread);
5123}
5124
5125static struct bio *remove_bio_from_retry(struct r5conf *conf,
5126 unsigned int *offset)
5127{
5128 struct bio *bi;
5129
5130 bi = conf->retry_read_aligned;
5131 if (bi) {
5132 *offset = conf->retry_read_offset;
5133 conf->retry_read_aligned = NULL;
5134 return bi;
5135 }
5136 bi = conf->retry_read_aligned_list;
5137 if(bi) {
5138 conf->retry_read_aligned_list = bi->bi_next;
5139 bi->bi_next = NULL;
5140 *offset = 0;
5141 }
5142
5143 return bi;
5144}
5145
5146/*
5147 * The "raid5_align_endio" should check if the read succeeded and if it
5148 * did, call bio_endio on the original bio (having bio_put the new bio
5149 * first).
5150 * If the read failed..
5151 */
5152static void raid5_align_endio(struct bio *bi)
5153{
5154 struct bio* raid_bi = bi->bi_private;
5155 struct mddev *mddev;
5156 struct r5conf *conf;
5157 struct md_rdev *rdev;
5158 blk_status_t error = bi->bi_status;
5159
5160 bio_put(bi);
5161
5162 rdev = (void*)raid_bi->bi_next;
5163 raid_bi->bi_next = NULL;
5164 mddev = rdev->mddev;
5165 conf = mddev->private;
5166
5167 rdev_dec_pending(rdev, conf->mddev);
5168
5169 if (!error) {
5170 bio_endio(raid_bi);
5171 if (atomic_dec_and_test(&conf->active_aligned_reads))
5172 wake_up(&conf->wait_for_quiescent);
5173 return;
5174 }
5175
5176 pr_debug("raid5_align_endio : io error...handing IO for a retry\n");
5177
5178 add_bio_to_retry(raid_bi, conf);
5179}
5180
5181static int raid5_read_one_chunk(struct mddev *mddev, struct bio *raid_bio)
5182{
5183 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
5184 int dd_idx;
5185 struct bio* align_bi;
5186 struct md_rdev *rdev;
5187 sector_t end_sector;
5188
5189 if (!in_chunk_boundary(mddev, raid_bio)) {
5190 pr_debug("%s: non aligned\n", __func__);
5191 return 0;
5192 }
5193 /*
5194 * use bio_clone_fast to make a copy of the bio
5195 */
5196 align_bi = bio_clone_fast(raid_bio, GFP_NOIO, mddev->bio_set);
5197 if (!align_bi)
5198 return 0;
5199 /*
5200 * set bi_end_io to a new function, and set bi_private to the
5201 * original bio.
5202 */
5203 align_bi->bi_end_io = raid5_align_endio;
5204 align_bi->bi_private = raid_bio;
5205 /*
5206 * compute position
5207 */
5208 align_bi->bi_iter.bi_sector =
5209 raid5_compute_sector(conf, raid_bio->bi_iter.bi_sector,
5210 0, &dd_idx, NULL);
5211
5212 end_sector = bio_end_sector(align_bi);
5213 rcu_read_lock();
5214 rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[dd_idx].replacement);
5215 if (!rdev || test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags) ||
5216 rdev->recovery_offset < end_sector) {
5217 rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[dd_idx].rdev);
5218 if (rdev &&
5219 (test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags) ||
5220 !(test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags) ||
5221 rdev->recovery_offset >= end_sector)))
5222 rdev = NULL;
5223 }
5224
5225 if (r5c_big_stripe_cached(conf, align_bi->bi_iter.bi_sector)) {
5226 rcu_read_unlock();
5227 bio_put(align_bi);
5228 return 0;
5229 }
5230
5231 if (rdev) {
5232 sector_t first_bad;
5233 int bad_sectors;
5234
5235 atomic_inc(&rdev->nr_pending);
5236 rcu_read_unlock();
5237 raid_bio->bi_next = (void*)rdev;
5238 bio_set_dev(align_bi, rdev->bdev);
5239 bio_clear_flag(align_bi, BIO_SEG_VALID);
5240
5241 if (is_badblock(rdev, align_bi->bi_iter.bi_sector,
5242 bio_sectors(align_bi),
5243 &first_bad, &bad_sectors)) {
5244 bio_put(align_bi);
5245 rdev_dec_pending(rdev, mddev);
5246 return 0;
5247 }
5248
5249 /* No reshape active, so we can trust rdev->data_offset */
5250 align_bi->bi_iter.bi_sector += rdev->data_offset;
5251
5252 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5253 wait_event_lock_irq(conf->wait_for_quiescent,
5254 conf->quiesce == 0,
5255 conf->device_lock);
5256 atomic_inc(&conf->active_aligned_reads);
5257 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5258
5259 if (mddev->gendisk)
5260 trace_block_bio_remap(align_bi->bi_disk->queue,
5261 align_bi, disk_devt(mddev->gendisk),
5262 raid_bio->bi_iter.bi_sector);
5263 generic_make_request(align_bi);
5264 return 1;
5265 } else {
5266 rcu_read_unlock();
5267 bio_put(align_bi);
5268 return 0;
5269 }
5270}
5271
5272static struct bio *chunk_aligned_read(struct mddev *mddev, struct bio *raid_bio)
5273{
5274 struct bio *split;
5275 sector_t sector = raid_bio->bi_iter.bi_sector;
5276 unsigned chunk_sects = mddev->chunk_sectors;
5277 unsigned sectors = chunk_sects - (sector & (chunk_sects-1));
5278
5279 if (sectors < bio_sectors(raid_bio)) {
5280 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
5281 split = bio_split(raid_bio, sectors, GFP_NOIO, conf->bio_split);
5282 bio_chain(split, raid_bio);
5283 generic_make_request(raid_bio);
5284 raid_bio = split;
5285 }
5286
5287 if (!raid5_read_one_chunk(mddev, raid_bio))
5288 return raid_bio;
5289
5290 return NULL;
5291}
5292
5293/* __get_priority_stripe - get the next stripe to process
5294 *
5295 * Full stripe writes are allowed to pass preread active stripes up until
5296 * the bypass_threshold is exceeded. In general the bypass_count
5297 * increments when the handle_list is handled before the hold_list; however, it
5298 * will not be incremented when STRIPE_IO_STARTED is sampled set signifying a
5299 * stripe with in flight i/o. The bypass_count will be reset when the
5300 * head of the hold_list has changed, i.e. the head was promoted to the
5301 * handle_list.
5302 */
5303static struct stripe_head *__get_priority_stripe(struct r5conf *conf, int group)
5304{
5305 struct stripe_head *sh, *tmp;
5306 struct list_head *handle_list = NULL;
5307 struct r5worker_group *wg;
5308 bool second_try = !r5c_is_writeback(conf->log) &&
5309 !r5l_log_disk_error(conf);
5310 bool try_loprio = test_bit(R5C_LOG_TIGHT, &conf->cache_state) ||
5311 r5l_log_disk_error(conf);
5312
5313again:
5314 wg = NULL;
5315 sh = NULL;
5316 if (conf->worker_cnt_per_group == 0) {
5317 handle_list = try_loprio ? &conf->loprio_list :
5318 &conf->handle_list;
5319 } else if (group != ANY_GROUP) {
5320 handle_list = try_loprio ? &conf->worker_groups[group].loprio_list :
5321 &conf->worker_groups[group].handle_list;
5322 wg = &conf->worker_groups[group];
5323 } else {
5324 int i;
5325 for (i = 0; i < conf->group_cnt; i++) {
5326 handle_list = try_loprio ? &conf->worker_groups[i].loprio_list :
5327 &conf->worker_groups[i].handle_list;
5328 wg = &conf->worker_groups[i];
5329 if (!list_empty(handle_list))
5330 break;
5331 }
5332 }
5333
5334 pr_debug("%s: handle: %s hold: %s full_writes: %d bypass_count: %d\n",
5335 __func__,
5336 list_empty(handle_list) ? "empty" : "busy",
5337 list_empty(&conf->hold_list) ? "empty" : "busy",
5338 atomic_read(&conf->pending_full_writes), conf->bypass_count);
5339
5340 if (!list_empty(handle_list)) {
5341 sh = list_entry(handle_list->next, typeof(*sh), lru);
5342
5343 if (list_empty(&conf->hold_list))
5344 conf->bypass_count = 0;
5345 else if (!test_bit(STRIPE_IO_STARTED, &sh->state)) {
5346 if (conf->hold_list.next == conf->last_hold)
5347 conf->bypass_count++;
5348 else {
5349 conf->last_hold = conf->hold_list.next;
5350 conf->bypass_count -= conf->bypass_threshold;
5351 if (conf->bypass_count < 0)
5352 conf->bypass_count = 0;
5353 }
5354 }
5355 } else if (!list_empty(&conf->hold_list) &&
5356 ((conf->bypass_threshold &&
5357 conf->bypass_count > conf->bypass_threshold) ||
5358 atomic_read(&conf->pending_full_writes) == 0)) {
5359
5360 list_for_each_entry(tmp, &conf->hold_list, lru) {
5361 if (conf->worker_cnt_per_group == 0 ||
5362 group == ANY_GROUP ||
5363 !cpu_online(tmp->cpu) ||
5364 cpu_to_group(tmp->cpu) == group) {
5365 sh = tmp;
5366 break;
5367 }
5368 }
5369
5370 if (sh) {
5371 conf->bypass_count -= conf->bypass_threshold;
5372 if (conf->bypass_count < 0)
5373 conf->bypass_count = 0;
5374 }
5375 wg = NULL;
5376 }
5377
5378 if (!sh) {
5379 if (second_try)
5380 return NULL;
5381 second_try = true;
5382 try_loprio = !try_loprio;
5383 goto again;
5384 }
5385
5386 if (wg) {
5387 wg->stripes_cnt--;
5388 sh->group = NULL;
5389 }
5390 list_del_init(&sh->lru);
5391 BUG_ON(atomic_inc_return(&sh->count) != 1);
5392 return sh;
5393}
5394
5395struct raid5_plug_cb {
5396 struct blk_plug_cb cb;
5397 struct list_head list;
5398 struct list_head temp_inactive_list[NR_STRIPE_HASH_LOCKS];
5399};
5400
5401static void raid5_unplug(struct blk_plug_cb *blk_cb, bool from_schedule)
5402{
5403 struct raid5_plug_cb *cb = container_of(
5404 blk_cb, struct raid5_plug_cb, cb);
5405 struct stripe_head *sh;
5406 struct mddev *mddev = cb->cb.data;
5407 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
5408 int cnt = 0;
5409 int hash;
5410
5411 if (cb->list.next && !list_empty(&cb->list)) {
5412 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5413 while (!list_empty(&cb->list)) {
5414 sh = list_first_entry(&cb->list, struct stripe_head, lru);
5415 list_del_init(&sh->lru);
5416 /*
5417 * avoid race release_stripe_plug() sees
5418 * STRIPE_ON_UNPLUG_LIST clear but the stripe
5419 * is still in our list
5420 */
5421 smp_mb__before_atomic();
5422 clear_bit(STRIPE_ON_UNPLUG_LIST, &sh->state);
5423 /*
5424 * STRIPE_ON_RELEASE_LIST could be set here. In that
5425 * case, the count is always > 1 here
5426 */
5427 hash = sh->hash_lock_index;
5428 __release_stripe(conf, sh, &cb->temp_inactive_list[hash]);
5429 cnt++;
5430 }
5431 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5432 }
5433 release_inactive_stripe_list(conf, cb->temp_inactive_list,
5434 NR_STRIPE_HASH_LOCKS);
5435 if (mddev->queue)
5436 trace_block_unplug(mddev->queue, cnt, !from_schedule);
5437 kfree(cb);
5438}
5439
5440static void release_stripe_plug(struct mddev *mddev,
5441 struct stripe_head *sh)
5442{
5443 struct blk_plug_cb *blk_cb = blk_check_plugged(
5444 raid5_unplug, mddev,
5445 sizeof(struct raid5_plug_cb));
5446 struct raid5_plug_cb *cb;
5447
5448 if (!blk_cb) {
5449 raid5_release_stripe(sh);
5450 return;
5451 }
5452
5453 cb = container_of(blk_cb, struct raid5_plug_cb, cb);
5454
5455 if (cb->list.next == NULL) {
5456 int i;
5457 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cb->list);
5458 for (i = 0; i < NR_STRIPE_HASH_LOCKS; i++)
5459 INIT_LIST_HEAD(cb->temp_inactive_list + i);
5460 }
5461
5462 if (!test_and_set_bit(STRIPE_ON_UNPLUG_LIST, &sh->state))
5463 list_add_tail(&sh->lru, &cb->list);
5464 else
5465 raid5_release_stripe(sh);
5466}
5467
5468static void make_discard_request(struct mddev *mddev, struct bio *bi)
5469{
5470 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
5471 sector_t logical_sector, last_sector;
5472 struct stripe_head *sh;
5473 int stripe_sectors;
5474
5475 if (mddev->reshape_position != MaxSector)
5476 /* Skip discard while reshape is happening */
5477 return;
5478
5479 logical_sector = bi->bi_iter.bi_sector & ~((sector_t)STRIPE_SECTORS-1);
5480 last_sector = bi->bi_iter.bi_sector + (bi->bi_iter.bi_size>>9);
5481
5482 bi->bi_next = NULL;
5483
5484 stripe_sectors = conf->chunk_sectors *
5485 (conf->raid_disks - conf->max_degraded);
5486 logical_sector = DIV_ROUND_UP_SECTOR_T(logical_sector,
5487 stripe_sectors);
5488 sector_div(last_sector, stripe_sectors);
5489
5490 logical_sector *= conf->chunk_sectors;
5491 last_sector *= conf->chunk_sectors;
5492
5493 for (; logical_sector < last_sector;
5494 logical_sector += STRIPE_SECTORS) {
5495 DEFINE_WAIT(w);
5496 int d;
5497 again:
5498 sh = raid5_get_active_stripe(conf, logical_sector, 0, 0, 0);
5499 prepare_to_wait(&conf->wait_for_overlap, &w,
5500 TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
5501 set_bit(R5_Overlap, &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags);
5502 if (test_bit(STRIPE_SYNCING, &sh->state)) {
5503 raid5_release_stripe(sh);
5504 schedule();
5505 goto again;
5506 }
5507 clear_bit(R5_Overlap, &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags);
5508 spin_lock_irq(&sh->stripe_lock);
5509 for (d = 0; d < conf->raid_disks; d++) {
5510 if (d == sh->pd_idx || d == sh->qd_idx)
5511 continue;
5512 if (sh->dev[d].towrite || sh->dev[d].toread) {
5513 set_bit(R5_Overlap, &sh->dev[d].flags);
5514 spin_unlock_irq(&sh->stripe_lock);
5515 raid5_release_stripe(sh);
5516 schedule();
5517 goto again;
5518 }
5519 }
5520 set_bit(STRIPE_DISCARD, &sh->state);
5521 finish_wait(&conf->wait_for_overlap, &w);
5522 sh->overwrite_disks = 0;
5523 for (d = 0; d < conf->raid_disks; d++) {
5524 if (d == sh->pd_idx || d == sh->qd_idx)
5525 continue;
5526 sh->dev[d].towrite = bi;
5527 set_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &sh->dev[d].flags);
5528 bio_inc_remaining(bi);
5529 md_write_inc(mddev, bi);
5530 sh->overwrite_disks++;
5531 }
5532 spin_unlock_irq(&sh->stripe_lock);
5533 if (conf->mddev->bitmap) {
5534 for (d = 0;
5535 d < conf->raid_disks - conf->max_degraded;
5536 d++)
5537 bitmap_startwrite(mddev->bitmap,
5538 sh->sector,
5539 STRIPE_SECTORS,
5540 0);
5541 sh->bm_seq = conf->seq_flush + 1;
5542 set_bit(STRIPE_BIT_DELAY, &sh->state);
5543 }
5544
5545 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
5546 clear_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
5547 if (!test_and_set_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE, &sh->state))
5548 atomic_inc(&conf->preread_active_stripes);
5549 release_stripe_plug(mddev, sh);
5550 }
5551
5552 bio_endio(bi);
5553}
5554
5555static bool raid5_make_request(struct mddev *mddev, struct bio * bi)
5556{
5557 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
5558 int dd_idx;
5559 sector_t new_sector;
5560 sector_t logical_sector, last_sector;
5561 struct stripe_head *sh;
5562 const int rw = bio_data_dir(bi);
5563 DEFINE_WAIT(w);
5564 bool do_prepare;
5565 bool do_flush = false;
5566
5567 if (unlikely(bi->bi_opf & REQ_PREFLUSH)) {
5568 int ret = r5l_handle_flush_request(conf->log, bi);
5569
5570 if (ret == 0)
5571 return true;
5572 if (ret == -ENODEV) {
5573 md_flush_request(mddev, bi);
5574 return true;
5575 }
5576 /* ret == -EAGAIN, fallback */
5577 /*
5578 * if r5l_handle_flush_request() didn't clear REQ_PREFLUSH,
5579 * we need to flush journal device
5580 */
5581 do_flush = bi->bi_opf & REQ_PREFLUSH;
5582 }
5583
5584 if (!md_write_start(mddev, bi))
5585 return false;
5586 /*
5587 * If array is degraded, better not do chunk aligned read because
5588 * later we might have to read it again in order to reconstruct
5589 * data on failed drives.
5590 */
5591 if (rw == READ && mddev->degraded == 0 &&
5592 mddev->reshape_position == MaxSector) {
5593 bi = chunk_aligned_read(mddev, bi);
5594 if (!bi)
5595 return true;
5596 }
5597
5598 if (unlikely(bio_op(bi) == REQ_OP_DISCARD)) {
5599 make_discard_request(mddev, bi);
5600 md_write_end(mddev);
5601 return true;
5602 }
5603
5604 logical_sector = bi->bi_iter.bi_sector & ~((sector_t)STRIPE_SECTORS-1);
5605 last_sector = bio_end_sector(bi);
5606 bi->bi_next = NULL;
5607
5608 prepare_to_wait(&conf->wait_for_overlap, &w, TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
5609 for (;logical_sector < last_sector; logical_sector += STRIPE_SECTORS) {
5610 int previous;
5611 int seq;
5612
5613 do_prepare = false;
5614 retry:
5615 seq = read_seqcount_begin(&conf->gen_lock);
5616 previous = 0;
5617 if (do_prepare)
5618 prepare_to_wait(&conf->wait_for_overlap, &w,
5619 TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
5620 if (unlikely(conf->reshape_progress != MaxSector)) {
5621 /* spinlock is needed as reshape_progress may be
5622 * 64bit on a 32bit platform, and so it might be
5623 * possible to see a half-updated value
5624 * Of course reshape_progress could change after
5625 * the lock is dropped, so once we get a reference
5626 * to the stripe that we think it is, we will have
5627 * to check again.
5628 */
5629 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5630 if (mddev->reshape_backwards
5631 ? logical_sector < conf->reshape_progress
5632 : logical_sector >= conf->reshape_progress) {
5633 previous = 1;
5634 } else {
5635 if (mddev->reshape_backwards
5636 ? logical_sector < conf->reshape_safe
5637 : logical_sector >= conf->reshape_safe) {
5638 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5639 schedule();
5640 do_prepare = true;
5641 goto retry;
5642 }
5643 }
5644 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5645 }
5646
5647 new_sector = raid5_compute_sector(conf, logical_sector,
5648 previous,
5649 &dd_idx, NULL);
5650 pr_debug("raid456: raid5_make_request, sector %llu logical %llu\n",
5651 (unsigned long long)new_sector,
5652 (unsigned long long)logical_sector);
5653
5654 sh = raid5_get_active_stripe(conf, new_sector, previous,
5655 (bi->bi_opf & REQ_RAHEAD), 0);
5656 if (sh) {
5657 if (unlikely(previous)) {
5658 /* expansion might have moved on while waiting for a
5659 * stripe, so we must do the range check again.
5660 * Expansion could still move past after this
5661 * test, but as we are holding a reference to
5662 * 'sh', we know that if that happens,
5663 * STRIPE_EXPANDING will get set and the expansion
5664 * won't proceed until we finish with the stripe.
5665 */
5666 int must_retry = 0;
5667 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5668 if (mddev->reshape_backwards
5669 ? logical_sector >= conf->reshape_progress
5670 : logical_sector < conf->reshape_progress)
5671 /* mismatch, need to try again */
5672 must_retry = 1;
5673 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5674 if (must_retry) {
5675 raid5_release_stripe(sh);
5676 schedule();
5677 do_prepare = true;
5678 goto retry;
5679 }
5680 }
5681 if (read_seqcount_retry(&conf->gen_lock, seq)) {
5682 /* Might have got the wrong stripe_head
5683 * by accident
5684 */
5685 raid5_release_stripe(sh);
5686 goto retry;
5687 }
5688
5689 if (test_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh->state) ||
5690 !add_stripe_bio(sh, bi, dd_idx, rw, previous)) {
5691 /* Stripe is busy expanding or
5692 * add failed due to overlap. Flush everything
5693 * and wait a while
5694 */
5695 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
5696 raid5_release_stripe(sh);
5697 schedule();
5698 do_prepare = true;
5699 goto retry;
5700 }
5701 if (do_flush) {
5702 set_bit(STRIPE_R5C_PREFLUSH, &sh->state);
5703 /* we only need flush for one stripe */
5704 do_flush = false;
5705 }
5706
5707 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
5708 clear_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
5709 if ((!sh->batch_head || sh == sh->batch_head) &&
5710 (bi->bi_opf & REQ_SYNC) &&
5711 !test_and_set_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE, &sh->state))
5712 atomic_inc(&conf->preread_active_stripes);
5713 release_stripe_plug(mddev, sh);
5714 } else {
5715 /* cannot get stripe for read-ahead, just give-up */
5716 bi->bi_status = BLK_STS_IOERR;
5717 break;
5718 }
5719 }
5720 finish_wait(&conf->wait_for_overlap, &w);
5721
5722 if (rw == WRITE)
5723 md_write_end(mddev);
5724 bio_endio(bi);
5725 return true;
5726}
5727
5728static sector_t raid5_size(struct mddev *mddev, sector_t sectors, int raid_disks);
5729
5730static sector_t reshape_request(struct mddev *mddev, sector_t sector_nr, int *skipped)
5731{
5732 /* reshaping is quite different to recovery/resync so it is
5733 * handled quite separately ... here.
5734 *
5735 * On each call to sync_request, we gather one chunk worth of
5736 * destination stripes and flag them as expanding.
5737 * Then we find all the source stripes and request reads.
5738 * As the reads complete, handle_stripe will copy the data
5739 * into the destination stripe and release that stripe.
5740 */
5741 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
5742 struct stripe_head *sh;
5743 sector_t first_sector, last_sector;
5744 int raid_disks = conf->previous_raid_disks;
5745 int data_disks = raid_disks - conf->max_degraded;
5746 int new_data_disks = conf->raid_disks - conf->max_degraded;
5747 int i;
5748 int dd_idx;
5749 sector_t writepos, readpos, safepos;
5750 sector_t stripe_addr;
5751 int reshape_sectors;
5752 struct list_head stripes;
5753 sector_t retn;
5754
5755 if (sector_nr == 0) {
5756 /* If restarting in the middle, skip the initial sectors */
5757 if (mddev->reshape_backwards &&
5758 conf->reshape_progress < raid5_size(mddev, 0, 0)) {
5759 sector_nr = raid5_size(mddev, 0, 0)
5760 - conf->reshape_progress;
5761 } else if (mddev->reshape_backwards &&
5762 conf->reshape_progress == MaxSector) {
5763 /* shouldn't happen, but just in case, finish up.*/
5764 sector_nr = MaxSector;
5765 } else if (!mddev->reshape_backwards &&
5766 conf->reshape_progress > 0)
5767 sector_nr = conf->reshape_progress;
5768 sector_div(sector_nr, new_data_disks);
5769 if (sector_nr) {
5770 mddev->curr_resync_completed = sector_nr;
5771 sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL, "sync_completed");
5772 *skipped = 1;
5773 retn = sector_nr;
5774 goto finish;
5775 }
5776 }
5777
5778 /* We need to process a full chunk at a time.
5779 * If old and new chunk sizes differ, we need to process the
5780 * largest of these
5781 */
5782
5783 reshape_sectors = max(conf->chunk_sectors, conf->prev_chunk_sectors);
5784
5785 /* We update the metadata at least every 10 seconds, or when
5786 * the data about to be copied would over-write the source of
5787 * the data at the front of the range. i.e. one new_stripe
5788 * along from reshape_progress new_maps to after where
5789 * reshape_safe old_maps to
5790 */
5791 writepos = conf->reshape_progress;
5792 sector_div(writepos, new_data_disks);
5793 readpos = conf->reshape_progress;
5794 sector_div(readpos, data_disks);
5795 safepos = conf->reshape_safe;
5796 sector_div(safepos, data_disks);
5797 if (mddev->reshape_backwards) {
5798 BUG_ON(writepos < reshape_sectors);
5799 writepos -= reshape_sectors;
5800 readpos += reshape_sectors;
5801 safepos += reshape_sectors;
5802 } else {
5803 writepos += reshape_sectors;
5804 /* readpos and safepos are worst-case calculations.
5805 * A negative number is overly pessimistic, and causes
5806 * obvious problems for unsigned storage. So clip to 0.
5807 */
5808 readpos -= min_t(sector_t, reshape_sectors, readpos);
5809 safepos -= min_t(sector_t, reshape_sectors, safepos);
5810 }
5811
5812 /* Having calculated the 'writepos' possibly use it
5813 * to set 'stripe_addr' which is where we will write to.
5814 */
5815 if (mddev->reshape_backwards) {
5816 BUG_ON(conf->reshape_progress == 0);
5817 stripe_addr = writepos;
5818 BUG_ON((mddev->dev_sectors &
5819 ~((sector_t)reshape_sectors - 1))
5820 - reshape_sectors - stripe_addr
5821 != sector_nr);
5822 } else {
5823 BUG_ON(writepos != sector_nr + reshape_sectors);
5824 stripe_addr = sector_nr;
5825 }
5826
5827 /* 'writepos' is the most advanced device address we might write.
5828 * 'readpos' is the least advanced device address we might read.
5829 * 'safepos' is the least address recorded in the metadata as having
5830 * been reshaped.
5831 * If there is a min_offset_diff, these are adjusted either by
5832 * increasing the safepos/readpos if diff is negative, or
5833 * increasing writepos if diff is positive.
5834 * If 'readpos' is then behind 'writepos', there is no way that we can
5835 * ensure safety in the face of a crash - that must be done by userspace
5836 * making a backup of the data. So in that case there is no particular
5837 * rush to update metadata.
5838 * Otherwise if 'safepos' is behind 'writepos', then we really need to
5839 * update the metadata to advance 'safepos' to match 'readpos' so that
5840 * we can be safe in the event of a crash.
5841 * So we insist on updating metadata if safepos is behind writepos and
5842 * readpos is beyond writepos.
5843 * In any case, update the metadata every 10 seconds.
5844 * Maybe that number should be configurable, but I'm not sure it is
5845 * worth it.... maybe it could be a multiple of safemode_delay???
5846 */
5847 if (conf->min_offset_diff < 0) {
5848 safepos += -conf->min_offset_diff;
5849 readpos += -conf->min_offset_diff;
5850 } else
5851 writepos += conf->min_offset_diff;
5852
5853 if ((mddev->reshape_backwards
5854 ? (safepos > writepos && readpos < writepos)
5855 : (safepos < writepos && readpos > writepos)) ||
5856 time_after(jiffies, conf->reshape_checkpoint + 10*HZ)) {
5857 /* Cannot proceed until we've updated the superblock... */
5858 wait_event(conf->wait_for_overlap,
5859 atomic_read(&conf->reshape_stripes)==0
5860 || test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery));
5861 if (atomic_read(&conf->reshape_stripes) != 0)
5862 return 0;
5863 mddev->reshape_position = conf->reshape_progress;
5864 mddev->curr_resync_completed = sector_nr;
5865 conf->reshape_checkpoint = jiffies;
5866 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags);
5867 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
5868 wait_event(mddev->sb_wait, mddev->sb_flags == 0 ||
5869 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery));
5870 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery))
5871 return 0;
5872 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5873 conf->reshape_safe = mddev->reshape_position;
5874 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5875 wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
5876 sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL, "sync_completed");
5877 }
5878
5879 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&stripes);
5880 for (i = 0; i < reshape_sectors; i += STRIPE_SECTORS) {
5881 int j;
5882 int skipped_disk = 0;
5883 sh = raid5_get_active_stripe(conf, stripe_addr+i, 0, 0, 1);
5884 set_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh->state);
5885 atomic_inc(&conf->reshape_stripes);
5886 /* If any of this stripe is beyond the end of the old
5887 * array, then we need to zero those blocks
5888 */
5889 for (j=sh->disks; j--;) {
5890 sector_t s;
5891 if (j == sh->pd_idx)
5892 continue;
5893 if (conf->level == 6 &&
5894 j == sh->qd_idx)
5895 continue;
5896 s = raid5_compute_blocknr(sh, j, 0);
5897 if (s < raid5_size(mddev, 0, 0)) {
5898 skipped_disk = 1;
5899 continue;
5900 }
5901 memset(page_address(sh->dev[j].page), 0, STRIPE_SIZE);
5902 set_bit(R5_Expanded, &sh->dev[j].flags);
5903 set_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[j].flags);
5904 }
5905 if (!skipped_disk) {
5906 set_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_READY, &sh->state);
5907 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
5908 }
5909 list_add(&sh->lru, &stripes);
5910 }
5911 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5912 if (mddev->reshape_backwards)
5913 conf->reshape_progress -= reshape_sectors * new_data_disks;
5914 else
5915 conf->reshape_progress += reshape_sectors * new_data_disks;
5916 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5917 /* Ok, those stripe are ready. We can start scheduling
5918 * reads on the source stripes.
5919 * The source stripes are determined by mapping the first and last
5920 * block on the destination stripes.
5921 */
5922 first_sector =
5923 raid5_compute_sector(conf, stripe_addr*(new_data_disks),
5924 1, &dd_idx, NULL);
5925 last_sector =
5926 raid5_compute_sector(conf, ((stripe_addr+reshape_sectors)
5927 * new_data_disks - 1),
5928 1, &dd_idx, NULL);
5929 if (last_sector >= mddev->dev_sectors)
5930 last_sector = mddev->dev_sectors - 1;
5931 while (first_sector <= last_sector) {
5932 sh = raid5_get_active_stripe(conf, first_sector, 1, 0, 1);
5933 set_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_SOURCE, &sh->state);
5934 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
5935 raid5_release_stripe(sh);
5936 first_sector += STRIPE_SECTORS;
5937 }
5938 /* Now that the sources are clearly marked, we can release
5939 * the destination stripes
5940 */
5941 while (!list_empty(&stripes)) {
5942 sh = list_entry(stripes.next, struct stripe_head, lru);
5943 list_del_init(&sh->lru);
5944 raid5_release_stripe(sh);
5945 }
5946 /* If this takes us to the resync_max point where we have to pause,
5947 * then we need to write out the superblock.
5948 */
5949 sector_nr += reshape_sectors;
5950 retn = reshape_sectors;
5951finish:
5952 if (mddev->curr_resync_completed > mddev->resync_max ||
5953 (sector_nr - mddev->curr_resync_completed) * 2
5954 >= mddev->resync_max - mddev->curr_resync_completed) {
5955 /* Cannot proceed until we've updated the superblock... */
5956 wait_event(conf->wait_for_overlap,
5957 atomic_read(&conf->reshape_stripes) == 0
5958 || test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery));
5959 if (atomic_read(&conf->reshape_stripes) != 0)
5960 goto ret;
5961 mddev->reshape_position = conf->reshape_progress;
5962 mddev->curr_resync_completed = sector_nr;
5963 conf->reshape_checkpoint = jiffies;
5964 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags);
5965 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
5966 wait_event(mddev->sb_wait,
5967 !test_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags)
5968 || test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery));
5969 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery))
5970 goto ret;
5971 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5972 conf->reshape_safe = mddev->reshape_position;
5973 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5974 wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
5975 sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL, "sync_completed");
5976 }
5977ret:
5978 return retn;
5979}
5980
5981static inline sector_t raid5_sync_request(struct mddev *mddev, sector_t sector_nr,
5982 int *skipped)
5983{
5984 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
5985 struct stripe_head *sh;
5986 sector_t max_sector = mddev->dev_sectors;
5987 sector_t sync_blocks;
5988 int still_degraded = 0;
5989 int i;
5990
5991 if (sector_nr >= max_sector) {
5992 /* just being told to finish up .. nothing much to do */
5993
5994 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery)) {
5995 end_reshape(conf);
5996 return 0;
5997 }
5998
5999 if (mddev->curr_resync < max_sector) /* aborted */
6000 bitmap_end_sync(mddev->bitmap, mddev->curr_resync,
6001 &sync_blocks, 1);
6002 else /* completed sync */
6003 conf->fullsync = 0;
6004 bitmap_close_sync(mddev->bitmap);
6005
6006 return 0;
6007 }
6008
6009 /* Allow raid5_quiesce to complete */
6010 wait_event(conf->wait_for_overlap, conf->quiesce != 2);
6011
6012 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery))
6013 return reshape_request(mddev, sector_nr, skipped);
6014
6015 /* No need to check resync_max as we never do more than one
6016 * stripe, and as resync_max will always be on a chunk boundary,
6017 * if the check in md_do_sync didn't fire, there is no chance
6018 * of overstepping resync_max here
6019 */
6020
6021 /* if there is too many failed drives and we are trying
6022 * to resync, then assert that we are finished, because there is
6023 * nothing we can do.
6024 */
6025 if (mddev->degraded >= conf->max_degraded &&
6026 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery)) {
6027 sector_t rv = mddev->dev_sectors - sector_nr;
6028 *skipped = 1;
6029 return rv;
6030 }
6031 if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_REQUESTED, &mddev->recovery) &&
6032 !conf->fullsync &&
6033 !bitmap_start_sync(mddev->bitmap, sector_nr, &sync_blocks, 1) &&
6034 sync_blocks >= STRIPE_SECTORS) {
6035 /* we can skip this block, and probably more */
6036 sync_blocks /= STRIPE_SECTORS;
6037 *skipped = 1;
6038 return sync_blocks * STRIPE_SECTORS; /* keep things rounded to whole stripes */
6039 }
6040
6041 bitmap_cond_end_sync(mddev->bitmap, sector_nr, false);
6042
6043 sh = raid5_get_active_stripe(conf, sector_nr, 0, 1, 0);
6044 if (sh == NULL) {
6045 sh = raid5_get_active_stripe(conf, sector_nr, 0, 0, 0);
6046 /* make sure we don't swamp the stripe cache if someone else
6047 * is trying to get access
6048 */
6049 schedule_timeout_uninterruptible(1);
6050 }
6051 /* Need to check if array will still be degraded after recovery/resync
6052 * Note in case of > 1 drive failures it's possible we're rebuilding
6053 * one drive while leaving another faulty drive in array.
6054 */
6055 rcu_read_lock();
6056 for (i = 0; i < conf->raid_disks; i++) {
6057 struct md_rdev *rdev = ACCESS_ONCE(conf->disks[i].rdev);
6058
6059 if (rdev == NULL || test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
6060 still_degraded = 1;
6061 }
6062 rcu_read_unlock();
6063
6064 bitmap_start_sync(mddev->bitmap, sector_nr, &sync_blocks, still_degraded);
6065
6066 set_bit(STRIPE_SYNC_REQUESTED, &sh->state);
6067 set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
6068
6069 raid5_release_stripe(sh);
6070
6071 return STRIPE_SECTORS;
6072}
6073
6074static int retry_aligned_read(struct r5conf *conf, struct bio *raid_bio,
6075 unsigned int offset)
6076{
6077 /* We may not be able to submit a whole bio at once as there
6078 * may not be enough stripe_heads available.
6079 * We cannot pre-allocate enough stripe_heads as we may need
6080 * more than exist in the cache (if we allow ever large chunks).
6081 * So we do one stripe head at a time and record in
6082 * ->bi_hw_segments how many have been done.
6083 *
6084 * We *know* that this entire raid_bio is in one chunk, so
6085 * it will be only one 'dd_idx' and only need one call to raid5_compute_sector.
6086 */
6087 struct stripe_head *sh;
6088 int dd_idx;
6089 sector_t sector, logical_sector, last_sector;
6090 int scnt = 0;
6091 int handled = 0;
6092
6093 logical_sector = raid_bio->bi_iter.bi_sector &
6094 ~((sector_t)STRIPE_SECTORS-1);
6095 sector = raid5_compute_sector(conf, logical_sector,
6096 0, &dd_idx, NULL);
6097 last_sector = bio_end_sector(raid_bio);
6098
6099 for (; logical_sector < last_sector;
6100 logical_sector += STRIPE_SECTORS,
6101 sector += STRIPE_SECTORS,
6102 scnt++) {
6103
6104 if (scnt < offset)
6105 /* already done this stripe */
6106 continue;
6107
6108 sh = raid5_get_active_stripe(conf, sector, 0, 1, 1);
6109
6110 if (!sh) {
6111 /* failed to get a stripe - must wait */
6112 conf->retry_read_aligned = raid_bio;
6113 conf->retry_read_offset = scnt;
6114 return handled;
6115 }
6116
6117 if (!add_stripe_bio(sh, raid_bio, dd_idx, 0, 0)) {
6118 raid5_release_stripe(sh);
6119 conf->retry_read_aligned = raid_bio;
6120 conf->retry_read_offset = scnt;
6121 return handled;
6122 }
6123
6124 set_bit(R5_ReadNoMerge, &sh->dev[dd_idx].flags);
6125 handle_stripe(sh);
6126 raid5_release_stripe(sh);
6127 handled++;
6128 }
6129
6130 bio_endio(raid_bio);
6131
6132 if (atomic_dec_and_test(&conf->active_aligned_reads))
6133 wake_up(&conf->wait_for_quiescent);
6134 return handled;
6135}
6136
6137static int handle_active_stripes(struct r5conf *conf, int group,
6138 struct r5worker *worker,
6139 struct list_head *temp_inactive_list)
6140{
6141 struct stripe_head *batch[MAX_STRIPE_BATCH], *sh;
6142 int i, batch_size = 0, hash;
6143 bool release_inactive = false;
6144
6145 while (batch_size < MAX_STRIPE_BATCH &&
6146 (sh = __get_priority_stripe(conf, group)) != NULL)
6147 batch[batch_size++] = sh;
6148
6149 if (batch_size == 0) {
6150 for (i = 0; i < NR_STRIPE_HASH_LOCKS; i++)
6151 if (!list_empty(temp_inactive_list + i))
6152 break;
6153 if (i == NR_STRIPE_HASH_LOCKS) {
6154 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6155 r5l_flush_stripe_to_raid(conf->log);
6156 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6157 return batch_size;
6158 }
6159 release_inactive = true;
6160 }
6161 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6162
6163 release_inactive_stripe_list(conf, temp_inactive_list,
6164 NR_STRIPE_HASH_LOCKS);
6165
6166 r5l_flush_stripe_to_raid(conf->log);
6167 if (release_inactive) {
6168 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6169 return 0;
6170 }
6171
6172 for (i = 0; i < batch_size; i++)
6173 handle_stripe(batch[i]);
6174 log_write_stripe_run(conf);
6175
6176 cond_resched();
6177
6178 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6179 for (i = 0; i < batch_size; i++) {
6180 hash = batch[i]->hash_lock_index;
6181 __release_stripe(conf, batch[i], &temp_inactive_list[hash]);
6182 }
6183 return batch_size;
6184}
6185
6186static void raid5_do_work(struct work_struct *work)
6187{
6188 struct r5worker *worker = container_of(work, struct r5worker, work);
6189 struct r5worker_group *group = worker->group;
6190 struct r5conf *conf = group->conf;
6191 struct mddev *mddev = conf->mddev;
6192 int group_id = group - conf->worker_groups;
6193 int handled;
6194 struct blk_plug plug;
6195
6196 pr_debug("+++ raid5worker active\n");
6197
6198 blk_start_plug(&plug);
6199 handled = 0;
6200 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6201 while (1) {
6202 int batch_size, released;
6203
6204 released = release_stripe_list(conf, worker->temp_inactive_list);
6205
6206 batch_size = handle_active_stripes(conf, group_id, worker,
6207 worker->temp_inactive_list);
6208 worker->working = false;
6209 if (!batch_size && !released)
6210 break;
6211 handled += batch_size;
6212 wait_event_lock_irq(mddev->sb_wait,
6213 !test_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING, &mddev->sb_flags),
6214 conf->device_lock);
6215 }
6216 pr_debug("%d stripes handled\n", handled);
6217
6218 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6219
6220 flush_deferred_bios(conf);
6221
6222 r5l_flush_stripe_to_raid(conf->log);
6223
6224 async_tx_issue_pending_all();
6225 blk_finish_plug(&plug);
6226
6227 pr_debug("--- raid5worker inactive\n");
6228}
6229
6230/*
6231 * This is our raid5 kernel thread.
6232 *
6233 * We scan the hash table for stripes which can be handled now.
6234 * During the scan, completed stripes are saved for us by the interrupt
6235 * handler, so that they will not have to wait for our next wakeup.
6236 */
6237static void raid5d(struct md_thread *thread)
6238{
6239 struct mddev *mddev = thread->mddev;
6240 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
6241 int handled;
6242 struct blk_plug plug;
6243
6244 pr_debug("+++ raid5d active\n");
6245
6246 md_check_recovery(mddev);
6247
6248 blk_start_plug(&plug);
6249 handled = 0;
6250 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6251 while (1) {
6252 struct bio *bio;
6253 int batch_size, released;
6254 unsigned int offset;
6255
6256 released = release_stripe_list(conf, conf->temp_inactive_list);
6257 if (released)
6258 clear_bit(R5_DID_ALLOC, &conf->cache_state);
6259
6260 if (
6261 !list_empty(&conf->bitmap_list)) {
6262 /* Now is a good time to flush some bitmap updates */
6263 conf->seq_flush++;
6264 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6265 bitmap_unplug(mddev->bitmap);
6266 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6267 conf->seq_write = conf->seq_flush;
6268 activate_bit_delay(conf, conf->temp_inactive_list);
6269 }
6270 raid5_activate_delayed(conf);
6271
6272 while ((bio = remove_bio_from_retry(conf, &offset))) {
6273 int ok;
6274 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6275 ok = retry_aligned_read(conf, bio, offset);
6276 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6277 if (!ok)
6278 break;
6279 handled++;
6280 }
6281
6282 batch_size = handle_active_stripes(conf, ANY_GROUP, NULL,
6283 conf->temp_inactive_list);
6284 if (!batch_size && !released)
6285 break;
6286 handled += batch_size;
6287
6288 if (mddev->sb_flags & ~(1 << MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING)) {
6289 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6290 md_check_recovery(mddev);
6291 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6292 }
6293 }
6294 pr_debug("%d stripes handled\n", handled);
6295
6296 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6297 if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_ALLOC_MORE, &conf->cache_state) &&
6298 mutex_trylock(&conf->cache_size_mutex)) {
6299 grow_one_stripe(conf, __GFP_NOWARN);
6300 /* Set flag even if allocation failed. This helps
6301 * slow down allocation requests when mem is short
6302 */
6303 set_bit(R5_DID_ALLOC, &conf->cache_state);
6304 mutex_unlock(&conf->cache_size_mutex);
6305 }
6306
6307 flush_deferred_bios(conf);
6308
6309 r5l_flush_stripe_to_raid(conf->log);
6310
6311 async_tx_issue_pending_all();
6312 blk_finish_plug(&plug);
6313
6314 pr_debug("--- raid5d inactive\n");
6315}
6316
6317static ssize_t
6318raid5_show_stripe_cache_size(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
6319{
6320 struct r5conf *conf;
6321 int ret = 0;
6322 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
6323 conf = mddev->private;
6324 if (conf)
6325 ret = sprintf(page, "%d\n", conf->min_nr_stripes);
6326 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
6327 return ret;
6328}
6329
6330int
6331raid5_set_cache_size(struct mddev *mddev, int size)
6332{
6333 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
6334
6335 if (size <= 16 || size > 32768)
6336 return -EINVAL;
6337
6338 conf->min_nr_stripes = size;
6339 mutex_lock(&conf->cache_size_mutex);
6340 while (size < conf->max_nr_stripes &&
6341 drop_one_stripe(conf))
6342 ;
6343 mutex_unlock(&conf->cache_size_mutex);
6344
6345 md_allow_write(mddev);
6346
6347 mutex_lock(&conf->cache_size_mutex);
6348 while (size > conf->max_nr_stripes)
6349 if (!grow_one_stripe(conf, GFP_KERNEL))
6350 break;
6351 mutex_unlock(&conf->cache_size_mutex);
6352
6353 return 0;
6354}
6355EXPORT_SYMBOL(raid5_set_cache_size);
6356
6357static ssize_t
6358raid5_store_stripe_cache_size(struct mddev *mddev, const char *page, size_t len)
6359{
6360 struct r5conf *conf;
6361 unsigned long new;
6362 int err;
6363
6364 if (len >= PAGE_SIZE)
6365 return -EINVAL;
6366 if (kstrtoul(page, 10, &new))
6367 return -EINVAL;
6368 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
6369 if (err)
6370 return err;
6371 conf = mddev->private;
6372 if (!conf)
6373 err = -ENODEV;
6374 else
6375 err = raid5_set_cache_size(mddev, new);
6376 mddev_unlock(mddev);
6377
6378 return err ?: len;
6379}
6380
6381static struct md_sysfs_entry
6382raid5_stripecache_size = __ATTR(stripe_cache_size, S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR,
6383 raid5_show_stripe_cache_size,
6384 raid5_store_stripe_cache_size);
6385
6386static ssize_t
6387raid5_show_rmw_level(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
6388{
6389 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
6390 if (conf)
6391 return sprintf(page, "%d\n", conf->rmw_level);
6392 else
6393 return 0;
6394}
6395
6396static ssize_t
6397raid5_store_rmw_level(struct mddev *mddev, const char *page, size_t len)
6398{
6399 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
6400 unsigned long new;
6401
6402 if (!conf)
6403 return -ENODEV;
6404
6405 if (len >= PAGE_SIZE)
6406 return -EINVAL;
6407
6408 if (kstrtoul(page, 10, &new))
6409 return -EINVAL;
6410
6411 if (new != PARITY_DISABLE_RMW && !raid6_call.xor_syndrome)
6412 return -EINVAL;
6413
6414 if (new != PARITY_DISABLE_RMW &&
6415 new != PARITY_ENABLE_RMW &&
6416 new != PARITY_PREFER_RMW)
6417 return -EINVAL;
6418
6419 conf->rmw_level = new;
6420 return len;
6421}
6422
6423static struct md_sysfs_entry
6424raid5_rmw_level = __ATTR(rmw_level, S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR,
6425 raid5_show_rmw_level,
6426 raid5_store_rmw_level);
6427
6428
6429static ssize_t
6430raid5_show_preread_threshold(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
6431{
6432 struct r5conf *conf;
6433 int ret = 0;
6434 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
6435 conf = mddev->private;
6436 if (conf)
6437 ret = sprintf(page, "%d\n", conf->bypass_threshold);
6438 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
6439 return ret;
6440}
6441
6442static ssize_t
6443raid5_store_preread_threshold(struct mddev *mddev, const char *page, size_t len)
6444{
6445 struct r5conf *conf;
6446 unsigned long new;
6447 int err;
6448
6449 if (len >= PAGE_SIZE)
6450 return -EINVAL;
6451 if (kstrtoul(page, 10, &new))
6452 return -EINVAL;
6453
6454 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
6455 if (err)
6456 return err;
6457 conf = mddev->private;
6458 if (!conf)
6459 err = -ENODEV;
6460 else if (new > conf->min_nr_stripes)
6461 err = -EINVAL;
6462 else
6463 conf->bypass_threshold = new;
6464 mddev_unlock(mddev);
6465 return err ?: len;
6466}
6467
6468static struct md_sysfs_entry
6469raid5_preread_bypass_threshold = __ATTR(preread_bypass_threshold,
6470 S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR,
6471 raid5_show_preread_threshold,
6472 raid5_store_preread_threshold);
6473
6474static ssize_t
6475raid5_show_skip_copy(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
6476{
6477 struct r5conf *conf;
6478 int ret = 0;
6479 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
6480 conf = mddev->private;
6481 if (conf)
6482 ret = sprintf(page, "%d\n", conf->skip_copy);
6483 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
6484 return ret;
6485}
6486
6487static ssize_t
6488raid5_store_skip_copy(struct mddev *mddev, const char *page, size_t len)
6489{
6490 struct r5conf *conf;
6491 unsigned long new;
6492 int err;
6493
6494 if (len >= PAGE_SIZE)
6495 return -EINVAL;
6496 if (kstrtoul(page, 10, &new))
6497 return -EINVAL;
6498 new = !!new;
6499
6500 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
6501 if (err)
6502 return err;
6503 conf = mddev->private;
6504 if (!conf)
6505 err = -ENODEV;
6506 else if (new != conf->skip_copy) {
6507 mddev_suspend(mddev);
6508 conf->skip_copy = new;
6509 if (new)
6510 mddev->queue->backing_dev_info->capabilities |=
6511 BDI_CAP_STABLE_WRITES;
6512 else
6513 mddev->queue->backing_dev_info->capabilities &=
6514 ~BDI_CAP_STABLE_WRITES;
6515 mddev_resume(mddev);
6516 }
6517 mddev_unlock(mddev);
6518 return err ?: len;
6519}
6520
6521static struct md_sysfs_entry
6522raid5_skip_copy = __ATTR(skip_copy, S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR,
6523 raid5_show_skip_copy,
6524 raid5_store_skip_copy);
6525
6526static ssize_t
6527stripe_cache_active_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
6528{
6529 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
6530 if (conf)
6531 return sprintf(page, "%d\n", atomic_read(&conf->active_stripes));
6532 else
6533 return 0;
6534}
6535
6536static struct md_sysfs_entry
6537raid5_stripecache_active = __ATTR_RO(stripe_cache_active);
6538
6539static ssize_t
6540raid5_show_group_thread_cnt(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
6541{
6542 struct r5conf *conf;
6543 int ret = 0;
6544 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
6545 conf = mddev->private;
6546 if (conf)
6547 ret = sprintf(page, "%d\n", conf->worker_cnt_per_group);
6548 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
6549 return ret;
6550}
6551
6552static int alloc_thread_groups(struct r5conf *conf, int cnt,
6553 int *group_cnt,
6554 int *worker_cnt_per_group,
6555 struct r5worker_group **worker_groups);
6556static ssize_t
6557raid5_store_group_thread_cnt(struct mddev *mddev, const char *page, size_t len)
6558{
6559 struct r5conf *conf;
6560 unsigned int new;
6561 int err;
6562 struct r5worker_group *new_groups, *old_groups;
6563 int group_cnt, worker_cnt_per_group;
6564
6565 if (len >= PAGE_SIZE)
6566 return -EINVAL;
6567 if (kstrtouint(page, 10, &new))
6568 return -EINVAL;
6569 /* 8192 should be big enough */
6570 if (new > 8192)
6571 return -EINVAL;
6572
6573 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
6574 if (err)
6575 return err;
6576 conf = mddev->private;
6577 if (!conf)
6578 err = -ENODEV;
6579 else if (new != conf->worker_cnt_per_group) {
6580 mddev_suspend(mddev);
6581
6582 old_groups = conf->worker_groups;
6583 if (old_groups)
6584 flush_workqueue(raid5_wq);
6585
6586 err = alloc_thread_groups(conf, new,
6587 &group_cnt, &worker_cnt_per_group,
6588 &new_groups);
6589 if (!err) {
6590 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6591 conf->group_cnt = group_cnt;
6592 conf->worker_cnt_per_group = worker_cnt_per_group;
6593 conf->worker_groups = new_groups;
6594 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
6595
6596 if (old_groups)
6597 kfree(old_groups[0].workers);
6598 kfree(old_groups);
6599 }
6600 mddev_resume(mddev);
6601 }
6602 mddev_unlock(mddev);
6603
6604 return err ?: len;
6605}
6606
6607static struct md_sysfs_entry
6608raid5_group_thread_cnt = __ATTR(group_thread_cnt, S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR,
6609 raid5_show_group_thread_cnt,
6610 raid5_store_group_thread_cnt);
6611
6612static struct attribute *raid5_attrs[] = {
6613 &raid5_stripecache_size.attr,
6614 &raid5_stripecache_active.attr,
6615 &raid5_preread_bypass_threshold.attr,
6616 &raid5_group_thread_cnt.attr,
6617 &raid5_skip_copy.attr,
6618 &raid5_rmw_level.attr,
6619 &r5c_journal_mode.attr,
6620 NULL,
6621};
6622static struct attribute_group raid5_attrs_group = {
6623 .name = NULL,
6624 .attrs = raid5_attrs,
6625};
6626
6627static int alloc_thread_groups(struct r5conf *conf, int cnt,
6628 int *group_cnt,
6629 int *worker_cnt_per_group,
6630 struct r5worker_group **worker_groups)
6631{
6632 int i, j, k;
6633 ssize_t size;
6634 struct r5worker *workers;
6635
6636 *worker_cnt_per_group = cnt;
6637 if (cnt == 0) {
6638 *group_cnt = 0;
6639 *worker_groups = NULL;
6640 return 0;
6641 }
6642 *group_cnt = num_possible_nodes();
6643 size = sizeof(struct r5worker) * cnt;
6644 workers = kzalloc(size * *group_cnt, GFP_NOIO);
6645 *worker_groups = kzalloc(sizeof(struct r5worker_group) *
6646 *group_cnt, GFP_NOIO);
6647 if (!*worker_groups || !workers) {
6648 kfree(workers);
6649 kfree(*worker_groups);
6650 return -ENOMEM;
6651 }
6652
6653 for (i = 0; i < *group_cnt; i++) {
6654 struct r5worker_group *group;
6655
6656 group = &(*worker_groups)[i];
6657 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&group->handle_list);
6658 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&group->loprio_list);
6659 group->conf = conf;
6660 group->workers = workers + i * cnt;
6661
6662 for (j = 0; j < cnt; j++) {
6663 struct r5worker *worker = group->workers + j;
6664 worker->group = group;
6665 INIT_WORK(&worker->work, raid5_do_work);
6666
6667 for (k = 0; k < NR_STRIPE_HASH_LOCKS; k++)
6668 INIT_LIST_HEAD(worker->temp_inactive_list + k);
6669 }
6670 }
6671
6672 return 0;
6673}
6674
6675static void free_thread_groups(struct r5conf *conf)
6676{
6677 if (conf->worker_groups)
6678 kfree(conf->worker_groups[0].workers);
6679 kfree(conf->worker_groups);
6680 conf->worker_groups = NULL;
6681}
6682
6683static sector_t
6684raid5_size(struct mddev *mddev, sector_t sectors, int raid_disks)
6685{
6686 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
6687
6688 if (!sectors)
6689 sectors = mddev->dev_sectors;
6690 if (!raid_disks)
6691 /* size is defined by the smallest of previous and new size */
6692 raid_disks = min(conf->raid_disks, conf->previous_raid_disks);
6693
6694 sectors &= ~((sector_t)conf->chunk_sectors - 1);
6695 sectors &= ~((sector_t)conf->prev_chunk_sectors - 1);
6696 return sectors * (raid_disks - conf->max_degraded);
6697}
6698
6699static void free_scratch_buffer(struct r5conf *conf, struct raid5_percpu *percpu)
6700{
6701 safe_put_page(percpu->spare_page);
6702 if (percpu->scribble)
6703 flex_array_free(percpu->scribble);
6704 percpu->spare_page = NULL;
6705 percpu->scribble = NULL;
6706}
6707
6708static int alloc_scratch_buffer(struct r5conf *conf, struct raid5_percpu *percpu)
6709{
6710 if (conf->level == 6 && !percpu->spare_page)
6711 percpu->spare_page = alloc_page(GFP_KERNEL);
6712 if (!percpu->scribble)
6713 percpu->scribble = scribble_alloc(max(conf->raid_disks,
6714 conf->previous_raid_disks),
6715 max(conf->chunk_sectors,
6716 conf->prev_chunk_sectors)
6717 / STRIPE_SECTORS,
6718 GFP_KERNEL);
6719
6720 if (!percpu->scribble || (conf->level == 6 && !percpu->spare_page)) {
6721 free_scratch_buffer(conf, percpu);
6722 return -ENOMEM;
6723 }
6724
6725 return 0;
6726}
6727
6728static int raid456_cpu_dead(unsigned int cpu, struct hlist_node *node)
6729{
6730 struct r5conf *conf = hlist_entry_safe(node, struct r5conf, node);
6731
6732 free_scratch_buffer(conf, per_cpu_ptr(conf->percpu, cpu));
6733 return 0;
6734}
6735
6736static void raid5_free_percpu(struct r5conf *conf)
6737{
6738 if (!conf->percpu)
6739 return;
6740
6741 cpuhp_state_remove_instance(CPUHP_MD_RAID5_PREPARE, &conf->node);
6742 free_percpu(conf->percpu);
6743}
6744
6745static void free_conf(struct r5conf *conf)
6746{
6747 int i;
6748
6749 log_exit(conf);
6750
6751 if (conf->shrinker.nr_deferred)
6752 unregister_shrinker(&conf->shrinker);
6753
6754 free_thread_groups(conf);
6755 shrink_stripes(conf);
6756 raid5_free_percpu(conf);
6757 for (i = 0; i < conf->pool_size; i++)
6758 if (conf->disks[i].extra_page)
6759 put_page(conf->disks[i].extra_page);
6760 kfree(conf->disks);
6761 if (conf->bio_split)
6762 bioset_free(conf->bio_split);
6763 kfree(conf->stripe_hashtbl);
6764 kfree(conf->pending_data);
6765 kfree(conf);
6766}
6767
6768static int raid456_cpu_up_prepare(unsigned int cpu, struct hlist_node *node)
6769{
6770 struct r5conf *conf = hlist_entry_safe(node, struct r5conf, node);
6771 struct raid5_percpu *percpu = per_cpu_ptr(conf->percpu, cpu);
6772
6773 if (alloc_scratch_buffer(conf, percpu)) {
6774 pr_warn("%s: failed memory allocation for cpu%u\n",
6775 __func__, cpu);
6776 return -ENOMEM;
6777 }
6778 return 0;
6779}
6780
6781static int raid5_alloc_percpu(struct r5conf *conf)
6782{
6783 int err = 0;
6784
6785 conf->percpu = alloc_percpu(struct raid5_percpu);
6786 if (!conf->percpu)
6787 return -ENOMEM;
6788
6789 err = cpuhp_state_add_instance(CPUHP_MD_RAID5_PREPARE, &conf->node);
6790 if (!err) {
6791 conf->scribble_disks = max(conf->raid_disks,
6792 conf->previous_raid_disks);
6793 conf->scribble_sectors = max(conf->chunk_sectors,
6794 conf->prev_chunk_sectors);
6795 }
6796 return err;
6797}
6798
6799static unsigned long raid5_cache_scan(struct shrinker *shrink,
6800 struct shrink_control *sc)
6801{
6802 struct r5conf *conf = container_of(shrink, struct r5conf, shrinker);
6803 unsigned long ret = SHRINK_STOP;
6804
6805 if (mutex_trylock(&conf->cache_size_mutex)) {
6806 ret= 0;
6807 while (ret < sc->nr_to_scan &&
6808 conf->max_nr_stripes > conf->min_nr_stripes) {
6809 if (drop_one_stripe(conf) == 0) {
6810 ret = SHRINK_STOP;
6811 break;
6812 }
6813 ret++;
6814 }
6815 mutex_unlock(&conf->cache_size_mutex);
6816 }
6817 return ret;
6818}
6819
6820static unsigned long raid5_cache_count(struct shrinker *shrink,
6821 struct shrink_control *sc)
6822{
6823 struct r5conf *conf = container_of(shrink, struct r5conf, shrinker);
6824
6825 if (conf->max_nr_stripes < conf->min_nr_stripes)
6826 /* unlikely, but not impossible */
6827 return 0;
6828 return conf->max_nr_stripes - conf->min_nr_stripes;
6829}
6830
6831static struct r5conf *setup_conf(struct mddev *mddev)
6832{
6833 struct r5conf *conf;
6834 int raid_disk, memory, max_disks;
6835 struct md_rdev *rdev;
6836 struct disk_info *disk;
6837 char pers_name[6];
6838 int i;
6839 int group_cnt, worker_cnt_per_group;
6840 struct r5worker_group *new_group;
6841
6842 if (mddev->new_level != 5
6843 && mddev->new_level != 4
6844 && mddev->new_level != 6) {
6845 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: raid level not set to 4/5/6 (%d)\n",
6846 mdname(mddev), mddev->new_level);
6847 return ERR_PTR(-EIO);
6848 }
6849 if ((mddev->new_level == 5
6850 && !algorithm_valid_raid5(mddev->new_layout)) ||
6851 (mddev->new_level == 6
6852 && !algorithm_valid_raid6(mddev->new_layout))) {
6853 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: layout %d not supported\n",
6854 mdname(mddev), mddev->new_layout);
6855 return ERR_PTR(-EIO);
6856 }
6857 if (mddev->new_level == 6 && mddev->raid_disks < 4) {
6858 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: not enough configured devices (%d, minimum 4)\n",
6859 mdname(mddev), mddev->raid_disks);
6860 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
6861 }
6862
6863 if (!mddev->new_chunk_sectors ||
6864 (mddev->new_chunk_sectors << 9) % PAGE_SIZE ||
6865 !is_power_of_2(mddev->new_chunk_sectors)) {
6866 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: invalid chunk size %d\n",
6867 mdname(mddev), mddev->new_chunk_sectors << 9);
6868 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
6869 }
6870
6871 conf = kzalloc(sizeof(struct r5conf), GFP_KERNEL);
6872 if (conf == NULL)
6873 goto abort;
6874 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->free_list);
6875 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->pending_list);
6876 conf->pending_data = kzalloc(sizeof(struct r5pending_data) *
6877 PENDING_IO_MAX, GFP_KERNEL);
6878 if (!conf->pending_data)
6879 goto abort;
6880 for (i = 0; i < PENDING_IO_MAX; i++)
6881 list_add(&conf->pending_data[i].sibling, &conf->free_list);
6882 /* Don't enable multi-threading by default*/
6883 if (!alloc_thread_groups(conf, 0, &group_cnt, &worker_cnt_per_group,
6884 &new_group)) {
6885 conf->group_cnt = group_cnt;
6886 conf->worker_cnt_per_group = worker_cnt_per_group;
6887 conf->worker_groups = new_group;
6888 } else
6889 goto abort;
6890 spin_lock_init(&conf->device_lock);
6891 seqcount_init(&conf->gen_lock);
6892 mutex_init(&conf->cache_size_mutex);
6893 init_waitqueue_head(&conf->wait_for_quiescent);
6894 init_waitqueue_head(&conf->wait_for_stripe);
6895 init_waitqueue_head(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
6896 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->handle_list);
6897 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->loprio_list);
6898 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->hold_list);
6899 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->delayed_list);
6900 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->bitmap_list);
6901 init_llist_head(&conf->released_stripes);
6902 atomic_set(&conf->active_stripes, 0);
6903 atomic_set(&conf->preread_active_stripes, 0);
6904 atomic_set(&conf->active_aligned_reads, 0);
6905 spin_lock_init(&conf->pending_bios_lock);
6906 conf->batch_bio_dispatch = true;
6907 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
6908 if (test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags))
6909 continue;
6910 if (blk_queue_nonrot(bdev_get_queue(rdev->bdev))) {
6911 conf->batch_bio_dispatch = false;
6912 break;
6913 }
6914 }
6915
6916 conf->bypass_threshold = BYPASS_THRESHOLD;
6917 conf->recovery_disabled = mddev->recovery_disabled - 1;
6918
6919 conf->raid_disks = mddev->raid_disks;
6920 if (mddev->reshape_position == MaxSector)
6921 conf->previous_raid_disks = mddev->raid_disks;
6922 else
6923 conf->previous_raid_disks = mddev->raid_disks - mddev->delta_disks;
6924 max_disks = max(conf->raid_disks, conf->previous_raid_disks);
6925
6926 conf->disks = kzalloc(max_disks * sizeof(struct disk_info),
6927 GFP_KERNEL);
6928
6929 if (!conf->disks)
6930 goto abort;
6931
6932 for (i = 0; i < max_disks; i++) {
6933 conf->disks[i].extra_page = alloc_page(GFP_KERNEL);
6934 if (!conf->disks[i].extra_page)
6935 goto abort;
6936 }
6937
6938 conf->bio_split = bioset_create(BIO_POOL_SIZE, 0, 0);
6939 if (!conf->bio_split)
6940 goto abort;
6941 conf->mddev = mddev;
6942
6943 if ((conf->stripe_hashtbl = kzalloc(PAGE_SIZE, GFP_KERNEL)) == NULL)
6944 goto abort;
6945
6946 /* We init hash_locks[0] separately to that it can be used
6947 * as the reference lock in the spin_lock_nest_lock() call
6948 * in lock_all_device_hash_locks_irq in order to convince
6949 * lockdep that we know what we are doing.
6950 */
6951 spin_lock_init(conf->hash_locks);
6952 for (i = 1; i < NR_STRIPE_HASH_LOCKS; i++)
6953 spin_lock_init(conf->hash_locks + i);
6954
6955 for (i = 0; i < NR_STRIPE_HASH_LOCKS; i++)
6956 INIT_LIST_HEAD(conf->inactive_list + i);
6957
6958 for (i = 0; i < NR_STRIPE_HASH_LOCKS; i++)
6959 INIT_LIST_HEAD(conf->temp_inactive_list + i);
6960
6961 atomic_set(&conf->r5c_cached_full_stripes, 0);
6962 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->r5c_full_stripe_list);
6963 atomic_set(&conf->r5c_cached_partial_stripes, 0);
6964 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->r5c_partial_stripe_list);
6965 atomic_set(&conf->r5c_flushing_full_stripes, 0);
6966 atomic_set(&conf->r5c_flushing_partial_stripes, 0);
6967
6968 conf->level = mddev->new_level;
6969 conf->chunk_sectors = mddev->new_chunk_sectors;
6970 if (raid5_alloc_percpu(conf) != 0)
6971 goto abort;
6972
6973 pr_debug("raid456: run(%s) called.\n", mdname(mddev));
6974
6975 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
6976 raid_disk = rdev->raid_disk;
6977 if (raid_disk >= max_disks
6978 || raid_disk < 0 || test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags))
6979 continue;
6980 disk = conf->disks + raid_disk;
6981
6982 if (test_bit(Replacement, &rdev->flags)) {
6983 if (disk->replacement)
6984 goto abort;
6985 disk->replacement = rdev;
6986 } else {
6987 if (disk->rdev)
6988 goto abort;
6989 disk->rdev = rdev;
6990 }
6991
6992 if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags)) {
6993 char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
6994 pr_info("md/raid:%s: device %s operational as raid disk %d\n",
6995 mdname(mddev), bdevname(rdev->bdev, b), raid_disk);
6996 } else if (rdev->saved_raid_disk != raid_disk)
6997 /* Cannot rely on bitmap to complete recovery */
6998 conf->fullsync = 1;
6999 }
7000
7001 conf->level = mddev->new_level;
7002 if (conf->level == 6) {
7003 conf->max_degraded = 2;
7004 if (raid6_call.xor_syndrome)
7005 conf->rmw_level = PARITY_ENABLE_RMW;
7006 else
7007 conf->rmw_level = PARITY_DISABLE_RMW;
7008 } else {
7009 conf->max_degraded = 1;
7010 conf->rmw_level = PARITY_ENABLE_RMW;
7011 }
7012 conf->algorithm = mddev->new_layout;
7013 conf->reshape_progress = mddev->reshape_position;
7014 if (conf->reshape_progress != MaxSector) {
7015 conf->prev_chunk_sectors = mddev->chunk_sectors;
7016 conf->prev_algo = mddev->layout;
7017 } else {
7018 conf->prev_chunk_sectors = conf->chunk_sectors;
7019 conf->prev_algo = conf->algorithm;
7020 }
7021
7022 conf->min_nr_stripes = NR_STRIPES;
7023 if (mddev->reshape_position != MaxSector) {
7024 int stripes = max_t(int,
7025 ((mddev->chunk_sectors << 9) / STRIPE_SIZE) * 4,
7026 ((mddev->new_chunk_sectors << 9) / STRIPE_SIZE) * 4);
7027 conf->min_nr_stripes = max(NR_STRIPES, stripes);
7028 if (conf->min_nr_stripes != NR_STRIPES)
7029 pr_info("md/raid:%s: force stripe size %d for reshape\n",
7030 mdname(mddev), conf->min_nr_stripes);
7031 }
7032 memory = conf->min_nr_stripes * (sizeof(struct stripe_head) +
7033 max_disks * ((sizeof(struct bio) + PAGE_SIZE))) / 1024;
7034 atomic_set(&conf->empty_inactive_list_nr, NR_STRIPE_HASH_LOCKS);
7035 if (grow_stripes(conf, conf->min_nr_stripes)) {
7036 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: couldn't allocate %dkB for buffers\n",
7037 mdname(mddev), memory);
7038 goto abort;
7039 } else
7040 pr_debug("md/raid:%s: allocated %dkB\n", mdname(mddev), memory);
7041 /*
7042 * Losing a stripe head costs more than the time to refill it,
7043 * it reduces the queue depth and so can hurt throughput.
7044 * So set it rather large, scaled by number of devices.
7045 */
7046 conf->shrinker.seeks = DEFAULT_SEEKS * conf->raid_disks * 4;
7047 conf->shrinker.scan_objects = raid5_cache_scan;
7048 conf->shrinker.count_objects = raid5_cache_count;
7049 conf->shrinker.batch = 128;
7050 conf->shrinker.flags = 0;
7051 if (register_shrinker(&conf->shrinker)) {
7052 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: couldn't register shrinker.\n",
7053 mdname(mddev));
7054 goto abort;
7055 }
7056
7057 sprintf(pers_name, "raid%d", mddev->new_level);
7058 conf->thread = md_register_thread(raid5d, mddev, pers_name);
7059 if (!conf->thread) {
7060 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: couldn't allocate thread.\n",
7061 mdname(mddev));
7062 goto abort;
7063 }
7064
7065 return conf;
7066
7067 abort:
7068 if (conf) {
7069 free_conf(conf);
7070 return ERR_PTR(-EIO);
7071 } else
7072 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
7073}
7074
7075static int only_parity(int raid_disk, int algo, int raid_disks, int max_degraded)
7076{
7077 switch (algo) {
7078 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0:
7079 if (raid_disk < max_degraded)
7080 return 1;
7081 break;
7082 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_N:
7083 if (raid_disk >= raid_disks - max_degraded)
7084 return 1;
7085 break;
7086 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0_6:
7087 if (raid_disk == 0 ||
7088 raid_disk == raid_disks - 1)
7089 return 1;
7090 break;
7091 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
7092 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
7093 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC_6:
7094 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC_6:
7095 if (raid_disk == raid_disks - 1)
7096 return 1;
7097 }
7098 return 0;
7099}
7100
7101static int raid5_run(struct mddev *mddev)
7102{
7103 struct r5conf *conf;
7104 int working_disks = 0;
7105 int dirty_parity_disks = 0;
7106 struct md_rdev *rdev;
7107 struct md_rdev *journal_dev = NULL;
7108 sector_t reshape_offset = 0;
7109 int i;
7110 long long min_offset_diff = 0;
7111 int first = 1;
7112
7113 if (mddev_init_writes_pending(mddev) < 0)
7114 return -ENOMEM;
7115
7116 if (mddev->recovery_cp != MaxSector)
7117 pr_notice("md/raid:%s: not clean -- starting background reconstruction\n",
7118 mdname(mddev));
7119
7120 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
7121 long long diff;
7122
7123 if (test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags)) {
7124 journal_dev = rdev;
7125 continue;
7126 }
7127 if (rdev->raid_disk < 0)
7128 continue;
7129 diff = (rdev->new_data_offset - rdev->data_offset);
7130 if (first) {
7131 min_offset_diff = diff;
7132 first = 0;
7133 } else if (mddev->reshape_backwards &&
7134 diff < min_offset_diff)
7135 min_offset_diff = diff;
7136 else if (!mddev->reshape_backwards &&
7137 diff > min_offset_diff)
7138 min_offset_diff = diff;
7139 }
7140
7141 if ((test_bit(MD_HAS_JOURNAL, &mddev->flags) || journal_dev) &&
7142 (mddev->bitmap_info.offset || mddev->bitmap_info.file)) {
7143 pr_notice("md/raid:%s: array cannot have both journal and bitmap\n",
7144 mdname(mddev));
7145 return -EINVAL;
7146 }
7147
7148 if (mddev->reshape_position != MaxSector) {
7149 /* Check that we can continue the reshape.
7150 * Difficulties arise if the stripe we would write to
7151 * next is at or after the stripe we would read from next.
7152 * For a reshape that changes the number of devices, this
7153 * is only possible for a very short time, and mdadm makes
7154 * sure that time appears to have past before assembling
7155 * the array. So we fail if that time hasn't passed.
7156 * For a reshape that keeps the number of devices the same
7157 * mdadm must be monitoring the reshape can keeping the
7158 * critical areas read-only and backed up. It will start
7159 * the array in read-only mode, so we check for that.
7160 */
7161 sector_t here_new, here_old;
7162 int old_disks;
7163 int max_degraded = (mddev->level == 6 ? 2 : 1);
7164 int chunk_sectors;
7165 int new_data_disks;
7166
7167 if (journal_dev) {
7168 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: don't support reshape with journal - aborting.\n",
7169 mdname(mddev));
7170 return -EINVAL;
7171 }
7172
7173 if (mddev->new_level != mddev->level) {
7174 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: unsupported reshape required - aborting.\n",
7175 mdname(mddev));
7176 return -EINVAL;
7177 }
7178 old_disks = mddev->raid_disks - mddev->delta_disks;
7179 /* reshape_position must be on a new-stripe boundary, and one
7180 * further up in new geometry must map after here in old
7181 * geometry.
7182 * If the chunk sizes are different, then as we perform reshape
7183 * in units of the largest of the two, reshape_position needs
7184 * be a multiple of the largest chunk size times new data disks.
7185 */
7186 here_new = mddev->reshape_position;
7187 chunk_sectors = max(mddev->chunk_sectors, mddev->new_chunk_sectors);
7188 new_data_disks = mddev->raid_disks - max_degraded;
7189 if (sector_div(here_new, chunk_sectors * new_data_disks)) {
7190 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: reshape_position not on a stripe boundary\n",
7191 mdname(mddev));
7192 return -EINVAL;
7193 }
7194 reshape_offset = here_new * chunk_sectors;
7195 /* here_new is the stripe we will write to */
7196 here_old = mddev->reshape_position;
7197 sector_div(here_old, chunk_sectors * (old_disks-max_degraded));
7198 /* here_old is the first stripe that we might need to read
7199 * from */
7200 if (mddev->delta_disks == 0) {
7201 /* We cannot be sure it is safe to start an in-place
7202 * reshape. It is only safe if user-space is monitoring
7203 * and taking constant backups.
7204 * mdadm always starts a situation like this in
7205 * readonly mode so it can take control before
7206 * allowing any writes. So just check for that.
7207 */
7208 if (abs(min_offset_diff) >= mddev->chunk_sectors &&
7209 abs(min_offset_diff) >= mddev->new_chunk_sectors)
7210 /* not really in-place - so OK */;
7211 else if (mddev->ro == 0) {
7212 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: in-place reshape must be started in read-only mode - aborting\n",
7213 mdname(mddev));
7214 return -EINVAL;
7215 }
7216 } else if (mddev->reshape_backwards
7217 ? (here_new * chunk_sectors + min_offset_diff <=
7218 here_old * chunk_sectors)
7219 : (here_new * chunk_sectors >=
7220 here_old * chunk_sectors + (-min_offset_diff))) {
7221 /* Reading from the same stripe as writing to - bad */
7222 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: reshape_position too early for auto-recovery - aborting.\n",
7223 mdname(mddev));
7224 return -EINVAL;
7225 }
7226 pr_debug("md/raid:%s: reshape will continue\n", mdname(mddev));
7227 /* OK, we should be able to continue; */
7228 } else {
7229 BUG_ON(mddev->level != mddev->new_level);
7230 BUG_ON(mddev->layout != mddev->new_layout);
7231 BUG_ON(mddev->chunk_sectors != mddev->new_chunk_sectors);
7232 BUG_ON(mddev->delta_disks != 0);
7233 }
7234
7235 if (test_bit(MD_HAS_JOURNAL, &mddev->flags) &&
7236 test_bit(MD_HAS_PPL, &mddev->flags)) {
7237 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: using journal device and PPL not allowed - disabling PPL\n",
7238 mdname(mddev));
7239 clear_bit(MD_HAS_PPL, &mddev->flags);
7240 clear_bit(MD_HAS_MULTIPLE_PPLS, &mddev->flags);
7241 }
7242
7243 if (mddev->private == NULL)
7244 conf = setup_conf(mddev);
7245 else
7246 conf = mddev->private;
7247
7248 if (IS_ERR(conf))
7249 return PTR_ERR(conf);
7250
7251 if (test_bit(MD_HAS_JOURNAL, &mddev->flags)) {
7252 if (!journal_dev) {
7253 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: journal disk is missing, force array readonly\n",
7254 mdname(mddev));
7255 mddev->ro = 1;
7256 set_disk_ro(mddev->gendisk, 1);
7257 } else if (mddev->recovery_cp == MaxSector)
7258 set_bit(MD_JOURNAL_CLEAN, &mddev->flags);
7259 }
7260
7261 conf->min_offset_diff = min_offset_diff;
7262 mddev->thread = conf->thread;
7263 conf->thread = NULL;
7264 mddev->private = conf;
7265
7266 for (i = 0; i < conf->raid_disks && conf->previous_raid_disks;
7267 i++) {
7268 rdev = conf->disks[i].rdev;
7269 if (!rdev && conf->disks[i].replacement) {
7270 /* The replacement is all we have yet */
7271 rdev = conf->disks[i].replacement;
7272 conf->disks[i].replacement = NULL;
7273 clear_bit(Replacement, &rdev->flags);
7274 conf->disks[i].rdev = rdev;
7275 }
7276 if (!rdev)
7277 continue;
7278 if (conf->disks[i].replacement &&
7279 conf->reshape_progress != MaxSector) {
7280 /* replacements and reshape simply do not mix. */
7281 pr_warn("md: cannot handle concurrent replacement and reshape.\n");
7282 goto abort;
7283 }
7284 if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags)) {
7285 working_disks++;
7286 continue;
7287 }
7288 /* This disc is not fully in-sync. However if it
7289 * just stored parity (beyond the recovery_offset),
7290 * when we don't need to be concerned about the
7291 * array being dirty.
7292 * When reshape goes 'backwards', we never have
7293 * partially completed devices, so we only need
7294 * to worry about reshape going forwards.
7295 */
7296 /* Hack because v0.91 doesn't store recovery_offset properly. */
7297 if (mddev->major_version == 0 &&
7298 mddev->minor_version > 90)
7299 rdev->recovery_offset = reshape_offset;
7300
7301 if (rdev->recovery_offset < reshape_offset) {
7302 /* We need to check old and new layout */
7303 if (!only_parity(rdev->raid_disk,
7304 conf->algorithm,
7305 conf->raid_disks,
7306 conf->max_degraded))
7307 continue;
7308 }
7309 if (!only_parity(rdev->raid_disk,
7310 conf->prev_algo,
7311 conf->previous_raid_disks,
7312 conf->max_degraded))
7313 continue;
7314 dirty_parity_disks++;
7315 }
7316
7317 /*
7318 * 0 for a fully functional array, 1 or 2 for a degraded array.
7319 */
7320 mddev->degraded = raid5_calc_degraded(conf);
7321
7322 if (has_failed(conf)) {
7323 pr_crit("md/raid:%s: not enough operational devices (%d/%d failed)\n",
7324 mdname(mddev), mddev->degraded, conf->raid_disks);
7325 goto abort;
7326 }
7327
7328 /* device size must be a multiple of chunk size */
7329 mddev->dev_sectors &= ~(mddev->chunk_sectors - 1);
7330 mddev->resync_max_sectors = mddev->dev_sectors;
7331
7332 if (mddev->degraded > dirty_parity_disks &&
7333 mddev->recovery_cp != MaxSector) {
7334 if (test_bit(MD_HAS_PPL, &mddev->flags))
7335 pr_crit("md/raid:%s: starting dirty degraded array with PPL.\n",
7336 mdname(mddev));
7337 else if (mddev->ok_start_degraded)
7338 pr_crit("md/raid:%s: starting dirty degraded array - data corruption possible.\n",
7339 mdname(mddev));
7340 else {
7341 pr_crit("md/raid:%s: cannot start dirty degraded array.\n",
7342 mdname(mddev));
7343 goto abort;
7344 }
7345 }
7346
7347 pr_info("md/raid:%s: raid level %d active with %d out of %d devices, algorithm %d\n",
7348 mdname(mddev), conf->level,
7349 mddev->raid_disks-mddev->degraded, mddev->raid_disks,
7350 mddev->new_layout);
7351
7352 print_raid5_conf(conf);
7353
7354 if (conf->reshape_progress != MaxSector) {
7355 conf->reshape_safe = conf->reshape_progress;
7356 atomic_set(&conf->reshape_stripes, 0);
7357 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery);
7358 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &mddev->recovery);
7359 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery);
7360 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery);
7361 mddev->sync_thread = md_register_thread(md_do_sync, mddev,
7362 "reshape");
7363 }
7364
7365 /* Ok, everything is just fine now */
7366 if (mddev->to_remove == &raid5_attrs_group)
7367 mddev->to_remove = NULL;
7368 else if (mddev->kobj.sd &&
7369 sysfs_create_group(&mddev->kobj, &raid5_attrs_group))
7370 pr_warn("raid5: failed to create sysfs attributes for %s\n",
7371 mdname(mddev));
7372 md_set_array_sectors(mddev, raid5_size(mddev, 0, 0));
7373
7374 if (mddev->queue) {
7375 int chunk_size;
7376 /* read-ahead size must cover two whole stripes, which
7377 * is 2 * (datadisks) * chunksize where 'n' is the
7378 * number of raid devices
7379 */
7380 int data_disks = conf->previous_raid_disks - conf->max_degraded;
7381 int stripe = data_disks *
7382 ((mddev->chunk_sectors << 9) / PAGE_SIZE);
7383 if (mddev->queue->backing_dev_info->ra_pages < 2 * stripe)
7384 mddev->queue->backing_dev_info->ra_pages = 2 * stripe;
7385
7386 chunk_size = mddev->chunk_sectors << 9;
7387 blk_queue_io_min(mddev->queue, chunk_size);
7388 blk_queue_io_opt(mddev->queue, chunk_size *
7389 (conf->raid_disks - conf->max_degraded));
7390 mddev->queue->limits.raid_partial_stripes_expensive = 1;
7391 /*
7392 * We can only discard a whole stripe. It doesn't make sense to
7393 * discard data disk but write parity disk
7394 */
7395 stripe = stripe * PAGE_SIZE;
7396 /* Round up to power of 2, as discard handling
7397 * currently assumes that */
7398 while ((stripe-1) & stripe)
7399 stripe = (stripe | (stripe-1)) + 1;
7400 mddev->queue->limits.discard_alignment = stripe;
7401 mddev->queue->limits.discard_granularity = stripe;
7402
7403 blk_queue_max_write_same_sectors(mddev->queue, 0);
7404 blk_queue_max_write_zeroes_sectors(mddev->queue, 0);
7405
7406 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
7407 disk_stack_limits(mddev->gendisk, rdev->bdev,
7408 rdev->data_offset << 9);
7409 disk_stack_limits(mddev->gendisk, rdev->bdev,
7410 rdev->new_data_offset << 9);
7411 }
7412
7413 /*
7414 * zeroing is required, otherwise data
7415 * could be lost. Consider a scenario: discard a stripe
7416 * (the stripe could be inconsistent if
7417 * discard_zeroes_data is 0); write one disk of the
7418 * stripe (the stripe could be inconsistent again
7419 * depending on which disks are used to calculate
7420 * parity); the disk is broken; The stripe data of this
7421 * disk is lost.
7422 *
7423 * We only allow DISCARD if the sysadmin has confirmed that
7424 * only safe devices are in use by setting a module parameter.
7425 * A better idea might be to turn DISCARD into WRITE_ZEROES
7426 * requests, as that is required to be safe.
7427 */
7428 if (devices_handle_discard_safely &&
7429 mddev->queue->limits.max_discard_sectors >= (stripe >> 9) &&
7430 mddev->queue->limits.discard_granularity >= stripe)
7431 queue_flag_set_unlocked(QUEUE_FLAG_DISCARD,
7432 mddev->queue);
7433 else
7434 queue_flag_clear_unlocked(QUEUE_FLAG_DISCARD,
7435 mddev->queue);
7436
7437 blk_queue_max_hw_sectors(mddev->queue, UINT_MAX);
7438 }
7439
7440 if (log_init(conf, journal_dev, raid5_has_ppl(conf)))
7441 goto abort;
7442
7443 return 0;
7444abort:
7445 md_unregister_thread(&mddev->thread);
7446 print_raid5_conf(conf);
7447 free_conf(conf);
7448 mddev->private = NULL;
7449 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: failed to run raid set.\n", mdname(mddev));
7450 return -EIO;
7451}
7452
7453static void raid5_free(struct mddev *mddev, void *priv)
7454{
7455 struct r5conf *conf = priv;
7456
7457 free_conf(conf);
7458 mddev->to_remove = &raid5_attrs_group;
7459}
7460
7461static void raid5_status(struct seq_file *seq, struct mddev *mddev)
7462{
7463 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
7464 int i;
7465
7466 seq_printf(seq, " level %d, %dk chunk, algorithm %d", mddev->level,
7467 conf->chunk_sectors / 2, mddev->layout);
7468 seq_printf (seq, " [%d/%d] [", conf->raid_disks, conf->raid_disks - mddev->degraded);
7469 rcu_read_lock();
7470 for (i = 0; i < conf->raid_disks; i++) {
7471 struct md_rdev *rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[i].rdev);
7472 seq_printf (seq, "%s", rdev && test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags) ? "U" : "_");
7473 }
7474 rcu_read_unlock();
7475 seq_printf (seq, "]");
7476}
7477
7478static void print_raid5_conf (struct r5conf *conf)
7479{
7480 int i;
7481 struct disk_info *tmp;
7482
7483 pr_debug("RAID conf printout:\n");
7484 if (!conf) {
7485 pr_debug("(conf==NULL)\n");
7486 return;
7487 }
7488 pr_debug(" --- level:%d rd:%d wd:%d\n", conf->level,
7489 conf->raid_disks,
7490 conf->raid_disks - conf->mddev->degraded);
7491
7492 for (i = 0; i < conf->raid_disks; i++) {
7493 char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
7494 tmp = conf->disks + i;
7495 if (tmp->rdev)
7496 pr_debug(" disk %d, o:%d, dev:%s\n",
7497 i, !test_bit(Faulty, &tmp->rdev->flags),
7498 bdevname(tmp->rdev->bdev, b));
7499 }
7500}
7501
7502static int raid5_spare_active(struct mddev *mddev)
7503{
7504 int i;
7505 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
7506 struct disk_info *tmp;
7507 int count = 0;
7508 unsigned long flags;
7509
7510 for (i = 0; i < conf->raid_disks; i++) {
7511 tmp = conf->disks + i;
7512 if (tmp->replacement
7513 && tmp->replacement->recovery_offset == MaxSector
7514 && !test_bit(Faulty, &tmp->replacement->flags)
7515 && !test_and_set_bit(In_sync, &tmp->replacement->flags)) {
7516 /* Replacement has just become active. */
7517 if (!tmp->rdev
7518 || !test_and_clear_bit(In_sync, &tmp->rdev->flags))
7519 count++;
7520 if (tmp->rdev) {
7521 /* Replaced device not technically faulty,
7522 * but we need to be sure it gets removed
7523 * and never re-added.
7524 */
7525 set_bit(Faulty, &tmp->rdev->flags);
7526 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(
7527 tmp->rdev->sysfs_state);
7528 }
7529 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(tmp->replacement->sysfs_state);
7530 } else if (tmp->rdev
7531 && tmp->rdev->recovery_offset == MaxSector
7532 && !test_bit(Faulty, &tmp->rdev->flags)
7533 && !test_and_set_bit(In_sync, &tmp->rdev->flags)) {
7534 count++;
7535 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(tmp->rdev->sysfs_state);
7536 }
7537 }
7538 spin_lock_irqsave(&conf->device_lock, flags);
7539 mddev->degraded = raid5_calc_degraded(conf);
7540 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&conf->device_lock, flags);
7541 print_raid5_conf(conf);
7542 return count;
7543}
7544
7545static int raid5_remove_disk(struct mddev *mddev, struct md_rdev *rdev)
7546{
7547 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
7548 int err = 0;
7549 int number = rdev->raid_disk;
7550 struct md_rdev **rdevp;
7551 struct disk_info *p = conf->disks + number;
7552
7553 print_raid5_conf(conf);
7554 if (test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags) && conf->log) {
7555 /*
7556 * we can't wait pending write here, as this is called in
7557 * raid5d, wait will deadlock.
7558 * neilb: there is no locking about new writes here,
7559 * so this cannot be safe.
7560 */
7561 if (atomic_read(&conf->active_stripes) ||
7562 atomic_read(&conf->r5c_cached_full_stripes) ||
7563 atomic_read(&conf->r5c_cached_partial_stripes)) {
7564 return -EBUSY;
7565 }
7566 log_exit(conf);
7567 return 0;
7568 }
7569 if (rdev == p->rdev)
7570 rdevp = &p->rdev;
7571 else if (rdev == p->replacement)
7572 rdevp = &p->replacement;
7573 else
7574 return 0;
7575
7576 if (number >= conf->raid_disks &&
7577 conf->reshape_progress == MaxSector)
7578 clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
7579
7580 if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags) ||
7581 atomic_read(&rdev->nr_pending)) {
7582 err = -EBUSY;
7583 goto abort;
7584 }
7585 /* Only remove non-faulty devices if recovery
7586 * isn't possible.
7587 */
7588 if (!test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags) &&
7589 mddev->recovery_disabled != conf->recovery_disabled &&
7590 !has_failed(conf) &&
7591 (!p->replacement || p->replacement == rdev) &&
7592 number < conf->raid_disks) {
7593 err = -EBUSY;
7594 goto abort;
7595 }
7596 *rdevp = NULL;
7597 if (!test_bit(RemoveSynchronized, &rdev->flags)) {
7598 synchronize_rcu();
7599 if (atomic_read(&rdev->nr_pending)) {
7600 /* lost the race, try later */
7601 err = -EBUSY;
7602 *rdevp = rdev;
7603 }
7604 }
7605 if (!err) {
7606 err = log_modify(conf, rdev, false);
7607 if (err)
7608 goto abort;
7609 }
7610 if (p->replacement) {
7611 /* We must have just cleared 'rdev' */
7612 p->rdev = p->replacement;
7613 clear_bit(Replacement, &p->replacement->flags);
7614 smp_mb(); /* Make sure other CPUs may see both as identical
7615 * but will never see neither - if they are careful
7616 */
7617 p->replacement = NULL;
7618
7619 if (!err)
7620 err = log_modify(conf, p->rdev, true);
7621 }
7622
7623 clear_bit(WantReplacement, &rdev->flags);
7624abort:
7625
7626 print_raid5_conf(conf);
7627 return err;
7628}
7629
