7630static int raid5_add_disk(struct mddev *mddev, struct md_rdev *rdev)
7631{
7632 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
7633 int err = -EEXIST;
7634 int disk;
7635 struct disk_info *p;
7636 int first = 0;
7637 int last = conf->raid_disks - 1;
7638
7639 if (test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags)) {
7640 if (conf->log)
7641 return -EBUSY;
7642
7643 rdev->raid_disk = 0;
7644 /*
7645 * The array is in readonly mode if journal is missing, so no
7646 * write requests running. We should be safe
7647 */
7648 log_init(conf, rdev, false);
7649 return 0;
7650 }
7651 if (mddev->recovery_disabled == conf->recovery_disabled)
7652 return -EBUSY;
7653
7654 if (rdev->saved_raid_disk < 0 && has_failed(conf))
7655 /* no point adding a device */
7656 return -EINVAL;
7657
7658 if (rdev->raid_disk >= 0)
7659 first = last = rdev->raid_disk;
7660
7661 /*
7662 * find the disk ... but prefer rdev->saved_raid_disk
7663 * if possible.
7664 */
7665 if (rdev->saved_raid_disk >= 0 &&
7666 rdev->saved_raid_disk >= first &&
7667 conf->disks[rdev->saved_raid_disk].rdev == NULL)
7668 first = rdev->saved_raid_disk;
7669
7670 for (disk = first; disk <= last; disk++) {
7671 p = conf->disks + disk;
7672 if (p->rdev == NULL) {
7673 clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
7674 rdev->raid_disk = disk;
7675 if (rdev->saved_raid_disk != disk)
7676 conf->fullsync = 1;
7677 rcu_assign_pointer(p->rdev, rdev);
7678
7679 err = log_modify(conf, rdev, true);
7680
7681 goto out;
7682 }
7683 }
7684 for (disk = first; disk <= last; disk++) {
7685 p = conf->disks + disk;
7686 if (test_bit(WantReplacement, &p->rdev->flags) &&
7687 p->replacement == NULL) {
7688 clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
7689 set_bit(Replacement, &rdev->flags);
7690 rdev->raid_disk = disk;
7691 err = 0;
7692 conf->fullsync = 1;
7693 rcu_assign_pointer(p->replacement, rdev);
7694 break;
7695 }
7696 }
7697out:
7698 print_raid5_conf(conf);
7699 return err;
7700}
7701
7702static int raid5_resize(struct mddev *mddev, sector_t sectors)
7703{
7704 /* no resync is happening, and there is enough space
7705 * on all devices, so we can resize.
7706 * We need to make sure resync covers any new space.
7707 * If the array is shrinking we should possibly wait until
7708 * any io in the removed space completes, but it hardly seems
7709 * worth it.
7710 */
7711 sector_t newsize;
7712 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
7713
7714 if (conf->log || raid5_has_ppl(conf))
7715 return -EINVAL;
7716 sectors &= ~((sector_t)conf->chunk_sectors - 1);
7717 newsize = raid5_size(mddev, sectors, mddev->raid_disks);
7718 if (mddev->external_size &&
7719 mddev->array_sectors > newsize)
7720 return -EINVAL;
7721 if (mddev->bitmap) {
7722 int ret = bitmap_resize(mddev->bitmap, sectors, 0, 0);
7723 if (ret)
7724 return ret;
7725 }
7726 md_set_array_sectors(mddev, newsize);
7727 if (sectors > mddev->dev_sectors &&
7728 mddev->recovery_cp > mddev->dev_sectors) {
7729 mddev->recovery_cp = mddev->dev_sectors;
7730 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
7731 }
7732 mddev->dev_sectors = sectors;
7733 mddev->resync_max_sectors = sectors;
7734 return 0;
7735}
7736
7737static int check_stripe_cache(struct mddev *mddev)
7738{
7739 /* Can only proceed if there are plenty of stripe_heads.
7740 * We need a minimum of one full stripe,, and for sensible progress
7741 * it is best to have about 4 times that.
7742 * If we require 4 times, then the default 256 4K stripe_heads will
7743 * allow for chunk sizes up to 256K, which is probably OK.
7744 * If the chunk size is greater, user-space should request more
7745 * stripe_heads first.
7746 */
7747 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
7748 if (((mddev->chunk_sectors << 9) / STRIPE_SIZE) * 4
7749 > conf->min_nr_stripes ||
7750 ((mddev->new_chunk_sectors << 9) / STRIPE_SIZE) * 4
7751 > conf->min_nr_stripes) {
7752 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: reshape: not enough stripes. Needed %lu\n",
7753 mdname(mddev),
7754 ((max(mddev->chunk_sectors, mddev->new_chunk_sectors) << 9)
7755 / STRIPE_SIZE)*4);
7756 return 0;
7757 }
7758 return 1;
7759}
7760
7761static int check_reshape(struct mddev *mddev)
7762{
7763 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
7764
7765 if (conf->log || raid5_has_ppl(conf))
7766 return -EINVAL;
7767 if (mddev->delta_disks == 0 &&
7768 mddev->new_layout == mddev->layout &&
7769 mddev->new_chunk_sectors == mddev->chunk_sectors)
7770 return 0; /* nothing to do */
7771 if (has_failed(conf))
7772 return -EINVAL;
7773 if (mddev->delta_disks < 0 && mddev->reshape_position == MaxSector) {
7774 /* We might be able to shrink, but the devices must
7775 * be made bigger first.
7776 * For raid6, 4 is the minimum size.
7777 * Otherwise 2 is the minimum
7778 */
7779 int min = 2;
7780 if (mddev->level == 6)
7781 min = 4;
7782 if (mddev->raid_disks + mddev->delta_disks < min)
7783 return -EINVAL;
7784 }
7785
7786 if (!check_stripe_cache(mddev))
7787 return -ENOSPC;
7788
7789 if (mddev->new_chunk_sectors > mddev->chunk_sectors ||
7790 mddev->delta_disks > 0)
7791 if (resize_chunks(conf,
7792 conf->previous_raid_disks
7793 + max(0, mddev->delta_disks),
7794 max(mddev->new_chunk_sectors,
7795 mddev->chunk_sectors)
7796 ) < 0)
7797 return -ENOMEM;
7798
7799 if (conf->previous_raid_disks + mddev->delta_disks <= conf->pool_size)
7800 return 0; /* never bother to shrink */
7801 return resize_stripes(conf, (conf->previous_raid_disks
7802 + mddev->delta_disks));
7803}
7804
7805static int raid5_start_reshape(struct mddev *mddev)
7806{
7807 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
7808 struct md_rdev *rdev;
7809 int spares = 0;
7810 unsigned long flags;
7811
7812 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery))
7813 return -EBUSY;
7814
7815 if (!check_stripe_cache(mddev))
7816 return -ENOSPC;
7817
7818 if (has_failed(conf))
7819 return -EINVAL;
7820
7821 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
7822 if (!test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags)
7823 && !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
7824 spares++;
7825 }
7826
7827 if (spares - mddev->degraded < mddev->delta_disks - conf->max_degraded)
7828 /* Not enough devices even to make a degraded array
7829 * of that size
7830 */
7831 return -EINVAL;
7832
7833 /* Refuse to reduce size of the array. Any reductions in
7834 * array size must be through explicit setting of array_size
7835 * attribute.
7836 */
7837 if (raid5_size(mddev, 0, conf->raid_disks + mddev->delta_disks)
7838 < mddev->array_sectors) {
7839 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: array size must be reduced before number of disks\n",
7840 mdname(mddev));
7841 return -EINVAL;
7842 }
7843
7844 atomic_set(&conf->reshape_stripes, 0);
7845 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
7846 write_seqcount_begin(&conf->gen_lock);
7847 conf->previous_raid_disks = conf->raid_disks;
7848 conf->raid_disks += mddev->delta_disks;
7849 conf->prev_chunk_sectors = conf->chunk_sectors;
7850 conf->chunk_sectors = mddev->new_chunk_sectors;
7851 conf->prev_algo = conf->algorithm;
7852 conf->algorithm = mddev->new_layout;
7853 conf->generation++;
7854 /* Code that selects data_offset needs to see the generation update
7855 * if reshape_progress has been set - so a memory barrier needed.
7856 */
7857 smp_mb();
7858 if (mddev->reshape_backwards)
7859 conf->reshape_progress = raid5_size(mddev, 0, 0);
7860 else
7861 conf->reshape_progress = 0;
7862 conf->reshape_safe = conf->reshape_progress;
7863 write_seqcount_end(&conf->gen_lock);
7864 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
7865
7866 /* Now make sure any requests that proceeded on the assumption
7867 * the reshape wasn't running - like Discard or Read - have
7868 * completed.
7869 */
7870 mddev_suspend(mddev);
7871 mddev_resume(mddev);
7872
7873 /* Add some new drives, as many as will fit.
7874 * We know there are enough to make the newly sized array work.
7875 * Don't add devices if we are reducing the number of
7876 * devices in the array. This is because it is not possible
7877 * to correctly record the "partially reconstructed" state of
7878 * such devices during the reshape and confusion could result.
7879 */
7880 if (mddev->delta_disks >= 0) {
7881 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev)
7882 if (rdev->raid_disk < 0 &&
7883 !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags)) {
7884 if (raid5_add_disk(mddev, rdev) == 0) {
7885 if (rdev->raid_disk
7886 >= conf->previous_raid_disks)
7887 set_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
7888 else
7889 rdev->recovery_offset = 0;
7890
7891 if (sysfs_link_rdev(mddev, rdev))
7892 /* Failure here is OK */;
7893 }
7894 } else if (rdev->raid_disk >= conf->previous_raid_disks
7895 && !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags)) {
7896 /* This is a spare that was manually added */
7897 set_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
7898 }
7899
7900 /* When a reshape changes the number of devices,
7901 * ->degraded is measured against the larger of the
7902 * pre and post number of devices.
7903 */
7904 spin_lock_irqsave(&conf->device_lock, flags);
7905 mddev->degraded = raid5_calc_degraded(conf);
7906 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&conf->device_lock, flags);
7907 }
7908 mddev->raid_disks = conf->raid_disks;
7909 mddev->reshape_position = conf->reshape_progress;
7910 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags);
7911
7912 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery);
7913 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &mddev->recovery);
7914 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_DONE, &mddev->recovery);
7915 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery);
7916 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery);
7917 mddev->sync_thread = md_register_thread(md_do_sync, mddev,
7918 "reshape");
7919 if (!mddev->sync_thread) {
7920 mddev->recovery = 0;
7921 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
7922 write_seqcount_begin(&conf->gen_lock);
7923 mddev->raid_disks = conf->raid_disks = conf->previous_raid_disks;
7924 mddev->new_chunk_sectors =
7925 conf->chunk_sectors = conf->prev_chunk_sectors;
7926 mddev->new_layout = conf->algorithm = conf->prev_algo;
7927 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev)
7928 rdev->new_data_offset = rdev->data_offset;
7929 smp_wmb();
7930 conf->generation --;
7931 conf->reshape_progress = MaxSector;
7932 mddev->reshape_position = MaxSector;
7933 write_seqcount_end(&conf->gen_lock);
7934 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
7935 return -EAGAIN;
7936 }
7937 conf->reshape_checkpoint = jiffies;
7938 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->sync_thread);
7939 md_new_event(mddev);
7940 return 0;
7941}
7942
7943/* This is called from the reshape thread and should make any
7944 * changes needed in 'conf'
7945 */
7946static void end_reshape(struct r5conf *conf)
7947{
7948
7949 if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &conf->mddev->recovery)) {
7950
7951 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
7952 conf->previous_raid_disks = conf->raid_disks;
7953 md_finish_reshape(conf->mddev);
7954 smp_wmb();
7955 conf->reshape_progress = MaxSector;
7956 conf->mddev->reshape_position = MaxSector;
7957 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
7958 wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
7959
7960 /* read-ahead size must cover two whole stripes, which is
7961 * 2 * (datadisks) * chunksize where 'n' is the number of raid devices
7962 */
7963 if (conf->mddev->queue) {
7964 int data_disks = conf->raid_disks - conf->max_degraded;
7965 int stripe = data_disks * ((conf->chunk_sectors << 9)
7966 / PAGE_SIZE);
7967 if (conf->mddev->queue->backing_dev_info->ra_pages < 2 * stripe)
7968 conf->mddev->queue->backing_dev_info->ra_pages = 2 * stripe;
7969 }
7970 }
7971}
7972
7973/* This is called from the raid5d thread with mddev_lock held.
7974 * It makes config changes to the device.
7975 */
7976static void raid5_finish_reshape(struct mddev *mddev)
7977{
7978 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
7979
7980 if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery)) {
7981
7982 if (mddev->delta_disks <= 0) {
7983 int d;
7984 spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
7985 mddev->degraded = raid5_calc_degraded(conf);
7986 spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
7987 for (d = conf->raid_disks ;
7988 d < conf->raid_disks - mddev->delta_disks;
7989 d++) {
7990 struct md_rdev *rdev = conf->disks[d].rdev;
7991 if (rdev)
7992 clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
7993 rdev = conf->disks[d].replacement;
7994 if (rdev)
7995 clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
7996 }
7997 }
7998 mddev->layout = conf->algorithm;
7999 mddev->chunk_sectors = conf->chunk_sectors;
8000 mddev->reshape_position = MaxSector;
8001 mddev->delta_disks = 0;
8002 mddev->reshape_backwards = 0;
8003 }
8004}
8005
8006static void raid5_quiesce(struct mddev *mddev, int quiesce)
8007{
8008 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
8009
8010 if (quiesce) {
8011 /* stop all writes */
8012 lock_all_device_hash_locks_irq(conf);
8013 /* '2' tells resync/reshape to pause so that all
8014 * active stripes can drain
8015 */
8016 r5c_flush_cache(conf, INT_MAX);
8017 conf->quiesce = 2;
8018 wait_event_cmd(conf->wait_for_quiescent,
8019 atomic_read(&conf->active_stripes) == 0 &&
8020 atomic_read(&conf->active_aligned_reads) == 0,
8021 unlock_all_device_hash_locks_irq(conf),
8022 lock_all_device_hash_locks_irq(conf));
8023 conf->quiesce = 1;
8024 unlock_all_device_hash_locks_irq(conf);
8025 /* allow reshape to continue */
8026 wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
8027 } else {
8028 /* re-enable writes */
8029 lock_all_device_hash_locks_irq(conf);
8030 conf->quiesce = 0;
8031 wake_up(&conf->wait_for_quiescent);
8032 wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
8033 unlock_all_device_hash_locks_irq(conf);
8034 }
8035 r5l_quiesce(conf->log, quiesce);
8036}
8037
8038static void *raid45_takeover_raid0(struct mddev *mddev, int level)
8039{
8040 struct r0conf *raid0_conf = mddev->private;
8041 sector_t sectors;
8042
8043 /* for raid0 takeover only one zone is supported */
8044 if (raid0_conf->nr_strip_zones > 1) {
8045 pr_warn("md/raid:%s: cannot takeover raid0 with more than one zone.\n",
8046 mdname(mddev));
8047 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
8048 }
8049
8050 sectors = raid0_conf->strip_zone[0].zone_end;
8051 sector_div(sectors, raid0_conf->strip_zone[0].nb_dev);
8052 mddev->dev_sectors = sectors;
8053 mddev->new_level = level;
8054 mddev->new_layout = ALGORITHM_PARITY_N;
8055 mddev->new_chunk_sectors = mddev->chunk_sectors;
8056 mddev->raid_disks += 1;
8057 mddev->delta_disks = 1;
8058 /* make sure it will be not marked as dirty */
8059 mddev->recovery_cp = MaxSector;
8060
8061 return setup_conf(mddev);
8062}
8063
8064static void *raid5_takeover_raid1(struct mddev *mddev)
8065{
8066 int chunksect;
8067 void *ret;
8068
8069 if (mddev->raid_disks != 2 ||
8070 mddev->degraded > 1)
8071 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
8072
8073 /* Should check if there are write-behind devices? */
8074
8075 chunksect = 64*2; /* 64K by default */
8076
8077 /* The array must be an exact multiple of chunksize */
8078 while (chunksect && (mddev->array_sectors & (chunksect-1)))
8079 chunksect >>= 1;
8080
8081 if ((chunksect<<9) < STRIPE_SIZE)
8082 /* array size does not allow a suitable chunk size */
8083 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
8084
8085 mddev->new_level = 5;
8086 mddev->new_layout = ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC;
8087 mddev->new_chunk_sectors = chunksect;
8088
8089 ret = setup_conf(mddev);
8090 if (!IS_ERR(ret))
8091 mddev_clear_unsupported_flags(mddev,
8092 UNSUPPORTED_MDDEV_FLAGS);
8093 return ret;
8094}
8095
8096static void *raid5_takeover_raid6(struct mddev *mddev)
8097{
8098 int new_layout;
8099
8100 switch (mddev->layout) {
8101 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
8102 new_layout = ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC;
8103 break;
8104 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
8105 new_layout = ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC;
8106 break;
8107 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC_6:
8108 new_layout = ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC;
8109 break;
8110 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC_6:
8111 new_layout = ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC;
8112 break;
8113 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0_6:
8114 new_layout = ALGORITHM_PARITY_0;
8115 break;
8116 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_N:
8117 new_layout = ALGORITHM_PARITY_N;
8118 break;
8119 default:
8120 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
8121 }
8122 mddev->new_level = 5;
8123 mddev->new_layout = new_layout;
8124 mddev->delta_disks = -1;
8125 mddev->raid_disks -= 1;
8126 return setup_conf(mddev);
8127}
8128
8129static int raid5_check_reshape(struct mddev *mddev)
8130{
8131 /* For a 2-drive array, the layout and chunk size can be changed
8132 * immediately as not restriping is needed.
8133 * For larger arrays we record the new value - after validation
8134 * to be used by a reshape pass.
8135 */
8136 struct r5conf *conf = mddev->private;
8137 int new_chunk = mddev->new_chunk_sectors;
8138
8139 if (mddev->new_layout >= 0 && !algorithm_valid_raid5(mddev->new_layout))
8140 return -EINVAL;
8141 if (new_chunk > 0) {
8142 if (!is_power_of_2(new_chunk))
8143 return -EINVAL;
8144 if (new_chunk < (PAGE_SIZE>>9))
8145 return -EINVAL;
8146 if (mddev->array_sectors & (new_chunk-1))
8147 /* not factor of array size */
8148 return -EINVAL;
8149 }
8150
8151 /* They look valid */
8152
8153 if (mddev->raid_disks == 2) {
8154 /* can make the change immediately */
8155 if (mddev->new_layout >= 0) {
8156 conf->algorithm = mddev->new_layout;
8157 mddev->layout = mddev->new_layout;
8158 }
8159 if (new_chunk > 0) {
8160 conf->chunk_sectors = new_chunk ;
8161 mddev->chunk_sectors = new_chunk;
8162 }
8163 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags);
8164 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
8165 }
8166 return check_reshape(mddev);
8167}
8168
8169static int raid6_check_reshape(struct mddev *mddev)
8170{
8171 int new_chunk = mddev->new_chunk_sectors;
8172
8173 if (mddev->new_layout >= 0 && !algorithm_valid_raid6(mddev->new_layout))
8174 return -EINVAL;
8175 if (new_chunk > 0) {
8176 if (!is_power_of_2(new_chunk))
8177 return -EINVAL;
8178 if (new_chunk < (PAGE_SIZE >> 9))
8179 return -EINVAL;
8180 if (mddev->array_sectors & (new_chunk-1))
8181 /* not factor of array size */
8182 return -EINVAL;
8183 }
8184
8185 /* They look valid */
8186 return check_reshape(mddev);
8187}
8188
8189static void *raid5_takeover(struct mddev *mddev)
8190{
8191 /* raid5 can take over:
8192 * raid0 - if there is only one strip zone - make it a raid4 layout
8193 * raid1 - if there are two drives. We need to know the chunk size
8194 * raid4 - trivial - just use a raid4 layout.
8195 * raid6 - Providing it is a *_6 layout
8196 */
8197 if (mddev->level == 0)
8198 return raid45_takeover_raid0(mddev, 5);
8199 if (mddev->level == 1)
8200 return raid5_takeover_raid1(mddev);
8201 if (mddev->level == 4) {
8202 mddev->new_layout = ALGORITHM_PARITY_N;
8203 mddev->new_level = 5;
8204 return setup_conf(mddev);
8205 }
8206 if (mddev->level == 6)
8207 return raid5_takeover_raid6(mddev);
8208
8209 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
8210}
8211
8212static void *raid4_takeover(struct mddev *mddev)
8213{
8214 /* raid4 can take over:
8215 * raid0 - if there is only one strip zone
8216 * raid5 - if layout is right
8217 */
8218 if (mddev->level == 0)
8219 return raid45_takeover_raid0(mddev, 4);
8220 if (mddev->level == 5 &&
8221 mddev->layout == ALGORITHM_PARITY_N) {
8222 mddev->new_layout = 0;
8223 mddev->new_level = 4;
8224 return setup_conf(mddev);
8225 }
8226 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
8227}
8228
8229static struct md_personality raid5_personality;
8230
8231static void *raid6_takeover(struct mddev *mddev)
8232{
8233 /* Currently can only take over a raid5. We map the
8234 * personality to an equivalent raid6 personality
8235 * with the Q block at the end.
8236 */
8237 int new_layout;
8238
8239 if (mddev->pers != &raid5_personality)
8240 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
8241 if (mddev->degraded > 1)
8242 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
8243 if (mddev->raid_disks > 253)
8244 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
8245 if (mddev->raid_disks < 3)
8246 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
8247
8248 switch (mddev->layout) {
8249 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC:
8250 new_layout = ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC_6;
8251 break;
8252 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC:
8253 new_layout = ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC_6;
8254 break;
8255 case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC:
8256 new_layout = ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC_6;
8257 break;
8258 case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC:
8259 new_layout = ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC_6;
8260 break;
8261 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0:
8262 new_layout = ALGORITHM_PARITY_0_6;
8263 break;
8264 case ALGORITHM_PARITY_N:
8265 new_layout = ALGORITHM_PARITY_N;
8266 break;
8267 default:
8268 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
8269 }
8270 mddev->new_level = 6;
8271 mddev->new_layout = new_layout;
8272 mddev->delta_disks = 1;
8273 mddev->raid_disks += 1;
8274 return setup_conf(mddev);
8275}
8276
8277static int raid5_change_consistency_policy(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf)
8278{
8279 struct r5conf *conf;
8280 int err;
8281
8282 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
8283 if (err)
8284 return err;
8285 conf = mddev->private;
8286 if (!conf) {
8287 mddev_unlock(mddev);
8288 return -ENODEV;
8289 }
8290
8291 if (strncmp(buf, "ppl", 3) == 0) {
8292 /* ppl only works with RAID 5 */
8293 if (!raid5_has_ppl(conf) && conf->level == 5) {
8294 err = log_init(conf, NULL, true);
8295 if (!err) {
8296 err = resize_stripes(conf, conf->pool_size);
8297 if (err)
8298 log_exit(conf);
8299 }
8300 } else
8301 err = -EINVAL;
8302 } else if (strncmp(buf, "resync", 6) == 0) {
8303 if (raid5_has_ppl(conf)) {
8304 mddev_suspend(mddev);
8305 log_exit(conf);
8306 mddev_resume(mddev);
8307 err = resize_stripes(conf, conf->pool_size);
8308 } else if (test_bit(MD_HAS_JOURNAL, &conf->mddev->flags) &&
8309 r5l_log_disk_error(conf)) {
8310 bool journal_dev_exists = false;
8311 struct md_rdev *rdev;
8312
8313 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev)
8314 if (test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags)) {
8315 journal_dev_exists = true;
8316 break;
8317 }
8318
8319 if (!journal_dev_exists) {
8320 mddev_suspend(mddev);
8321 clear_bit(MD_HAS_JOURNAL, &mddev->flags);
8322 mddev_resume(mddev);
8323 } else /* need remove journal device first */
8324 err = -EBUSY;
8325 } else
8326 err = -EINVAL;
8327 } else {
8328 err = -EINVAL;
8329 }
8330
8331 if (!err)
8332 md_update_sb(mddev, 1);
8333
8334 mddev_unlock(mddev);
8335
8336 return err;
8337}
8338
8339static struct md_personality raid6_personality =
8340{
8341 .name = "raid6",
8342 .level = 6,
8343 .owner = THIS_MODULE,
8344 .make_request = raid5_make_request,
8345 .run = raid5_run,
8346 .free = raid5_free,
8347 .status = raid5_status,
8348 .error_handler = raid5_error,
8349 .hot_add_disk = raid5_add_disk,
8350 .hot_remove_disk= raid5_remove_disk,
8351 .spare_active = raid5_spare_active,
8352 .sync_request = raid5_sync_request,
8353 .resize = raid5_resize,
8354 .size = raid5_size,
8355 .check_reshape = raid6_check_reshape,
8356 .start_reshape = raid5_start_reshape,
8357 .finish_reshape = raid5_finish_reshape,
8358 .quiesce = raid5_quiesce,
8359 .takeover = raid6_takeover,
8360 .congested = raid5_congested,
8361 .change_consistency_policy = raid5_change_consistency_policy,
8362};
8363static struct md_personality raid5_personality =
8364{
8365 .name = "raid5",
8366 .level = 5,
8367 .owner = THIS_MODULE,
8368 .make_request = raid5_make_request,
8369 .run = raid5_run,
8370 .free = raid5_free,
8371 .status = raid5_status,
8372 .error_handler = raid5_error,
8373 .hot_add_disk = raid5_add_disk,
8374 .hot_remove_disk= raid5_remove_disk,
8375 .spare_active = raid5_spare_active,
8376 .sync_request = raid5_sync_request,
8377 .resize = raid5_resize,
8378 .size = raid5_size,
8379 .check_reshape = raid5_check_reshape,
8380 .start_reshape = raid5_start_reshape,
8381 .finish_reshape = raid5_finish_reshape,
8382 .quiesce = raid5_quiesce,
8383 .takeover = raid5_takeover,
8384 .congested = raid5_congested,
8385 .change_consistency_policy = raid5_change_consistency_policy,
8386};
8387
8388static struct md_personality raid4_personality =
8389{
8390 .name = "raid4",
8391 .level = 4,
8392 .owner = THIS_MODULE,
8393 .make_request = raid5_make_request,
8394 .run = raid5_run,
8395 .free = raid5_free,
8396 .status = raid5_status,
8397 .error_handler = raid5_error,
8398 .hot_add_disk = raid5_add_disk,
8399 .hot_remove_disk= raid5_remove_disk,
8400 .spare_active = raid5_spare_active,
8401 .sync_request = raid5_sync_request,
8402 .resize = raid5_resize,
8403 .size = raid5_size,
8404 .check_reshape = raid5_check_reshape,
8405 .start_reshape = raid5_start_reshape,
8406 .finish_reshape = raid5_finish_reshape,
8407 .quiesce = raid5_quiesce,
8408 .takeover = raid4_takeover,
8409 .congested = raid5_congested,
8410 .change_consistency_policy = raid5_change_consistency_policy,
8411};
8412
8413static int __init raid5_init(void)
8414{
8415 int ret;
8416
8417 raid5_wq = alloc_workqueue("raid5wq",
8418 WQ_UNBOUND|WQ_MEM_RECLAIM|WQ_CPU_INTENSIVE|WQ_SYSFS, 0);
8419 if (!raid5_wq)
8420 return -ENOMEM;
8421
8422 ret = cpuhp_setup_state_multi(CPUHP_MD_RAID5_PREPARE,
8423 "md/raid5:prepare",
8424 raid456_cpu_up_prepare,
8425 raid456_cpu_dead);
8426 if (ret) {
8427 destroy_workqueue(raid5_wq);
8428 return ret;
8429 }
8430 register_md_personality(&raid6_personality);
8431 register_md_personality(&raid5_personality);
8432 register_md_personality(&raid4_personality);
8433 return 0;
8434}
8435
8436static void raid5_exit(void)
8437{
8438 unregister_md_personality(&raid6_personality);
8439 unregister_md_personality(&raid5_personality);
8440 unregister_md_personality(&raid4_personality);
8441 cpuhp_remove_multi_state(CPUHP_MD_RAID5_PREPARE);
8442 destroy_workqueue(raid5_wq);
8443}
8444
8445module_init(raid5_init);
8446module_exit(raid5_exit);
8447MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
8448MODULE_DESCRIPTION("RAID4/5/6 (striping with parity) personality for MD");
8449MODULE_ALIAS("md-personality-4"); /* RAID5 */
8450MODULE_ALIAS("md-raid5");
8451MODULE_ALIAS("md-raid4");
8452MODULE_ALIAS("md-level-5");
8453MODULE_ALIAS("md-level-4");
8454MODULE_ALIAS("md-personality-8"); /* RAID6 */
8455MODULE_ALIAS("md-raid6");
8456MODULE_ALIAS("md-level-6");
8457
8458/* This used to be two separate modules, they were: */
8459MODULE_ALIAS("raid5");
8460MODULE_ALIAS("raid6");
8461
